story:
GameGuard

GameGuard is an application that monitor's how long your children play's games on the computer and shut's the games down once the timer has reached zero.

This Application builds on principles of safe environments for children that play videogames and makes the child able to still use applications such as Paint, Word, Spreadsheet software and so on this means that homework is not an issue - Games will not be able to start once the timer reaches 0.

Why is this important?

other software like this closes the computer down until the next day.

this does not!. This allows for your child to still develop skills with the computer, like creative software or homework, which is done more and more on the computer. It's hard for a child to focus, when computergames are in near sight.

this software counts down whenever a game is open, and stops the timer whenever a game is closed, so there is time for breaks and so on.

its important for children to have restrictions especially on computergames, aged restricted material for instance. but also on the time spent playing mindless video games. it can be hard for a parent to keep track of time and to keep an eye on the child whilst making dinner, being in the garden or grocery shopping, with gameguard, this is not a problem!

I aim to create an application, that can manage time playing videogames, manage aged restricted materiel (through esrb ratings) and maybe make parents a little less stressed in their daily habits.

Why indiegogo?

This funding will provide funds for development of this software, the beta is already in full scale testing.

This software will be free in the future, if i meet my goal.

ive spent somewhat 100 hours on development so far and there's atleast 100 more hours to go till final release

 

... more to come

story:
Hi! We are Imbue Games and we are here to raise money for the development of a new game and to hire a much needed artist.

 

The idea behind this game is an instanced multiplayer turn based rpg that is focused on creating a unique story for your character while sharing achievements and dangerous missions with or against your friends.

The focus point is to create a character to play whilst building a legend around him or her.

Actions will have an effect on your journey as you play. For example, if you kill a noble, his son might hunt you down later, or perhaps you might save an old man, only to find out he can help you with a mission far later.


Richard H aka FUED.

Coding since 1997, FUED has been creating games since the original klik'n'play was released. His interest in making games progressed from a hobby to professional status recently. With six years of commercial coding experience he finally took the plunge to create the games of his dreams.

Johnny H aka SUSHI

SUSHI is a designer for imbue games. Ventura saga was designed by FUED so he took on a position of "jack of all trades" working on the lore and story of the game as well as the characters mechanics and world concept. His passion stems from the memories of the magic he felt when first playing great games.

At the moment the game is at the Alpha stage.

The dynamic mission scheme can generate hundreds of missions. But the number of paths of these missions is only about one path every two missions when we would like it to be two paths or more per missions, which would involve a considerable time investment.

We also are desperate to hire a dedicated artist capable of making polished game art and assets for the next six months. We want, with your generous help, to give you an exciting and original game !

Early Adopter: $10

A Preorder version of the game, able to play as soon as closed beta is released.

Supporter: $20

A Copy of the game, as well as minor cosmetic upgrades valued at $20 for a player to unlock.

Fancy Pants Edition: $30

The game, cosmetic upgrades, and a Icon for the forums/in game that is unique.

Sushi's Magical Pack: $40 

The game, cosmetic upgrades, and a collection of unique icons for both in game and forums.

Deluxe Edition: $65

The game, some classes unlocked within the game, letting you get straight to the class you wish to use. Also a unique longsword skin that is visible in game.

Physical Edition: $100

The game on dvd, a physical box containing the game and artwork from the game on it, A printed version of the game manual, A world map, A quick reference guide and a personal note of thanks.

Ultimate Supporter: $250

The game, with some classes unlocked at the beggining. As well as the ability to design an NPC which a lot of players will meet in thier travels through the game.

Amazing Support: $500

The game, access to alpha builds, and contribution from the start on how development will proceed, and absolutely everything in game unlocked.

Dedicated Support: $1000

The game, Everything unlocked, access to alpha builds, and a completely unique skin designed for your character.

Power Level Pack: $9001

The game, and access to developers skype, as well as being included as an equal part of the team to help steer development in any way you wish.


Previous projects include;

http://imbuegames.com/Games.aspx


Aquablocks, a puzzle game for iphone/android

Necropolis, a top down rpg for pc/iphone/android

story:
A schoolteacher wakes to find his entire life is missing from public record.  His bank account, his health care, his credit cards are all frozen when the government declares him to be a non-person.  As he takes the steps necessary to pull his life back together, he becomes aware of nefarious forces that have conspired against him.  The truth, it seems, is rarely pure and never simple.

Conspirocracy starts in an exaggerated, highly-bureaucratic re-imagining of Toronto, Canada.  Medical droids serve as gatekeepers between patients and doctors.  The activities of beggars and buskers are regulated and tasked.  Airport security is taken to an more extreme, disconcerting level.  As the player, you will have your work cut out for you finding what you're looking for when the system is stacked heavily against you.

This game is already in beta-testing, and a launch date is anticipated for mid-November.

If, and only if, you love us enough that we are able to hit our $5000 target, we're going to celebrate together by adding a whole selection of possible epilogues to the game based on the choices you have made previously.  It'll be like Fallout, only you don't need to worry about your faithful dog running into a super-mutant army (unless that's the ending you choose).  You'll want to play again and again to see the different ways the story can play out!




  • A complete story with a large cast of voiced characters, challenging puzzles and lots to see and do.
  • Unlockable achievements for players who discover the many easter-eggs hidden within.
  • A "stress" management system.  Our hero has a weak heart and too many stressful incidents will elevate his blood pressure with dire consequences.  As you explore, you will need to find ways to relax and keep from losing your temper.
  • Our hero carries a cellphone and a tablet with him wherever he goes.  From any point in the game you can peruse a selection of apps that you have installed.
  • A dynamic hint-system that, if activated, will provide a nudge in the right direction when players get a little stuck.
  • Two different endings (with rumours of a secret third-ending for the dedicated explorer) based on two different perspectives you may have about the events surrounding the loss of your identity.

Conspirocracy was written for a mature audience.  It features only the mildest of profanity, no sexual content and some violence.

(Sample gameplay video)


At this time, we can only guarantee that Conspirocracy will be released for the PC, but we note that work has already begun on developing a Mac-friendly port.

This is going to be a whole lot easier if we can bring in some support.



By supporting our project, you are not only getting a game, but half of the proceeds raised here for this limited time initiative will be in support of the Foundation Fighting Blindness.

For almost 40 years, the Foundation Fighting Blindness has funded dozens of research discoveries to identify the causes of genetic forms of blindness.  These discoveries have helped bring scientists to this very exciting time in vision research.  Today marks the first time that a treatment exists to prevent vision loss and restore some vision for those with an eye disease called 'wet' age-related macular degeneration (AMD) - and the first time human trials exist to reverse blindness in certain patients with retinitis pigmentosa (RP). 

To reaffirm, we live in an age where restoring sight to the blind is a real possibility!

And what of the other half of your donation?  This project was paid for largely out of our own pockets and if we hit our target, we can safely say we've broken even.  Everything above our target will help us launch a larger and more ambitious adventure game, again for charity.  If you're wondering where exactly your money is going to go, the following reference chart will be of use.

If you've come this far, but aren't able to contribute to the campaign with a donation, we hope that you will share awareness about what we're doing here with your friends on Facebook and Twitter to help spread the word!

We've pulled together the following sponsorship options for you to choose from!


Receive a digital copy of the game.  You've just donated $5 to the FFB!


Receive a digital copy of the game, and the official 22-song soundtrack.  You just donated $7.50 to the FFB!


Receive the special-edition of the game and official soundtrack on a disk, complete with box and art.  We might even throw in some extras ;-) 

Hey, you just donated $20 to the FFB!


Receive the special-edition of the game and official soundtrack on a disk, complete with box and a detailed 11 x 17" poster of the box art that you can mount on your wall to announce to the world how awesome you are.

You've generously donated $30 to the FFB!


Receive the special-edition of the game and official soundtrack on a disk, complete with box and a beautiful 11 x 17" poster, a behind-the-scenes book detailing the work that went into the game and have your name featured in the credits. 

Wow, you just donated $50 to the FFB!


You get all that great stuff those donors above got, but more importantly, you get your likeness included into the game as a background character with spoken lines!

You just gave $100 to the FFB!  Thank you so much!

You get everything above, but instead of a background character, you will have a statue detailing your name and your accomplishments as a bureaucrat featured in-game.  The main character will read your story, as it appears on a plaque.

You just gave $200 to the FFB!  Thank you so much!



On behalf of our team, and of the Foundation Fighting Blindness, thank you for believing in us and our project!

story:
Our Story

Kinky Island was born from the love of classic adventure games like Monkey Island, Day of the Tentacle, Flight of the Amazon Queen and Teen Agent. The game began its life as a freeware project (and just a joke) but now development is back on after continued interest in the project from fans. A demo was released in 2006 and at that time the project required new talent to help make it happen. By 2011 we had a brand new team formed and since then many of the games assets have been in production thanks to the hardwork and dedication of the team members who wanted to see the game exist. The game is aimed at mature players who are 18+ as it features nudity, bad langauge and other adult themes !

 

The project has come a long way since 2006 - now we have all new gorgeous looking art and heaps of animation. The game features:

» Over 30 interactive hand-drawn rooms thanks to Micheal Cross

» Over 20 fully animated characters thanks to Luke Rideout

» Comic writing & music by Mark Lovegrove

» Fun puzzles & classic adventure gameplay thanks to James Spanos

 

Screen 7 have been developing games for free since 1997 and working on other peoples projects. Over 2012 and the following years, we hope to finally bring Screen 7 up to commercial standard and become a proper games studio. We have plenty of projects in the pipeline that will please all fans of retro adventure games - your contribution to this project will help us deliver even more in the future!

 

Mark Lovegrove, project leader, has been involved with many games projects usually as music composer. His previous work includes music for Yahtzee Croshaw games Trilby's Notes and Trilby: The Art of Theft, and popular freeware adventure games Nelly Cootalot: Spoonbeaks Ahoy and Chance Of The Dead. He is currently music producer for a new Yahtzee game and composer for A Night At Camp Ravenwood. Some of his favorite retro adventure games are Fate of Atlantis, Flight of the Amazon Queen, The Dig and Day of the Tentacle.

More about Mark: http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/d...

 

Luke Rideout is an exceptional pixel artist and runs his own games studio. He saw the potential in Kinky Island and has helped us to bring it to the level of quality it is at now.

More about Luke: http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/d...

 

Micheal Cross has recently stirred the retro adventure game scene with his project A Night At Camp Ravenwood, which some are likening to the look and feel of Monkey Island. Seriously, go and Google it - you won't be dissapointed! Micheal is creating wonderful retro looking backgrounds, heavily inspired by Amazon Queen.

 

James (Jim) Spanos our programmer is a well known AGS programmer and runs the AGS Blog.

More about James: http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/d...

 

Our other team members Misja "miez" van Laatum and Paul "subspark" Wilkinson are on hand for various aspects of production.

 

The Impact

By funding Kinky Island means this game can finally see the light of day. It also gives you the chance to pre-order and get a copy for yourself before the public. The game will usually cost around £8.99 ($14). Depending on your level of contribution, you can play the beta and even have a character based on yourself in the game. How much is currently done?

 

Story - 90%

Background art - 40%

Character art - 25%

Music - 10%

Coding - 5%

 

Hundreds of man-hours will have been poured into the game on completion. We thought carefully about making it free or gaining some renumeration.

 

With your help the game can be finished and on-sale by Christmas 2012 !!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for funding in the region of $2000, to help us with the following:

500 will help:

» Website, we need funds to cover our server costs and design a funky new website

» Jewel case editions, we'd like to spend some of the funds making some boxed editions to sell

1000 will help:

» Talkie options, the more we raise, the more likely a voice pack will beincluded

» SVN, help us cover the costs of the place we store all our files

1500+ will help:

» Development costs, the cost of having someone program it fully, artwork costs and time

» Team payments, helping those spending days of their lives making it eat & drink

» All excess funds will go to the forming of Screen 7 as a games studio

 

CHECK OUT THE PERKS LIST (on the right) TO SEE WHAT YOU'LL GET IN RETURN FOR KINDLY HELPING US OUT!!

 

Play the 2006 demo

You can download & play the old 2006 demo for free here:

http://www.screen7.co.uk/games/ki

 

Further info about the game can be found here:

http://www.screen7.co.uk/games/game_kinkyisland...

story:
Polskojęzyczna wersja poniżej! Polish verson below!

Turtle Stampie - the mobile game!

Hi, my name is Matthew and I am forunder and programmer from Cintul Apps studio. We introduce a new project named Turtle Stampie, is a mobile game for Android & iOS platforms. You must rotate the screen by touching sides of the screen, next you must collect all of the shamans to reach next level, after 20 levels (from one of level pack) you can go to another "pack" of 25 levels with a different graphic! In the final version there will be a 100 levels, each of the 25 levels will be with new graphic theme and another enemies! On the video you can see an alpha 0.1 ver of Turtle Stampie. With Your help we can finish that project, publish it and go to another... but the second project is a secret now!

Some informations about me - I am 16 years old schoolboy living in Wroclaw, Poland. I've programming for couple of months - this game was created by me for four months. I started from "Hello world!" script, and through these months I made Turtle Stampie. Now I want to go forward, but I can't do it myself, because I do not earn any money due to my age, so I asked my dad for help in creation of this substdy campain.

The money, that we will get will be used to:

  • buy a Development Enviroment License
  • Android Developer License
  • Apple iOS Developer License
  • buy 1 tablet
  • buy 1 smartphone
  • register our names - "Turtle Stampie" & "Cintul Apps"

We can not run without Your help, if you want to help us - donate us! :)

After claim the perk mail me at: cintulek@me.com, because indiegogo doesn't give me your mail. ;)

Turtle Stampie - gra mobilna!

Witajcie, mam na imię Mateusz i jestem założycielem, jak i programistą w studiu Cintul Apps. Właśnie wdrażamy nowy projekt o nazwie Turtle Stampie, czyli - żółwik Stampie (czyt. Stampi), gra wydana będzie na systemy Android oraz iOS. W grze poruszamy się wcześniej wspomnianym żółwikiem, przekręcamy ekran poprzez naciskanie na lewą, bądź prawą stronę ekranu, musimy zebrać wszystkich szamanów, by przejść do następnego poziomu. Po przejściu 20 poziomów zostaje odblokowana nowa "paczka" poziomów, w której to znajduje się takowych 25, w każdej takiej "paczce" (a będzie ich cztery) zostanie zmieniony całkowicie styl graficzny, pojawią się inni przeciwnicy, lecz to dopiero w finalnej wersji - na filmiku została pokazana wersja alpha. Z Twoją pomocą możemy skończyć ten projekt, opublikować go i zająć się kolejnym, który już powoli realizujemy... ale to jest jeszcze sekretem!

Pare informacji o mnie - jestem 16 letnim uczniem Technikum Informatycznego we Wrocławiu. Programuję od paru miesięcy, tą grę stworzyłem w ciągu czterech, a zaczynałem od zwykłego programu "Witaj świecie", przez te miesiące powstał właśnie Stampie. Teraz chcę iść dalej, ale sam tego zrobić nie mogę, gdyż nie generuję zbyt dużo pieniędzy ze wzglęu na mój wiek, a więc poprosiłem tatę o pomoc w stworzeniu tej kampanii dotacyjnej.

Pieniądze, które tutaj uzyskam zostaną przeznaczone na:

  • kupno licencji Developerskiej do środowiska programistycznego
  • licencję Android Developer
  • licencję Apple iOS Developer
  • kupno 1 tablet'a
  • kupno 1 smartphone'a
  • zarejestrowanie i zastrzeżenie nazw - "Turtle Stampie" oraz "Cintul Apps"

Nie możemy ruszyć bez Twojej  pomocy, jeżeli chcesz nam pomóc - przekaż darowiznę!

Po wybraniu któregoś z profitów proszę o kontakt mailowy na adres: cintulek@me.com, gdyż indiegogo nie udostępnia mi takich danych.
story_txt:
Polskojęzyczna wersja poniżej! Polish verson below!
Turtle Stampie - the mobile game!
Hi, my name is Matthew and I am forunder and programmer from Cintul Apps studio. We introduce a new project named Turtle Stampie, is a mobile game for Android & iOS platforms. You must rotate the screen by touching sides of the screen, next you must collect all of the shamans to reach next level, after 20 levels (from one of level pack) you can go to another "pack" of 25 levels with a different graphic! In the final version there will be a 100 levels, each of the 25 levels will be with new graphic theme and another enemies! On the video you can see an alpha 0.1 ver of Turtle Stampie. With Your help we can finish that project, publish it and go to another... but the second project is a secret now!
Some informations about me - I am 16 years old schoolboy living in Wroclaw, Poland. I've programming for couple of months - this game was created by me for four months. I started from "Hello world!" script, and through these months I made Turtle Stampie. Now I want to go forward, but I can't do it myself, because I do not earn any money due to my age, so I asked my dad for help in creation of this substdy campain.
The money, that we will get will be used to:

buy a Development Enviroment License
Android Developer License
Apple iOS Developer License
buy 1 tablet
buy 1 smartphone
register our names - "Turtle Stampie" & "Cintul Apps"
We can not run without Your help, if you want to help us - donate us! :)
After claim the perk mail me at: cintulek@me.com, because indiegogo doesn't give me your mail. ;)

story:
Short Summary

Want to play video games, win great prizes AND do something amazing for charity? Then read on! 

1 gamer, 1 video game developer and 1 video game arcade are all working together to bring you a HUGE Dead or Alive 5 tournament in London as well as some online tournaments to win some great prizes including cash and DLC for the game itself! And have fun at a videogame arcade while you're at it!

What We Need & What You Get

On October 17th & 18th we’ll have a Dead or Alive 5 Last Round tournament here in London. It will be £20 to get into the venue for BOTH days, so you pay £20 for the Saturday and the Sunday is free. Don't forget the Heart of Gaming is a videogame arcade! You're not just playing to enter the tournament, but to play a great selection of both arcade and console games alike. Half of this money will go to the charity Human Appeal, to fund the ongoing aid work that they do. The other half will be going to support a gaming venue that is ONLY run by volunteers to pay the rent. We'll have some casual matches, and we’ll also be holding a big tournament on the day where all matches will be streamed. The tournament will be played on PS4.

Prizes so far include £200 cash, Season Passes and Digital Copies of the game!

Not got the full game? Not a problem! ANYBODY IN EUROPE with a PS4/Xbox One/PS3 will be able practice AND join in the online tournaments we'll be running as well as there is a FREE version of the game: Dead or Alive 5 Last Round Core Fighters. Players will just need to make sure to download it, buy an online tournament ticket, and practice before the day! All funds donated will go to the charity Human Appeal to fund the amazing aid work they do in Syria. But you'll need to get practicing as there will be some tough competition on the day...

To purchase a ticket for an online or offline tournament, please see the "Perks" section of the page. Please note payment for entry to online tournaments is separate from payment for the offline event.

When purchasing tickets for online events please leave your PSN ID or Xbox Gamertag

PLEASE NOTE: Due to DLC region lock and connection compatibility, online tournaments will only be for European players. 


The Impact

The ongoing conflict in Syria and the recent earthquake in Nepal have left millions of people without food water and shelter. These are basic human rights that nobody should be left without. Human Appeal is a charity that seeks to help these people and we want to raise some funds so that they can carry out this work. 
Your donation will go towards helping people rebuild their lives on Syria and Nepal. These people are struggling to find food, water and shelter. With your donation, you will be able to support foreign aid workers to deliver these much needed supplies. 

Making a Donation without Entering the Tournament

If you dont want to play but you'd still like to donate then please feel free to do so on the website (just make a donation without selecting one of the "Perks")

Other Ways you Can Help

Please spread the word, and share this video/ campaign to help change lives for the better! 

Follow @CarlFranciss on Twitter for the latest updates on the tournament, prizes, and combo videos to help you practice for the tournament! https://twitter.com/CarlFranciss

To find out more about Human Appeal, please visit https://humanappeal.org.uk/

To find out more about Dead or Alive 5 Last Round, follow @KoeiTecmoEurope . 

Alternatively, please visit: http://teamninja-studio.com/doa5/lastround/uk/t...

To find out more about the Venue, Heart of Gaming, please visit: https://twitter.com/TheHOGuk


Online Tournament Structure and Rules
We will be using the existing "Tournament" mode for these events. Details will be emailed to all entrants before tournaments.
Rounds: 3
Time: 60 seconds
Stage select: Random
Single Elimination (lose once and you're out!)

One entry per tournament per player! (You cant buy multiple tickets for the same online tournament. Anyone found to be doing this will be disqualified WITHOUT REFUND).
If you disconnect then you're out too so make sure your Internet settings are optimised before playing ! We reserve the right to remove red bars / bad connections from the lobby!

Offline Tournament Structure and Rules
Rounds: 3
Time: 60 seconds
Stage select: Random
Offline tournament structure will depend on the number of entrants and will be confirmed when we have a better idea of numbers. If we only have a low number of entrants then it will be a "Round Robin" style tournament and may only last one day. If a player has paid for 2 days they will still be free to come back and play casuals/use the arcade on the 2nd day. If we have a large number of entrants, then it will be a double elimination tournament across both days. Please check back for updates!
For information on the venue (e.g its location and setup) please go to https://www.facebook.com/TheHeartOfGaming

Payment Info 

PLEASE NOTE, THE PAYMENT  FOR OFFLINE TOURNAMENTS MADE VIA THIS SITE IS ONLY A PART PAYMENT. YOUR £10 DEPOSIT FOR OFFLINE TOURNAMENT CONSTITUTES YOUR PAYMENT FOR REGISTRATION ONLY. THIS MONEY WILL FORM YOUR CHARITABLE DONATION. 

YOU WILL STILL NEED TO PAY FOR ENTRY TO THE VENUE ON THE DAY. IT WILL BE AN ADDITIONAL £10 ON THE DOOR FOR REGISTRATION AND ENTRY FOR BOTH DAYS, MAKING A TOTAL OF £20 POUNDS. PLEASE CHECK DATES AND TIMES BEFORE BOOKING AS WE CANNOT ADMINISTRATE REFUNDS. 

PAYMENTS FOR ONLINE TOURNAMENTS IS COMPLETELY SEPARATE TO PAYMENT FOR THE OFFLINE EVENT.

AS PREVIOUSLY STATED HALF OF THIS MONEY GOES TOWARDS CHARITY. THE OTHER HALF GOES TOWARDS SUPPORTING A VOLUNTEER RUN VIDEO GAME ARCADE. THIS IS NOT A PROFIT MAKING TOURNAMENT.

THANK YOU

story:
I want to introduce you to my new project «Horde invasion».It is a set of beautifully sculpted fantasy multi-part miniatures. Miniatures are available in 3 versions.




32 mm scale for board game players

32 mm scale for boardgame players. This set of miniatures is  compatible with any fantasy boardgames, such as WFB. Miniatures are going with the square stands. Models are cast withhigh quality resin.

Digital source for home 3d printers

All models are cleaned , broken into pieces and ready for printing. You can print them in any size on any 3D printer for example Makerbot Replicator 2 or Form 1

Character List

All characters in high resolution. Carefully large size!

Master models for casting will be printed on Eden250 with accuracy - 16 microns - 0.01 millimeter. This will provide excellent quality and detailed models.



My miniature with GW mini and centimeter ruler for scale .


Actual casting quality. )





In addition, you will get an art book of this project in digital or paper form , depending on your pledge level.

There will be all concepts , clean renders, characters history and may be few tutorials for painting and creating models. approximately 50 - 100 pages

About me.

My name Taras Skorobruh. I am a professional digital character artist. I am over 9 years experience in the gaming industry. I participated in the development of DA 2, DA 3, Star wars the old republick, Elder scrols online and many other games. Last year I work for board games. In characters i love dynamics, fine details, style and realism. Every new character I try to do more complex and interesting.

Risks & Challenges

I've been sculpting professionally for many years and have yet to encounter any major obstacles or mishaps during the process of creation of a miniatures to that miniature going into production.

Please understand that to me and everyone else participating in the project, quality and craftsmanship are paramount. We'll keep working on it until it's perfect and we are sure that what you receive is our absolute best. We try to be realistic in our estimates and even give ourselves some room for comfort but if delays arise, it's because we want to give you our best!


update 22.04.2015

The company continues to work

Digital characters will be mailed within 1 days after the order.

Delivery for characters casted in resin will begin in late April,

Regards , Taras.

story:
Hi I'm Ray Austin

A University of Tennessee Alumni, I was drafted by the New York Jets and went on to play with the Chicago Bears and the Green Bay Packers in a successful five-year career in the NFL. After retiring from the NFL, I transitioned into a part time working model and Actor with over 100 commercials and multiple print jobs with National clients such as Gatorade, Kmart, Netflix , Coors, Target, Walmart and many more, and such shows as Prison Break, Detroit 187, Chicago Fire....and ok...That's enough:)


My Project: My awesome project (drumroll) SNAPCOUNT!

Today people can’t get enough football. A testament to this statement would be examples like fantasy football and fantasy baseball leagues.  

 My project SnapCount allows you the gamer to coach your own football team in REAL-TIME from your mobile device anywhere in the world! Imagine controlling a game of live football athletes, playing the game the way you want them to play!

In order to create something this big, I need your help! The SnapCount development team has carried the torch this far, but now we need your help to keep the flame burning and financial support to go the distance and make our avid sports/gamer fanatics dreams come true! 

Our Blood, Our Sweat, Our Tears… Your Game! 



What We Need & What You Get

I've done as much as I can financially  building out the app, website, (4)teams, and staffing. My project goals is to raise $25,000. With that, I can completely blow up the application IOS, android, tablets, administration, and complete our utility patent. 

•  If we reach our entire goal, I see this being a online league with teams built by the users themselves and ran by us every year. Getting bigger and strong each year. How cool would it be to have you very own football team you create, you, coach,  and you manage. I'm getting chills just thinking about it.


•  This can be a major move in sports. The first ever live gaming platform created. Imagine interacting with live athletes! 






Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate I totally get that! If you could spread the word to your football fanatics, friends and family on your social platforms that would be awesome! We need cheerleaders about our app just as much as we need funding. So you helping us promote would be super awesome!

story:
Attack of the Evil Poop Alpha Gameplay:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-kleccyi-JA&t=0s

 

But, what is this crap?!:

 

“Attack of the Evil Poop” is a very controversial and hilarious videogame created by a solo dev, Alejandro Navarro, to raise awareness about our eating habits, where Nick, who is the main character , is a chubby writer that travels to Latin America to find some inspiration for his next book, from which his future depends on.

As he falls in love with a chilean girl called Ana, he decides to get into shape, trying different solutions without good results, but one last thing will be very effective, more than every other solution he could ever imagine…

“Attack of the Evil Poop” mixes perfectly different game genres such as:  FPS (First Person Shooter), clicker, on-rails shooter and Q.T.E. (Quick Time Event) among others, to drive you totally insane!

 

 

 

Flush those evil creatures before they escape or someone discovers you!

Now, with the mastering of your skills, unlock every playable level, buy every weapon and item to make your task easier, but the most important is:
Don’t forget to flush!!!

 

- Attack those little demons with plungers, brooms and even with toothbrushes when there aren’t better weapons around.

- Block its karate chops at the precise moment to be rewarded, on the contrary, you will be knocked out for a little while, leaving you vulnerable to other attacks.

- Destroy its disgusting flying projectiles before they reach you, dodge its armed attacks and blow away its terrible farts with the hair dryer before you die suffocated.

- Each one of these twisted enemies have special skills depending on what you have eaten before facing them.

- Also, you will count on help from a little character, who will supply you the necessary accessories to combat evil and many other features that will give you a guaranteed amusement!

 

                                            

 

Some features of this exciting and naughty video game are:

 

- 12 frenetic main levels with different enemies each and some bonus levels!

- 5 different weapons to make those poops wish they never came out!

- An in-game store with 8 items to make the cleaning easier!

- An almost total destructible environment (A perfect catharsis!)

- An “I want to bloody know how it continues” story!

- Hilarious in-game moments and cutscenes!

- A lot of replayability, to repeat your favorite dishes!

And a lot more!!!

 

It is expected to be released, and those nasty creatures unleashed, at the beginning of 2018!
Let’s hope the dev won’t be sleeping under a bridge by then...

 

 

 

               

 

 

 

At this stage all the development costs, were made by the dev with very much effort and now the project is running out of resources (And the dev isn’t teaching on vacations from January to April, so this is the only chance to survive now).
What is needed to make this happen?

 

USD 9.500

- To reach the end of the production of the twelve original levels, in-game store, remaining characters and game mechanics.

- Service of voice acting for the remaining dialogues and characters.

- Equalization of the soundtrack.

- Game Post Production (Models, animations, texture, shaders, programming, gameplay polishing and and so on).

- Testing


There are a lot ideas in my head. Help me make them come true!

 

USD 15.000

- Addition of different bonus levels to add more content and refresh the playability in different locations.

- Addition of more enemies and game mechanics!

 

 

 

 

 

 

$3

Mwah!!

The goal is three dollar closer. The poops are going to kiss you, a lot!!

 

$7

Lots of fun on Steam! 

A digital version of the game on Steam once released + exclusive signed wallpaper (Full HD) to get your desktop dirty!

         

 

 

$15

They are everywhere!

A digital version of the game on Steam once released! + Making Off e-book

   

 

 

$25

Fun everywhere!

A digital version of the game on Steam + digital soundtrack

   

 

 

$50

Mr. Contributor!

A digital version of the game on Steam + name on credits

  

 

 

$100

The Contributonator!

A digital version of the game on Steam + digital soundtrack + making off e-book + name on credits as top contributor

          

 

 

$300

You are in the game!
A digital version of the game on Steam + your picture inside the game for a couple seconds in a cutscene! + name on credits.

  

 

$500
Poops salute you!

A digital version of the game on Steam + name on credits + a customized audio message for you, from the poops!

  

 

 

$1,000

You are in the game, permanently!

A digital version on Steam + your picture inside the game (In the Rat Store), permanently! + name on the credits as top contributor.
(There are only 2 slots available, and the first contributor will get the biggest one)

   

 

 

$5,000

Be the envy of your constipated friends!

A digital version of the game on Steam  + digital soundtrack + making off ebook + name on credits as top contributor + a customized picture of you photomontage beating down those evil poops as a wallpaper!

 

    

 

Do you imagine  a 4 years-old boy with withdrawal syndrome for not being allowed to play Atari?. Well, that’s me!

 

Since I was a little child I had video games, drawing, comics, music and animation movies addiction. I preferred to draw comics and design characters to pay attention to class at school

and of course, it was much more motivating to let my mind blows, than being sat at my desk within a suffocating classroom.

 

I always knew that I wanted to dedicate myself to these kinds of artistic areas, because they fill my heart completely.

When I got older I worked hard at a boring book store, to get money for affording my Digital Animation studies.

Lately, as I’m  a self-taught person, l learned by myself about musical composition software, illustration software and video editing software among others, until I learned about video games.

Besides, I’ve been teaching Digital Animation and Video Games Design during 8 years so far and I undertook “Sumersion Studio” business venture with two other partners.

 

Finally, I’ve decided to follow my own path as a solo dev, because I have all the skills and tools to do it. I think that sometimes, it’s better to keep the unique personal vision and doing things as one has planned, more than making deals with others for making them happy.

 

It’s been a long and a difficult path with ups and downs, with gratifications and disappointments,  but even like that, all I’ve been passing through motivates me.

 

The fact of knowing I will be able to create and bring my ideas to reality, sharing them with others, giving them a good moment and leave them a positive message, helps me to wake me up happily.

                                                                

 

 

- What happens if the campaign doesn’t reach the goal?
The game will be released anyway, probably with fewer features than  the originally designed.

 

- Why is a poop?
A poop is a taboo in many different cultures, but it is something as natural as breathing.I think we should start laughing more at these  subjects and worrying less about shallow things.
Besides, having a good time it’s not the only game goal, but, it also makes people think about their eating habits .

 

- How many gameplay hours?
It depends on your gaming skills, but the average I guess it  would be two hours. If you are one handed person, probably six. (Just kidding…)
It would be more…


- Are you crazy?

For being an indie, for being a teacher or for developing a game about poop?

 

- Where can I get ARKADIANAX?

This game is unavailable right now, but a remake is on its way! Link to Youtube Video
(And I guess there is an old torrent with the unfinished game)

 

- Why Indiegogo?

Because I’ve seen great projects raised (And I’ve donated lot of them too), and I’m sure

this great community will help me now. We, people, have the responsibility to help each other and I hope this is not the exception! :D

 

- Will this be for mobile?

It’s  an option, it depends on all this. We will see…

 

For more questions about this, please, leave a commentary.

 

Thanks for your time, guys!

 

www.ascenddigitally.com

https://www.facebook.com/AscendDigitally

https://twitter.com/anhojman
story_txt: Attack of the Evil Poop Alpha Gameplay:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-kleccyi-JA&t=0s But, what is this crap?!: “Attack of the Evil Poop” is a very controversial and hilarious videogame created by a solo dev, Alejandro Navarro, to raise awareness about our eating habits, where Nick, who is the main character , is a chubby writer that travels to Latin America to find some inspiration for his next book, from which his future depends on.As he falls in love with a chilean girl called Ana, he decides to get into shape, trying different solutions without good results, but one last thing will be very effective, more than every other solution he could ever imagine…“Attack of the Evil Poop” mixes perfectly different game genres such as:  FPS (First Person Shooter), clicker, on-rails shooter and Q.T.E. (Quick Time Event) among others, to drive you totally insane!   Flush those evil creatures before they escape or someone discovers you!Now, with the mastering of your skills, unlock every playable level, buy every weapon and item to make your task easier, but the most important is:Don’t forget to flush!!! - Attack those little demons with plungers, brooms and even with toothbrushes when there aren’t better weapons around.- Block its karate chops at the precise moment to be rewarded, on the contrary, you will be knocked out for a little while, leaving you vulnerable to other attacks.- Destroy its disgusting flying projectiles before they reach you, dodge its armed attacks and blow away its terrible farts with the hair dryer before you die suffocated.- Each one of these twisted enemies have special skills depending on what you have eaten before facing them.- Also, you will count on help from a little character, who will supply you the necessary accessories to combat evil and many other features that will give you a guaranteed amusement!                                              Some features of this exciting and naughty video game are: - 12 frenetic main levels with different enemies each and some bonus levels!- 5 different weapons to make those poops wish they never came out!- An in-game store with 8 items to make the cleaning easier!- An almost total destructible environment (A perfect catharsis!)- An “I want to bloody know how it continues” story!- Hilarious in-game moments and cutscenes!- A lot of replayability, to repeat your favorite dishes!And a lot more!!! It is expected to be released, and those nasty creatures unleashed, at the beginning of 2018!Let’s hope the dev won’t be sleeping under a bridge by then...                      At this stage all the development costs, were made by the dev with very much effort and now the project is running out of resources (And the dev isn’t teaching on vacations from January to April, so this is the only chance to survive now).What is needed to make this happen? USD 9.500- To reach the end of the production of the twelve original levels, in-game store, remaining characters and game mechanics.- Service of voice acting for the remaining dialogues and characters.- Equalization of the soundtrack.- Game Post Production (Models, animations, texture, shaders, programming, gameplay polishing and and so on).- TestingThere are a lot ideas in my head. Help me make them come true! USD 15.000- Addition of different bonus levels to add more content and refresh the playability in different locations.- Addition of more enemies and game mechanics!      $3Mwah!!The goal is three dollar closer. story:
The Class

Do you have a burning desire to create video games?

In this class you'll learn how to create working games in the web browser using JavaScript and HTML5.  This is a course for game programmers, but we'll cover more than just programming.  You'll learn how to gather together graphics and sounds and use your code to bring them to life.  You'll learn how to tell a story, and how to add all the little details that make the difference between a graphics demo and an actual game.  Best of all, you can share your finished games immediately with the whole world on the class website or on your own website.

Organization

If funded, the class will run from June 3 through July 8.  Each day I'll post new content online including:

  • Working demonstration code illustrating new concepts
  • Sample game code
  • Video explanations of key topics
  • Interactive online coding challenges
  • New tasks and dares for students
  • Feedback on student submitted tasks

All content will be posted on the class website.  You'll be given accounts on the server to post your own demos and games, and a version control repository to keep track of your source code (you are not required to use it if you don't want to).  The class website will also have a forum section for discussions related to the class.  You will be able to post your task results in the forum or email them directly to me for feedback.

All the pledge levels from Student on up give you access forever to all the educational content of the class whenever you want it, whenever you have time for it.  I'll never take down the class content.

Prerequisites

Students should have some existing programming knowledge, but don't need to be JavaScript experts.  To be successful in the class, you should have the following skills.

  • Some experience programming (for example in Python, Java, C#, or JavaScript)
  • Able to edit text files
  • Familiarity with basic HTML markup
  • Ability to use a graphics program such as Photoshop or the GIMP to cut, crop, and do other basic operations on images
  • Willingness to learn new technologies and programming techniques

The focus of the class is on creating games, not crazy programming techniques.  We'll be using programming as a tool to help us create games.

If you're not sure that your programming skills are good enough, try this practice problem.  In your favorite programming language, write a function that returns the sum of all the positive numbers in an array.  If the input is the array [1, 3, -5, 10] then the result from your function should be 14.  If you can write a solution in a few minutes without any problems then your programming skills are good enough for the class.

Technology

The class will cover making browser-based games using JavaScript and the HTML5 canvas. We'll be using a bunch of JavaScript libraries to make our lives easier, including the Crafty game engine.  The finished games should work in any modern web browser.

Funding Breakdown

  • $300 commissioned professional graphics for top game design proposals (will be CC-BY-3.0 licensed)
  • $178 royalty-free music licensing service (two months)
  • $60 server hosting for webpages and source code repositories (two months)
  • $50 miscellaneous royalty-free music
  • $40 email service for discussion group emails (two months)
  • $51 Indiegogo and Paypal fees
  • $30 video hosting for instructional videos (two months)
  • $20 royalty-free game sound effects sets

Total: $729

One expense is commissioning professional graphics for the top game design proposal(s). I want this to be a part of the class to show students how it works and what the costs are like. Of course most of the graphics we will use will be Creative Commons graphics gathered from many sources throughout the web. For music, I plan to use Magnatune's ILicenseMusic service and iStockphoto (they also have music) in addition to my existing collection of appropriately licensed Creative Commons works.

If the funding goal isn't met I will not be able to conduct the class.

About Me

I've always been interested in creating my own video games ever since I could understand anything. Working to create my own games as a kid led me down the programming path that I'm still on today.

In college I studied math and physics because I love figuring out how things work and discovering hidden beauty. At the time I saw programming as a means to an end, a way of getting things working, not really interesting in its own right. Then I discovered functional programming. I fell in love with programming all over again and realized that computer science is full of hidden wonders just as much as mathematics. I ended up getting a PhD in computer science at the University of California--Santa Cruz. After I finished my degree I joined the world of professional software development.

As a graduate student I've helped teach many classes in mathematics and computer science. Far and away the most fun class I've ever taught has been the UCSC COSMOS Game Programming summer school. High school students came for a few months in the summer to learn about game design and game programming. I was amazed at the creativity and drive of the students and at what they were able to accomplish.

I want to recreate the excitement of that class but in an internet class. I'm a believer in the power of online classes. Online classes can be cheaper and reach many more people simultaneously. I've done a few experimental classes before. It's actually pretty amazing. Hundreds of thousands of visitors have seen my "Nathan's Lessons" short interactive tutorial on JavaScript closures. That's more students than I ever saw in a classroom through years of being a graduate student. I got thousands of students for my class "Create Your Own Programming Language". Students learned esoteric programming language theory to be able to create their own programming languages.

I want this class to succeed because I want to bring the excitement of game programming to more students and get more games created. With just a little bit of guidance and direction, I know that beginning game programmers are capable of amazing things.

How to Help

Even if you don't have time to take the class yourself you are encouraged to pledge at any level you can afford. Every contribution helps make the class possible. Because this is an all online class, you can never take away a spot from another student. There is always room for more students in a digital class!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign you can still be involved:

  • Help get the word out to your friends that are interested in game programming
  • After the class is over, play the finished games and promote your favorite game

NEW: Free Student Waiting List

I've gotten inquiries from students throughout the world in a variety of situations who would like to participate in the class but are unable to financially contribute. To help bring the class to as many deserving students as possible I've started up a waiting list for students to take the class for free.

If you pledge at the new "StudentPlus" level you get to be a student in the class with all the benefits that entails, plus you allow one student on the waiting list to take the class as well.

story:
What is FrolicTribute.com?

FrolicTribute.com is a website thats purpose is to enrich the lives of internet users. The site will provide many things including watching funny/trending videos, playing games with other users or by yourself. Later, after our basic model is working we plan to expand into areas such as music, art, and anything we feel that we can effectively help or support. How are we going to do it? Keep reading and we promise our concept will become clear!

Whats the money for-

We will be using Magento to run our site. Magento is a eCommerce platform that is much more sophisticated then the typical html, css, java sites. Providing an effectively more secure and elegant website. We need additional funding for the following:

  • Hosting
  • Extensions(functions)
  • Programmers(We need additional people for certain functions)

Videos -

This is nothing new, our site will offer funny trending videos with a splash of our own humor. This has been done time and again but our site its trying to bring multiple sources of entertainment into one centralize location. Also the internet is becoming more and more effected by viruses and spyware, understanding this concern we will be trying to run a site that the user doesn't have to be wondering if its safe to visit or not.

Games -

Honestly the possibilities for what games to support is limitless. We plan to target the biggest and most played games especially ones we feel users want. Starting off FrolicTribute.com will be supporting PC games but in the background working on adding other systems that way users are not limited to what they can play.

Tournaments -

The tournaments run through our site will be completely inside our own system. Each member/user will receive a rating promptly after playing a few matches. The tournaments will be sectioned off so someone that is one of the best cannot play against someone that is just ok or new to the game. Each tournament will earn the users prizes ranging from tokens, entry into bigger tournaments, or actual items such as $20 gift card. Hopefully as the site grows we can award big items such as electronics.

Rating -

With our rating system it will be a numeric value so essentially there are thousands of places the user could be ranked. We feel that this will create a better gaming experience. For example, in Dota 2 there are only 3 ranks supporting millions of users, or in CS:GO there is only 16. When playing these games you have no idea where you stand, you just keep playing until you rank up. FrolicTribute.com plans to fix this frustration!

Tribute Tokens -

Each user/member obtains tokens on our site which is used as valueless currency. Tokens can be used for things such as entering tournaments, buying items such as a gift card or tv, or put them back into the site supporting projects and upgradable features to enhance your experience.

How Do I get Tribute Tokens -

  • Signing Up
  • Referals
  • Watch Videos
  • Play Games
  • Being Active on the Site
  • Winning Tournaments
  • And much much more!

Growth -

Right now we feel like there is a clear way to help the video and gaming communities. We are currently looking at music amongst other areas. When the video and gaming portion proves itself we will try to tap other areas and ask for our members input to help decide where to go. If for some reason we fail at one area we can move to the next only expanding to areas that we successfully better.

 

                                                Food Challenges!!!

                To Vote Simply Donate then message us with your decision!

           All Challenges will be recorded and edit for your viewing pleasure!!!

story_txt:
What is FrolicTribute.com?
FrolicTribute.com is a website thats purpose is to enrich the lives of internet users. The site will provide many things including watching funny/trending videos, playing games with other users or by yourself. Later, after our basic model is working we plan to expand into areas such as music, art, and anything we feel that we can effectively help or support. How are we going to do it? Keep reading and we promise our concept will become clear!
Whats the money for-
We will be using Magento to run our site. Magento is a eCommerce platform that is much more sophisticated then the typical html, css, java sites. Providing an effectively more secure and elegant website. We need additional funding for the following:

Hosting
Extensions(functions)
Programmers(We need additional people for certain functions)
Videos -
This is nothing new, our site will offer funny trending videos with a splash of our own humor. This has been done time and again but our site its trying to bring multiple sources of entertainment into one centralize location. Also the internet is becoming more and more effected by viruses and spyware, understanding this concern we will be trying to run a site that the user doesn't have to be wondering if its safe to visit or not.
Games -
Honestly the possibilities for what games to support is limitless. We plan to target the biggest and most played games especially ones we feel users want. Starting off FrolicTribute.com will be supporting PC games but in the background working on adding other systems that way users are not limited to what they can play.
Tournaments -
The tournaments run through our site will be completely inside our own system. Each member/user will receive a rating promptly after playing a few matches. The tournaments will be sectioned off so someone that is one of the best cannot play against someone that is just ok or new to the game. Each tournament will earn the users prizes ranging from tokens, entry into bigger tournaments, or actual items such as $20 gift card. Hopefully as the site grows we can award big items such as electronics.
Rating -
With our rating system it will be a numeric value so essentially there are thousands of places the user could be ranked. We feel that this will create a better gaming experience. For example, in Dota 2 there are only 3 ranks supporting millions of users, or in CS:GO there is only 16. When playing these games you have no idea where you stand, you just keep playing until you rank up. FrolicTribute.com plans to fix this frustration!
Tribute Tokens -
Each user/member obtains tokens on our site which is used as valueless currency. Tokens can be used for things such as entering tournaments, buying items such as a gift card or tv, or put them back into the site supporting projects and upgradable features to enhance your experience.
How Do I get Tribute Tokens -

Signing Up
Referals
Watch Videos
Play Games
Being Active on the Site
Winning Tournaments

And much much more!
Growth -
Right now we feel like there is a clear way to help the video and gaming communities. We are currently looking at music amongst other areas. When the video and gaming portion proves itself we will try to tap other areas and ask for our members input to help decide where to go. If for some reason we fail at one area we can move to the next only expanding to areas that we successfully better.

story:
Its time to bring a true convergence between Desktop computers and mobile Android devices; the best of both worlds. Your hardware, your operating system!

LinuxonAndroid has been running for over 2 years. We have grown from strength to strength, with over 60,000 active installs of our Android app (Complete Linux Installer), 8 different Linux distributions supported and over 1500 tested Device + ROM combinations. The above video shows the project as it is right now, we are working on a teaser for what it will feel like once funded and completed... watch this space!

We come back to Indiegogo to help realise LinuxonAndroid's true goal; a truly convergent system, making your Android device the only computer you will need!

After the success(or not) of the Ubuntu Edge it is clear people want a device that does everything they could need from a computer, and we are here to offer that on phones/tablets of your choice with your selection of Linux distribution.  

If we reach our funding goals we will be able to work full time on the LinuxonAndroid project, working around the clock to deliver a platform that allows both the easy use of Android and the productivity of a full desktop operating system.

This will be completed by taking our current work and tightening the integration, blurring the lines between Desktop Linux and Android. By building our own Android ROM, plus integrating and improving our Linux installs we will be able to offer a seamless experience between Android and Linux. 

Features that will be working from launch of the new project:

  • Shared file system: access your sdcard and storage in both Android and Linux

  • Native graphics: run Linux without VNC via HDMI out or on the devices screen

  • Audio: play audio from Linux via the devices speakers

  • Notifications: view all your android notifications from within Linux

  • Send Mail and Texts: send emails and text messages from within Linux, from accounts set up in Android

This all starts with android, by creating our own custom completely open source ROM Linux will be able to interact with Android on a whole new level. Get all your emails, texts and notifications from Android in Linux, access all your files from both Android and Linux and so much more!

By using an Open source ROM a growing community will easily be able to port this to more devices, allowing for many 'unofficial' builds for a huge support base.

LinuxonAndroid already supports 8 different distributions, and in time we hope to support stable versions of all of these all tightly integrated with Android, just pick your favourite distribution and away you go! 

We will start with Ubuntu as the first officially supported distro but plan to quickly move to support Debian, Kali Linux, Fedora, ArchLinux and many more. 

These will come with a base of software including web browser, office and email clients with other modifications required to 'talk' to Android and access the file system, notifications etc. All the changes will be open source and available from our git and repositories. 

Below a break down of our funding goals, any money raised will go towards the project and pushing it to its goal, but we believe at these funding points we can archive these goals. Its also important to note that while we will only be officially supporting the below devices all the work will be open source so developers will be able to port to other devices in the future! 

£1500 - Open Source ROM as described above with Nexus 4 support, Ubuntu at launch with full integration (working audio, native video, shared file system, notification/email/text pass through)

£2000 - All of the above, plus support for the Sony Xperia Tablet Z and full documentation at launch to make it much easier for other developers to port the project to other devices

£3000 - All of the Above plus Nexus 5 support

£5000 - All of the Above plus Nexus 7 (both 2012/13) and Nexus 10 support

LinuxonAndroid has been running for just over two years, and we have grown from strength to strength. From our simple beginnings of a guide on XDA the project has grown and grown, we currently stand at around 60,000 active installs of our app (Complete Linux Installer), get about 25,000 weekly downloads of our Linux images on source forge and now support 8 different Linux distributions. 

We have grown so much but its now time to take it to a new level with successful funding LinuxonAndroid will evolve into something truly useful, something that makes your Android device in to far more, into a full computer. 

And this is where we need YOU, we have the ideas, we have the skills we just do not have the funding or the free time. Only you can help here, by funding the project and helping us reach our goals we can guarantee dedicated time on the project to meet and smash our goals.

As an added intensive to the project we have set up the current perks, with more perks possibly being added at a later date. Donate just £2 and you will be sent a donation key that will unlock all the extra features in the current app, donate £10 and you will be one of the first to get early access to the next version!

Donate £40 and we will send you a nice little swag bag plus a donation key AND early access to the next version.

Not everyone can contribute with money, we completely understand this as it is after all the holiday period, but there are plenty of ways you can help support the project!

If you already have a root Android device why not download our app now and try out the current project app https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.zpwebsites.linuxonandroid

And do not forget to make some noise about this funding, share to all your social network sites and get the word out!

In the news:

  • http://www.androidauthority.com/linux-on-android-325158/
  • http://www.mobiflip.de/linuxonandroid-sucht-unterstuetzer/
  • http://androidhryaplikacie.sk/androidnovinky/novy-projekt-na-indiegogo-umozni-premenu-android-smartfonu-na-plnohodnotny-desktop-s-linuxo
  • http://www.lffl.org/2013/12/avviata-la-raccolta-fondi-per.html
  • http://www.pro-linux.de/news/1/20596/indiegogo-kampagne-fuer-linuxonandroid-gestartet.html
  • http://www.androidplanet.nl/82793/linuxonandroid
