story:
Blackpowder & Bloodlines is being run by Immersive Arts Melbourne - a group of experienced LARP writers and players who’ve participated in games all over Melbourne and around the world. We’re bringing our unique approach back to run the best game we can - and we need your help!

The campaign focuses on the interaction between Old World humans and New World orcs, their mutual struggle to survive, and the development of a new society. Humans from four nations as well as the orcs are available for player characters, all richly filled out with their own unique but recognisable cultures.

Our streamlined rules get out of the way and let players

 engage in deep role-playing, with resources tracked by in-game tokens and some brutal but forgiving combat mechanics. Much of the game experience will result from emergent play driven by the search for resources, and their use. Success, story and survival will all depend on competition for these scarce resources.

The game itself is spread out over several different play spaces, both physically and conceptually, to allow players to pick and choose what parts they participate in. While each play space affects the others, it’s perfectly possible for a player to just do one thing they enjoy all event. Better still, players can work with friends to have an impact everywhere - and true power awaits whoever can best shepherd their assets.

Our goal is to create a campaign of at least five weekend events, for over a hundred players which engages and inspires everyone involved, creates an environment of real challenge, and leaves a lasting impression full of fond memories. 

What We Need

We’re more than happy to do all the writing & testing on our own time: it’s fun, we love it and we’ll keep doing it as long as we can. But, we’re going big this time and some of this exciting stuff costs money. We’re asking for $6000 to help cover the major setup costs to help us get everything moving:

  • Insurance & Administration: $1000. This is our first hurdle. We can’t run without it, most sites need us to have it before they’ll even take a booking.

  • Site fees: $1250. If our game is going to be immersive, the choice of site is critical. We’re looking for a site that meets our atmospheric needs, as well as being able to support the hundred-plus people who’ll actually be at the event, so having some coin in the pocket will help us find the perfect place.

  • NPC costumes, weapons, gear: $2000. We have some big ideas, and for that we’ll need a big crew. NPCs are the key to developing really cool play experiences, and we want them to be awesome.

  • Props & set-pieces: $1000. We can make do with posterboard and string, but we’d prefer to do some really special stuff to bring the world to life. With your help, we can make it happen.

  • Website & photography: $400. The photography that comes out of LARP events is amazing, and it really helps to get people to events. We think this deserves proper recompense, and we’re tired of paying for it in booze and pizza.

  • GM Supplies, radios, first aid kits: $250. Making sure our Game Masters are properly-stocked, able to coordinate and look after everyone is a priority.

  • Storage & transport fees: $100. It’s not sexy, but we’ve got to put all our props somewhere.

If we don’t make our goal, we’ll still be running the game - even if we have to build stuff out of duct tape and cardboard!

What You Get

For the full run-down, have a look in the sideboard. Here's the highlights!

  • Crew and Leading Crew get our eternal gratitude. Thanks guys, every little bit helps!
  • If you want to pre-purchase a ticket to the first event, the ones you're probably looking for are the Stowaway, Passenger and First Class Passenger perks.
  • Officers get discounted entry to all our events, and Captains can buy their tickets up-front.
  • Privateers, Dockhands, Explorers and Navigators get some cool loot to take away.
  • Carpenters and Quartermasters can help us with some details to bring the game world to life.
  • The Master of Mint gets to help us write the ruler of one of the Old World nations, and if we make our stretch goals, their face will go on that nation's currency!
  • Should they exist, the Grand Patron of the Game is a beautiful human being who we will run an entire weekend event for, as well as mention how awesome they are every chance we get. Let it be known that we are buyable.

The Impact

Immersive Arts looking to build on the excellent LARP community that already exists in Melbourne and take it to the next level in every aspect: in immersion, in intensity, in maturity and in ambition. We fully expect that Blackpowder & Bloodlines will have an ongoing positive effect on the community at large, since we’ve seen it before - each time a club makes something amazing happen, the benefits filter out everywhere else. We hope that we can capture that magic too, and help the entire hobby take the next step up.

When we write & run LARP events, we don’t throw things together. We design them from the ground up with specific goals in mind. For Zeppelin Games, we wanted to ask “Can LARP be art?”; for Murder on the Ghan, we wanted to see what happens if players can’t trust the GMs; for Blackpowder & Bloodlines, we have several major goals:

  • We want to give our players a wide scope of play options.

  • We want to create mature, theme-exploring play.

  • We want our players to intensely immerse themselves.

  • We want to present serious moral choices with high personal stakes.

  • We want to help our players grow and improve in the hobby.

We’ve seen & done all of these before to varying degrees of scale and effectiveness and the results can be truly amazing. Most games focus on one or two of these aspects and do them really well, but we want to do it all - and we think that’s something worth doing.

Risks & Challenges
There’s a lot in here about aims, goals, and what we want to do. We do know that this is a big project, and we’re well aware that we’re doing something out of the ordinary by asking for your help. Running any LARP is fraught with difficulty. For starters, we have all the regular potential problems facing LARP events, like funding, character “bleed”, participant injury, organiser stress and so on. These are things that any LARP needs to manage, but there are some extra challenges which face us:

  • We want lots people to come to our events: One of the most challenging things that every new LARP faces is getting people to show up, and we’re aiming to get at least a hundred of them at our games. We know that the LARP calendar is expanding (which is excellent) but we think there’s space in there for one or two more weekend events each year. To be plain about it, our plan is to get people as excited as we are so that they tell their friends, family and random passersby that they should come as well. Then, we deliver - and good games are self-sustaining.
  • We have lofty ambitions: Blackpowder & Bloodlines is a crazy-ambitious project and we really want to make it better than anything we’ve done before, by a big margin. We know we can do “pretty good” but we want to do even better. The way that we’re going to do that is by working to our goals, communicating them to our community, and getting everyone to tell us how they think we’re travelling. We thrive on feedback, since it’s the only way we can find out if we’ve done what we set out to do, or if we need to change it up.
  • We’re dealing with confronting themes and ideas: We’re not only out to challenge ourselves, but our players as well. That can sometimes be hit & miss, but we’ve seen that the community is ready for it with other great events like After the Fall. We’ve already touched on how we’ll manage this: by communicating; by telling everyone up-front what kind of game we’re going to run, and then by giving people the tools to deal with it. Development manifestos, workshops and an open ear are just some of the tools we think will prove useful. That way, participants will know what to expect and how to direct their play to match those expectations.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t make a financial donation we would still love your help!

  • Sign up to our development emails: you can be among the first to read the drafts of rules and world and give us your feedback

  • Join the playtest events and help us break everything so that we can figure out how to make it better!

  • Tell your friends about Blackpowder and Bloodlines, share our campaign on facebook or your favorite other social media.

  • Come to our costume and prop, and character workshops, help us build & make things (no experience necessary).

  • Volunteer to NPC or crew: events need lots more than just the organisers running around to make things happen.

  • If you have other skills you'd like to contribute - such as building, making, sewing, writing - let us know.

  • And of course, come play!
story_txt:
Blackpowder & Bloodlines is being run by Immersive Arts Melbourne - a group of experienced LARP writers and players who’ve participated in games all over Melbourne and around the world. We’re bringing our unique approach back to run the best game we can - and we need your help!


The campaign focuses on the interaction between Old World humans and New World orcs, their mutual struggle to survive, and the development of a new society. Humans from four nations as well as the orcs are available for player characters, all richly filled out with their own unique but recognisable cultures.
Our streamlined rules get out of the way and let players
 engage in deep role-playing, with resources tracked by in-game tokens and some brutal but forgiving combat mechanics. Much of the game experience will result from emergent play driven by the search for resources, and their use. Success, story and survival will all depend on competition for these scarce resources.
The game itself is spread out over several different play spaces, both physically and conceptually, to allow players to pick and choose what parts they participate in. While each play space affects the others, it’s perfectly possible for a player to just do one thing they enjoy all event. Better still, players can work with friends to have an impact everywhere - and true power awaits whoever can best shepherd their assets.
Our goal is to create a campaign of at least five weekend events, for over a hundred players which engages and inspires everyone involved, creates an environment of real challenge, and leaves a lasting impression full of fond memories.    What We Need 
We’re more than happy to do all the writing & testing on our own time: it’s fun, we love it and we’ll keep doing it as long as we can. But, we’re going big this time and some of this exciting stuff costs money. We’re asking for $6000 to help cover the major setup costs to help us get everything moving:

Insurance & Administration: $1000. This is our first hurdle. We can’t run without it, most sites need us to have it before they’ll even take a booking.
Site fees: $1250. If our game is going to be immersive, the choice of site is critical. We’re looking for a site that meets our atmospheric needs, as well as being able to support the hundred-plus people who’ll actually be at the event, so having some coin in the pocket will help us find the perfect place.
NPC costumes, weapons, gear: $2000. We have some big ideas, and for that we’ll need a big crew. NPCs are the key to developing really cool play experiences, and we want them to be awesome.
Props & set-pieces: $1000. We can make do with posterboard and string, but we’d prefer to do some really special stuff to bring the world to life. With your help, we can make it happen.
Website & photography: $400. The photography that comes out of LARP events is amazing, and it really helps to get people to events. We think this deserves proper recompense, and we’re tired of paying for it in booze and pizza.
GM Supplies, radios, first aid kits: $250. Making sure our Game Masters are properly-stocked, able to coordinate and look after everyone is a priority.
Storage & transport fees: $100. It’s not sexy, but we’ve got to put all our props somewhere.

If we don’t make our goal, we’ll still be running the game - even if we have to build stuff out of duct tape and cardboard!
What You Get

For the full run-down, have a look in the sideboard. Here's the highlights!



Crew and Leading Crew get our eternal gratitude. Thanks guys, every little bit helps!


If you want to pre-purchase a ticket to the first event, the ones you're probably looking for are the Stowaway, Passenger and First Class Passenger perks.


Officers get discounted entry to all our events, and Captains can buy their tickets up-front.


Privateers, Dockhands, Explorers and Navigators get some cool loot to take away.


Carpenters and Quartermasters can help us with some details to bring the game world to life.


The Master of Mint gets to help us write the ruler of one of the Old World nations, and if we make our stretch goals, their face will go on that nation's currency!


Should they exist, the Grand Patron of the Game is a beautiful human being who we will run an entire weekend event for, as well as mention how awesome they are every chance we get. Let it be known that we are buyable.

  The Impact 
Immersive Arts looking to build on the excellent LARP community that already exists in Melbourne and take it to the next level in every aspect: in immersion, in intensity, in maturity and in ambition. We fully expect that Blackpowder & Bloodlines will have an ongoing positive effect on the community at large, since we’ve seen it before - each time a club makes something amazing happen, the benefits filter out everywhere else. We hope that we can capture that magic too, and help the entire hobby take the next step up.
When we write & run LARP events, we don’t throw things together. We design them from the ground up with specific goals in mind. For Zeppelin Games, we wanted to ask “Can LARP be art?”; for Murder on the Ghan, we wanted to see what happens if players can’t trust the GMs; for Blackpowder & Bloodlines, we have several major goals:

We want to give our players a wide scope of play options.
We want to create mature, theme-exploring play.
We want our players to intensely immerse themselves.
We want to present serious moral choices with high personal stakes.
We want to help our players grow and improve in the hobby.
We’ve seen & done all of these before to varying degrees of scale and effectiveness and the results can be truly amazing. Most games focus on one or two of these aspects and do them really well, but we want to do it all - and we think that’s something worth doing.

Risks & Challenges
There’s a lot in here about aims, goals, and what we want to do. We do know that this is a big project, and we’re well aware that we’re doing something out of the ordinary by asking for your help. Running any LARP is fraught with difficulty. For starters, we have all the regular potential problems facing LARP events, like funding, character “bleed”, participant injury, organiser stress and so on. These are things that any LARP needs to manage, but there are some extra challenges which face us:
We want lots people to come to our events: One of the most challenging things that every new LARP faces is getting people to show up, and we’re aiming to get at least a hundred of them at our games. We know that the LARP calendar is expanding (which is excellent) but we think there’s space in there for one or two more weekend events each year. To be plain about it, our plan is to get people as excited as we are so that they tell their friends, family and random passersby that they should come as well. Then, we deliver - and good games are self-sustaining.
We have lofty ambitions: Blackpowder & Bloodlines is a crazy-ambitious project and we really want to make it better than anything we’ve done before, by a big margin. We know we can do “pretty good” but we want to do even better. The way that we’re going to do that is by working to our goals, communicating them to our community, and getting everyone to tell us how they think we’re travelling. We thrive on feedback, since it’s the only way we can find out if we’ve done what we set out to do, or if we need to change it up.

We’re dealing with confronting themes and ideas: We’re not only out to challenge ourselves, but our players as well. That can sometimes be hit & miss, but we’ve seen that the community is ready for it with other great events like After the Fall. We’ve already touched on how we’ll manage this: by communicating; by telling everyone up-front what kind of game we’re going to run, and then by giving people the tools to deal with it. Development manifestos, workshops and an open ear are just some of the tools we think will prove useful. That way, participants will know what to expect and how to direct their play to match those expectations.



Other Ways You Can Help 

Even if you can’t make a financial donation we would still love your help! 

Sign up to our development emails: you can be among the first to read the drafts of rules and world and give us your feedback
Join the playtest events and help us break everything so that we can figure out how to make it better!
Tell your friends about Blackpowder and Bloodlines, share our campaign on facebook or your favorite other social media. 
Come to our costume and prop, and character workshops, help us build & make things (no experience necessary).
Volunteer to NPC or crew: events need lots more than just the organisers running around to make things happen.
If you have other skills you'd like to contribute - such as building, making, sewing, writing - let us know.
And of course, come play!

story:
This Campaign Has Ended!

We have finalized this campaign. The Game Development Mini-Degree can be purchased directly from our website HERE.

Learn to Code and Create YOUR OWN Games

The Game Development Mini-Degree is a massive collection of online courses that will teach you how to code and build impressive games with Unity.

Whether you are an absolute beginner or a more advanced programmer, this training bundle will help you reach your goals if your goal is to games for 2D, 3D, mobile, virtual reality or augmented reality environments!

Besides coding you will also learn to create your own game artwork (2D and 3D) using only free tools: Blender, MagicaVoxel, Gimp and Inkscape.

Courses Included in the Game Development Mini-Degree

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

About ZENVA - Join +200,000 Students!

At ZENVA, we've been teaching programming online since 2012 to over 200,000 students, many of whom have used these skills to advance their careers, start companies and publish games.

Upon course completion of the Game Development Mini-Degree you'll get a Completion Certificate that can be verified via URL and shared on LinkedIn to impress potential clients and employers.

We've Successfully Delivered 4 Crowdfunding Campaigns ON TIME

This is our 5th crowdfunding campaign and we have a perfect track record when it comes to delivering everything ON TIME to our backers!

story:
We are Nanali Studios!

Hi, everyone! Greetings from Seoul, Korea! 

It is very honor to meet you in IndieGoGo one of the greatest crowd funding community in the world. 

The studio starts from 2012 and consists of 7 talented people. Mainly we make a mobile game and characters. But we love to do anything related storytelling, like an e-book, mobile app, short film and others. 

Till today, we released two mobile game titles. Fruit Attacks and Timefish. Luckily, both titles are featured on Apple Appstore over 130 countries. 

And below four of Studio developing Sally's Law which we want to introduce to you via IndieGoGo. 


Ah, one more thing! We won the grand prize in Google Indie Game Festival Korea this year for Sally's Law. 



Sally's Law

The title of the game is 'Sally's law'. Just in case, you don't know what the term is, 'Sally's law' is an opposite word of 'Murphy's law'. The word which means that the things have a tendency happening in an own way. For example, when you feel nervous because of getting later than the appointed time, fortunately, the other arrives later than you. Or when you get out with an umbrella on a bright day, and suddenly it begins raining. I think the title fits our game. Below is concept arts of Sally's Law. 


So basically, Sally's Law starts from one idea. 'It might be someone or something is behind these kinds of lucky situations?' 


Story

And the story is here: Sally(who live in a city) heard that her father(who live in a rural area) is in a critical condition. So, she heads for her hometown. But somehow, the way she goes to hometown is so fair and easy. And it turns out, the half-ghost father helped her out throughout the entire way home.


How to play

It is not a familiar style game. So, please see the below trailer first. 

Did you get it? The way of play is like this. 
1) Playing Character 1(Sally). All the doors(or spikes, cliffs...) in front of the character are opens automatically.

2) Rewind the scene.

3) Character 1 moves automatically as the user controlled before.

4) Playing Character 2(Father). Open the doors in front of Character 1.

5) Character 1 and Character 2 are interacts with each other occasionally through the game.

There is some limitation exist. Father only moves vertically. He can't jump. And Sally only can do a jump. But when Father bumps Sally, he jumps highly. So, you should have a plan to move to solve many kinds of puzzles in the game. 

Currently, there are 8 kinds of gimmicks. 

1) Door-Key: When Father get the key, the door will be open. 

2) Doore-Button: Door opens only during Father push the button. 

3) Spike: Unlike other games, Sally didn't die when she step on the spike. Alternatively, Father should eliminate that before Sally steps on.

4) Spring: It only works to Sally. Sally jump high when she step on the spring. 

5) Changing Direction: It also only works to Sally. Sally change the direction when she touched this gimmick. 

6) Wormhole: It only works to Father. Father can teleport using this wormhole. 

7) Time Stopper: It only works to Father. When he gets this item, time stops for a moment. 

And as you see in the trailer, there are many texts displayed in the game. That's a story of Father and Sally. So, Sally's Law is kind of hybrid of e-book and game. 


Why IndieGoGo?

In Sally's Law, we plan to use the money to localize the story and text mainly since the story is very important in our game. And some of them will spend for making perks.
Basically, we apply IndieGoGo since we don't have enough resource to finish Sally's Law and start next. As you see, we don't make a lot of money since our contents including Fruit Attacks, Timefish not specialized earn the money. We believe we make the contents and story not only the game. So, if you like our work and want to cheer us. Back us :) 

Perks!

We set a plan to thank our backers as below. 

All the perks including actual products will be shipped within September.

story:
Hello!

I'm Jay, the owner of Black Knight Games in Hamilton, ON.  Since opening our doors almost six years ago Black Knight Games has been proud to be Hamilton's premier store for miniature wargaming, CCGs, RPGs and board games.  In that time we have grown considerably, and the Black Knight Games community has expanded with us creating a large group of local gamers that I am proud to be a part of.

The only down side to any of this is that we are simply running out of room!  It is not uncommon for a gamer to show up hoping for a game with a buddy only to find the space completely filled with participants of a league or tournament.

Until recently there wasn't anything that we could do about that, but now there is.  We have reached an agreement with our landlords and will be moving soon to a larger space in the same plaza.  We will be committing a lot of the new space to an amazing new gaming space which we are calling The Stronghold Game Lounge!

But We Need You!

We have already secured enough funds to get the space and move, and even add some improvements, but as it is we will have a large area which will almost double the amount of gaming space we have, but it will really just be a room similar to what we have now...and where's the fun in that?

With your help we can turn this simple space in to a gaming lair that you will love, and want to spend all your time in!  So, we have created this funding campaign to allow you, the local Black Knight gamer, to pitch in and turn this in to the game room of your dreams.

We're not just asking for a donation, that's not what this is at all.  We are creating a fundraising campaign that will allow you to get all sorts of great perks which simultaneously helping us make our community an amazing club-space.  Please Note:

  1. We are already committed to providing our gamers with the the best area that we can.  Any funds from this campaign will only be used to add to the greatness which will be this lounge.
  2. This campaign will reward all donors with perks based on the amount they have pitched in.  These perks are along the right, and are guaranteed rewards for donors.  So you get cool stuff AND the chance to pitch in!
  3. We will also have stretch-goals based on how much has been raised.  The more money we can raise the more goodies will be unlocked for the new space!

This funding campaign is not only a great way for you to pitch in financially, we will also make it a place for you to have a voice.  Do you have a great idea for a perk or stretch goal?  Do you know the one thing that will take this gaming space from good to great?  Well it's not too late, leave comments and create a conversation!  We would love to hear from you, because it is absolutely your space that we are making here!

What will the New Game Room Be Used For?

The Stronghold Game Lounge will replace our current gaming area, and will:

Allow us to run more events, and allow us to run some huge events, like a Magic: the Gathering Grand Prix Trial with 70+ players, or a 30 Team (60 player) Warhammer 40K Doubles Tournament!  It will allow us to run events for more niche games that usually are usually pre-empted by events from the bigger systems.  Expect more opportunity for games like Malifaux, Dystopian Wars, RPGs, Infinity, Flames of War, World of Warcraft TCG, Pokemom, and Blood Bowl...We play so many great games at BKG, and now we can let them all shine.

Event when we have an event on we will usually have plenty of extra space for you to get a pick-up game with your buddy, or even just to hang out with other gamers.

Who gets to use the Stronghold Game Lounge?

There are several ways that you can gain access to the Stronghold Game Lounge.  First of all every Stronghold Member will have access all the time.  Any participants in an official tournament or designated event will get access for the day as well.  Finaly you can gain access with a day-pass, or as the guest of a Red Card Member.

Other Ways You Can Help

Look we've all been there, sometimes you just don't have the extra cash to throw at something you want, even something as cool as this.  But fear not, there are plenty of things you can do to help!

  • Tell your friends!, and family!
  • Post this campaign to Facebook, Twitter or other social media.
  • Follow the funding campaign and pitch in with ideas and opinions.
  • Offer up your labor or skills!  We have a TON of work to do to get our to our vision, and anybody wishing to vonlunteer is more than welcome!

But I Don't Have a Credit Card or Paypal!

Really?  Dude it's 2013!  Don't worry, if you would prefer to contribute we can definitely work something out.  Drop by the store and let the staff know, or email us!

 

While we will be thrilled with any donations we get, the more we end up with the more great stuff we will be able to add to the space.  If we reach our normal goal you will have helped us out enough to make the space a reality, and to add to and update our tables.

That being said, we have all kinds of great ideas that would really make the Stronghold Game Lounge amazing.  So, if we make our initial $1000 goal we will then switch over to focussing on Stretch Goals.  As we knock-out stretch goals we will continually add more and more to the space until we finaly have the Gamer's Paradise of all our dreams!

Stretch Goals will include things like:
A lounge Area to rest in, Premium Tables, new items on the menu like hot drinks and food, fun entertainment like an X-Box or Foosball table, amazing decor including great art and a medieval-village facade, and interconnected TVs.  We also have two major goals, which will take some effort: A fully licensed bar to allow us to run After-Hours Veteran's Nights, and an additional private gaming area to add even more gaming, and options called The Keep Game Room.  Also some stretch goals will even upgrade the perks you've earned, meaning you get even more stuff for your contribution!

In addition to claiming perks donors may add additional funds and claim Add-Ons.  These add-ons are only available to donors that have already claimed a normal perk.  Some add-ons have added restrictions: The Red Card upgrade may only be added to a perk that includes the normal Stronghold Membership,  The additional Founder's Party ticket may only be added to a perk that already includes the pair of Founder's Party tickets.

To add an add-on simply increase your pledge by the number indicated.  At the end of the campaign we will find out through surveys which of the add-ons you wanted.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

Hello from Mississauga, Ontario, Canada, headquarters of Game Scorpion Inc. which is a small Indie app and game development company.  We are a 3 person team consisting of myself (Abhinav Gupta - Lead Developer and CEO), my wife Seema Gupta and our other developer Amit Niraj in India. 

Since I was a little boy I've always been in love with playing video games and making them.  My first game that gave me the passion to create was a game called Nibbles made in QBasic.  For the first time I was able to take a game and edit levels and make my own version of the game.  For the first time I got a taste of the world of developing and soon fell in love with video game development.

Now many years later my team mates and I have been making games and apps for iOS, Android and various other platforms.  This is the first time we are going to be trying out the Indiegogo platform and crowd funding to help us in creating our new game title PENTORA VAGEN. 

You can read about my history in my personal page.  I have had a very challenging time, but I guess that's how the best stories are created right? 

I've lost my job, my house, my car, and nearly everything I had in the recession. After a large loss like that, having FAITH in a greater power is a very important thing.  I can honestly say that without God and keeping faith we would not have been able to even get this far.

That being said, we are now HOPING and having FAITH that many of you reading this and viewing this project will help us fund this great vision for this game so that we may continue to do what we love and hopefully build a larger company that helps to create jobs and keep families in their homes!

Giving back to the community and helping out the economy is a lesson that we have learnt after loosing so much ourselves. We hope to one day become the next large company hiring thousands, but until then we will keep growing and working hard towards building a winning and responsible company!

DREAMS COME TRUE, please help us in making this vision a reality!

Thank you once again for your support, from the bottom of our hearts we would not be able to do this without you!

God Bless!

Abhinav Gupta
Lead Developer and CEO
Game Scorpion Inc.
http://www.gamescorpion.com

WHAT IS THIS?

Pentora Vagen is the name of the game.  We took several game concepts that we found highly addictive and built an entire world around it.  The closest way we can describe it is like taking a trading/buying/selling game and mixing it with an RPG!

You are a merchant known as a Vagen who must go around in this 2D/3D (Possibly 2.5D) world known as Pentora. As a Vagen (Merchant Class) you will travel to various kingdoms to buy and sell your various goods. 

30 Moons will you have in order to gain as many crystals as possible.  After 30 Moons your time will be up at which point you will have a score of total crystals.  This score will be shared on Game Center and you'll be able to try another 30 Moon campaign again.

Each 30 Moon session will be considered a ROUND and after a round is over you can upgrade your character and purchase other items for your character such as special powers, special moves, etc.

Your ultimate goal is to see how much money (Crystals) you can amass in a single 30 Moon campaign.

Along the way you will be able to go into various forests to do battle with monsters and evil enemies including other Vagen who wish to steal your goods from you to turn a profit.

You may even be sent on various missions and quests by various purchasers or suppliers of material in order for a price discount (Example: the sword smith who supplies swords may give you a discount if you get the Shard of Illumen which will help him to increase his sword creation output.  The Shard of Illumen is guarded by the Cyclops like monster in the cavern of Euridiya.  In exchange you will get discounted swords at half off for the next 10 rounds)

Other neat things you can do would be to purchase in-app Additional Moon cycles, so instead of a 30 Moon cycles, you can have a certain round played at 45 Moon cycles and hence increase your high score.

Along the way other quests and achievements will be built in with various updates to the app and there will be many in-app purchases and new quests and worlds to explore.

We are hoping that Pentora Vagen will be the next big hit and with your support we can really get this game out there :)

Over time we will start adding screenshots, videos, gameplay trailers, etc. So keep yourself posted here :)

What We Need

We are looking to get funding of $100,000 (100k) or more to help us in our efforts.  More would be grately appreciated, if we can hit a million that will help us even more!

We are hoping to have this project completed in about 4 months time, but pushing ourselves to have something ready for christmas if possible.

Proposed pricing of the game will be between FREE to $4.99 for the base price and then various in-app purchases ranging from $0.99 to $99.99.

The proposed base version will have Advertisments to support it and a removal of ads inside the game via in-app purchase.

So what we need the money for:
1. Software and tools to help us in creating the game
2. Purchasing various assets in the game or for paying for those who can create these assets (Sounds, Music, etc.)
3. General funding of the Game to help us in our continued support of the game and future efforts (Updates, Maintenenace, etc.)
4. Marketing the game (This can be pricey)
5. Purchasing the latest testing devices if applicable (To make sure we are up to date with the latest iOS systems)
6. If we can hit over the 200k mark then we will also start porting everything over to Android devices as well so that we can hit the worldwide audience even more.  If not we will still attempt the Android port, however it may take longer to port.
7. Once again if we can hit the higher million mark then we will also invest into getting the game Localized into several major languages as well and can then setup our office to start developing more great game titles and running a successful Game business.
8. To pay ourselves and staff for their hard work (No money = no staff = no game.  It takes money to make great works like this, hence why we chose to use Indiegogo as one of our options along with our own personal funds thus far)

If we don't hit our targets, we have made the campaign variable so that at least we can start with what we have and attempt to create the game with whatever you are willing to give us.  We are grateful for all your support and please know that we will still attempt to create the game with whatever budget is achieved.

What You Get

The game for one will be something to look forward to.  For all those who are taking part, we will make sure you are amongst the first to know about the launch and will make sure you get the BASE version for free (In order to do this we will keep the game free for the first week just to make sure you obtain a free copy of the base version.  After that if you do not obtain a free version you will pay between $0.99-$4.99 depending on the promotion for the BASE game).

$10 Perk (BACKGROUND PACAKGE):
$10 - You'll get an Image Background Package (For Windows or your Mac)

$25 Perk (POSTCARD PACKAGE):
$25 - You'll get everything from the $10 Perk + A postcard of Pentora Vagen sent to you via physical mail.

$50 Perk (SOUNDTRACK PACKAGE):
$50 - You'll get everything in $25 Perk + You'll also get the mp3 music soundtrack when it's released for the game

$100 Perk (BETA TESTER PACKAGE):
$100 - You'll get everything from the $50 Perk + You'll get access to special BETA TESTING via the web (flash) which means you'll be able to try the game EVEN BEFORE it's launched!  This is a great way to test out the game and also give us your ideas and feedback to make the game even better!

$250 Perk (80 Available) (WATCH US DEVELOP PACKAGE): You'll get everything from the $100 Perk + You'll get to watch us develop during the "WATCH US DEVELOP" portions which will happen every now and again.  We put our screen live and you can watch and hear the developers discuss and talk while you watch them develop the game! This is a very in-depth behind the scenes look at the game as it gets developed! Not many will get to see the behind the scenes!  You can even chat with the developers live and ask questions!

$500 Perk (50 Available) (BRONZE SPONSOR GAME CREDITS PACKAGE): You'll get everything from the $250 Perk + You'll get your personal name in the game credits as a Bronze Sponsor.  You'll also be getting a special Bronze Sponsor T-Shirt sent to you as well by mail.

$1,000 Perk (50 Available) (SILVER SPONSOR GAME CREDITS PACKAGE): You'll get everything from the $500 Perk EXCEPT You will be known as a SILVER SPONSOR in the game credits and will have a choice of your Company name or Personal name in the Silver Sponsor portion.  You will also be getting an official t-shirt with our company logo and in-game graphics related to Pentora Vagen with a "Silver Sponsor" label on it.

$5,000 Perk (8 Available) (GOLD SPONSOR GAME CREDITS PACKAGE): You'll get everything from the $1000 Perk EXCEPT You will be known as a GOLD SPONSOR in the game credits and will have a choice of your Company name or Personal name in the Gold Sponsor portion of game credits. You will also get to name your own Kingdom!  We will also list you as an Affiliate on our Website and you will also have a spot in the main game startup showing your logo (8 spots available).  You will also get a special PC Edition of the game (Before anyone else ever does).

$OPEN - Any other donations you wish to give towards this project are greatly appreciated!

The Impact

Our project is a valuable one to invest in because it will help to build a stronger company which will focus on job creation and growth and will help out the community.  We plan to be a helpful company focused on not just our profits, but the people behind those profits.

We want to be the change that we hope can be an example to follow.  Giving to the community, helping out our own staff, everyone becoming financially abundant and doing what they love, making dreams come true!

If you have ever been out of a job or lost everything due to corporate greed, then you know where we are coming from, this is a campaign for you!

If you are looking for change and want to help out a company in starting that change for better more responsible corporations, then this campaign is for you!

If you love video games and want to see a great game come to life then THIS CAMPAIGN IS DEFINITLY FOR YOU!

Every little bit helps us towards our goals and with your support we can achieve success not only for ourselves, but for the communities and lives of those who are involved.

We believe that one person can change the world.  Please help us in building a company that focuses on helping out the "LITTLE GUYS" rather than investing only in larger companies who focus only on monetary success rather than the people behind that success. 

Your help is grately appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help
 
Can't contribute money wise? NO PROBLEM! We still need your help to tell others and get more people to fund the project!  Please also visit our website and even purchase some of our other apps.  Your purchases of our other apps brings us in more money as well so we can use it in this and future project.
 
Please spread the word about our company, apps and project via Facebook, Twitter and all the social media outlets!  Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out asap!

Get us an interview! If you know a reporter who may be looking for a story and is interested in doing an interview or writing about us, our current project or even our other apps or app business, please forward them to this info:
 
Request for Interview
Abhinav Gupta
Lead Developer and CEO
Game Scorpion Inc.
nav@gamescorpion.com
 
(Upon receiving the request I will send out my phone number directly for contact)

The more help we can get about spreading the word the better!  Thank you for your help!

UPDATES


We will be placing updates here regularly for screenshots, videos and more!  Check back constantly for updates!

story:
Overview - What is Deceptive Inc?

Hi there! Welcome to the official crowdfunding page for Deceptive Inc - a VR experience. Please watch our pitch film to get a greater understanding of the overall experience or take a look down below for further information.

Deceptive Inc is a VR Escape Room Experience created by five 4th semester students (Anders, Jeppe, Jens-Julius, Magnus & Theis) all from the film school VIA Film & Transmedia in Aarhus, Denmark. 

In Deceptive Inc you are placed in the shoes of office worker 1326 in a small 1990's office cubicle - where you are told to work. Throughout the VR-experience, you will discover that the work you're doing might not be what you think it is, and in reality, it's all a simulation set up by an AI who wants you to do its dirty work. Your task is to escape the simulation and make the endless work end. Yet how you do it, and if you do so, is up to you. 

The game is set to be released on STEAM through STEAM DIRECT. Anyone with a VR-Computer based headset will be able to play - FOR FREE! Since we're on a tight student budget we need your help to develop, create and distribute the experience!

How did Deceptive Inc come to be? 

The modern society places high demands on how we as humans shall live and behave. You can live your whole life by following only the norms of society, and completely forget to follow your own thoughts and dreams. Almost like robots that just do what they are told. In Deceptive Inc you are inside a simulated world that mimics this kind of society, where everything is pre-programmed, and put into a system. It's the player's task to wake up from this 'trance', break the system, and thus find its own identity in this simulated world. 

The driven force to create Deceptive Inc is made from a common motivation in going to the same film school and primarily having made short films in our young career as filmmakers. We teamed up because we have a united love for the VR-media and we all wanted to make something different for our 4th-semester exam - instead of any other traditional media (short film, music video, commercials etc.). We wanted to make something that could give us a challenge, more perspective, and knowledge in creating other unique audiovisual media.

Impact, Risks & Challenges

First and foremost - we can't stretch this enough: This project is part of our exam, and therefore we have a deadline, which gives you a guarantee of seeing this as a finish VR-experience in the nearest future.

However, we're not going to hide the fact that Deceptive Inc is our first major VR-project. We knew from the get-go that there were going to be a lot of risks and surprises that could come our way as VR-greenhorns - especially considering our short 2-month time constraint our exam demands - but we do like a good challenge and we're aiming high. We want this to be a SUPER COOL VR-experience that will provide us with a lot of knowledge which we can benefit from in our future as VR creators. We are ready to tackle any hurdle coming our way. We have the skills, we have the passion and we have the gumption.

All we need now is your help!

What Your Hard Earned Money Will Go Towards

Again, since Deceptive Inc is a VR school exam project for our 4th-semester we want to clarify completely: EVERYBODY ON THE PROJECT - ARE WORKING FOR FREE! Nobody gets paid. It’s all about the passion for the experience.

Therefore, every and any donation goes explicitly towards:

  • Professional English Voice Actors
  • Renting Professional VR-Equipment (INSTA 360 PRO 8K)
  • Buying Great & Convincing Prop Materials
  • Paying the fee for uploading the game through Steam Direct (100$)
  • Extra Third-Party Plug-Ins/Special VR-Software

We therefore hope you'll highly consider donating to this VR-experience so Deceptive Inc can become a reality. 

The Team of Deceptive Inc:

Anders Riber Nielsen - Director, Co-Writer 
Anders started out acting from a young age, but soon found himself directing plays, music videos and several short films. His passion for storytelling has grown ever since, and he is eager to contribute making this VR-experience as immersive and profound as possible.

Jens Julius Gunderlund Dall  – Writer, Co-Director
Even though Jens-Julius is a storyteller by heart, his do-it-yourself approach to filmmaking means he has just as much experience in photography, editing and VFX. VR is a new and different format, but his background has given him the tools to write a script that can be visualized into a VR experience.

Magnus R. Poulsen, Producer

Magnus is a hard-working producer, who specializes in networking and team performance. In the age of 24, he has already been to the world’s biggest youth short film festival (NFFTY) and the world’s biggest short film festival (Clermont Ferrand Film Festival).
More than ever he is now determined to learn the best different possible workflows and collective overview of any VR-Experience he is on.

Theis Holmstrup, Producer

Theis is a creative producer who has a vast experience in creating internet video content and a core focus in producing commercials for television and creating VR-content. With a small team, Theis previously developed an ambitious and immersive VR experience that deals with sexual abuse and harassment.

Jeppe Klausen, Unity/VR-Technician

Jeppe is a 24-year-old filmmaker and musician, and he has various skills in the technical segment. He has worked with VR equipment such as 360 VR cameras and software that is compatible with this new media format. Jeppe also has a lot of experience with audio in both film and music and knows how to construct a credible sound mix and master.

--------
Thank you so much for showing interest in Deceptive Inc.
Please make sure to follow our journey on these platforms:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/deceptiveinc
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/deceptive_inc

Also, feel free to contacts us if you have any question! - We'll love to answer any question regarding Deceptive Inc or any uncertainty to why you should donate to the experience.
Be sure to read our FAQ too for extra details concerning the experience!

Thanks again and bye for now!

However, we're not going to hide the fact that Deceptive Inc is our first major VR-project. We knew from the get-go that there were going to be a lot of risks and surprises that could come our way as VR-greenhorns - especially considering our short 2-month time constraint our exam demands - but we do like a good challenge and we're aiming high. We want this to be a SUPER COOL VR-experience that will provide us with a lot of knowledge which we can benefit from in our future as VR creators. We are ready to tackle any hurdle coming our way. We have the skills, we have the passion and we have the gumption.
All we need now is your help!


What Your Hard Earned Money Will Go Towards
Again, since Deceptive Inc is a VR school exam project for our 4th-semester we want to clarify completely: EVERYBODY ON THE PROJECT - ARE WORKING FOR FREE! Nobody gets paid. It’s all about the passion for the experience.
Therefore, every and any donation goes explicitly towards:

Professional English Voice Actors
Renting Professional VR-Equipment (INSTA 360 PRO 8K)
Buying Great & Convincing Prop Materials
Paying the fee for uploading the game through Steam Direct (100$)
Extra Third-Party Plug-Ins/Special VR-Software

We therefore hope you'll highly consider donating to this VR-experience so Deceptive Inc can become a reality. 
The Team of Deceptive Inc:Anders Riber Nielsen - Director, Co-Writer Anders started out acting from a young age, but soon found himself directing plays, music videos and several short films. His passion for storytelling has grown ever since, and he is eager to contribute making this VR-experience as immersive and profound as possible.Jens Julius Gunderlund Dall  – Writer, Co-DirectorEven though Jens-Julius is a storyteller by heart, his do-it-yourself approach to filmmaking means he has just as much experience in photography, editing and VFX. VR is a new and different format, but his background has given him the tools to write a script that can be visualized into a VR experience.Magnus R. Poulsen, ProducerMagnus is a hard-working producer, who specializes in networking and team performance. In the age of 24, he has already been to the world’s biggest youth short film festival (NFFTY) and the world’s biggest short film festival (Clermont Ferrand Film Festival).More than ever he is now determined to learn the best different possible workflows and collective overview of any VR-Experience he is on.Theis Holmstrup, ProducerTheis is a creative producer who has a vast experience in creating internet video content and a core focus in producing commercials for television and creating VR-content. With a small team, Theis previously developed an ambitious and immersive VR experience that deals with sexual abuse and harassment.Jeppe Klausen, Unity/VR-TechnicianJeppe is a 24-year-old filmmaker and musician, and he has various skills in the technical segment. He has worked with VR equipment such as 360 VR cameras and software that is compatible with this new media format. Jeppe also has a lot of experience with audio in both film and music and knows how to construct a credible sound mix and master.--------Thank you so much for showing interest in Deceptive Inc.Please make sure to follow our journey on these platforms:Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/deceptiveincInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/deceptive_incAlso, feel free to contacts us if you have any question! - We'll love to answer any question regarding Deceptive Inc or any uncertainty to why you should donate to the experience.Be sure to read our FAQ too for extra details concerning the experience!Thanks again and bye for now!

story:
This is a Keep it All (KiA) funding project. You are guaranteed to get the perks you pay for. Since I didn't want to give too much away in the preview video, it's hard to tell that the game is actually fun and challenging.

"Beyond our Galaxy, there is a planet that spins closer to a star than our own. However, this world is controlled by greedy slime-monsters, and only Uriel can stop them."


Hello, I'm Derek Evers. 

I'm an Entrepreneurial Enthusiast, but I do face challenges in life. The biggest being; Crohn's disease, schizophrenia, and a bad knee from working way too much. Since I face these limitations, I've been trying to create some great digital products, as well as teach myself computer programming and web app development.

This campaign is important to me, since I feel I've created an excellent game that people will enjoy playing. Contributors will not only be helping me, but helping future customers get a fun product that might not make it into the world otherwise.


This project is the first release of Uriel for PC/Mac/Linux.

Uriel is a platform style, adventure role-playing game. 

It is a single player game. 

Although all video games are multi-media projects, I tried to design the game with a mixed-media style.

It's basically a NES game on acid.

I need funds to port the game to other devices, as well as pay developer fees for apps. 

Possible devices/apps include:

  • Android Tablets
  • iPads
  • Windows 8 app
  • Steam

If this campaign is successful, I may launch a follow-up campaign.

I also want to be able to make more games.



*Developer Fees and Equipment to port the game are my primary concern.

*Advertising Funds are only used through Independent Publishers, who need the funds more than big corporations.


All the perks are digital downloads from the cloud. You can access them any time after the early release date, set for the beginning of July 2014. You will receive an email, from me, letting you know that your perks are ready.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by using the Indiegogo share tools (under the preview video), to spread word of my campaign. Every share counts.

story:
"The raids have not stopped. We were already losing two or three able-bodied men a week! Now we just do nothing and take this injustice as sacrifice? Who do we have to bow to? What is it that comes crawling from the Mountains to take our people night after night? What God? What beast? And now, we aim to hold as we always do and stay course when it starts taking our children?"

-Speech given by Johann Albrecht to the Council of Elders, colonist of GH-17. 

What is Conclave?

Conclave is a card driven table top role playing game in the vein of Fiasco or The Quiet Year where instead of the traditional need for set up, a complex rules set and one player to act as the Game Master and facilitate the game, you set up during play, the rules are minimal but impactful and every player takes an equal role in the game.

The goal of Conclave is to simulate the meaningful and tough decisions any community's leaders must make. The players each act as a member of the governing body of the community, which can range from village elders to heads of interplanetary civilizations and everything in between.

Conclave is setting neutral, meaning it doesn't take place anywhere inherently, and can be easily adapted to any number of places and times, both real and unreal. Every quote at the head of each section in this description is taken from a trial game of Conclave, each using a different setting which was come up with during the game itself. Some examples of settings are:

  • A post zombie apocalypse group of survivors running low on supplies, stranded in rural Missouri.
  • An isolated planetary colony where people are disappearing, leaving behind only a rut in the ground, which runs to the foothills and the unexplored mountains before abruptly disappearing in the same place each time.
  • A 16th century coven of witches in Salem, Massachusetts who find that someone or something is causing famine and disease and blaming it on them.
  • A 1930s Chicago mob, who find that a rat is in their midst.

The rulebook will be full of these and other example scenarios in order to outline the mechanics of play through demonstration. There will also be several prebuilt scenarios complete with roles for each player.

A distinct change Conclave brings to the table (top), is that it is, rather than a completely collaborative game, a semi-competitive one with multiple win conditions. Every community has a pyramid of goals, with three easy goals, two medium goals, and one hard one. Easy goals are stepping stones to medium goals, and medium to hard. One of the medium goals is the prime goal and is essential to the survival of the group (the other medium and hard goals are in place so that ideally, the players can maximize the success of their community). Every player then secretly generates an individual goal based on a collaboratively generated character. At the completion of the game, points are awarded to everyone for completing the group goals and to individuals for completing their own goals. The player with the most points wins UNLESS:

1. Everyone completes the group goals without regard to their own. In this scenario, everyone is said to win.

-or-

2. The prime goal is uncompleted, in which case everyone loses regardless of individual goal completion.

This forces players to balance out their own goals and the goals of the group. Focus too much on group goals and the temptation to slip in an individual goal makes one player win. Focus too much on individual goals and no one wins. Different players will also play Conclave very differently. Conclave can be collaborative, competitive or anything in between depending on the players who play it.


"Listen, I don't have all your connections but I know one thing. Vinny over there is a rat, and every day we go without dealing with it, he brings the cops a little closer to coming down on our ass."

-Sunny the Thumb, three days before being executed for wearing a wire.

How does gameplay work?

The first step in a game of Conclave is world building. Players go around the table and establish details of the setting of the game. Either a regimented set up can be used (where a set order of properties is established: Problem, Place, People, etc.) or a free form set up (where no set order is followed, for example, one person could come up with the Problem that the last of a lineage of kings is dying, then the next could determine that the Place is the last, dying city and the third determine that the People are humans who fled into underground shelter when the bombs first dropped). This allows multiple ways of play depending on player preferences and imagination. Then, the setting is further expanded with multiple sentences detailing the state of the community in depth. 

Note: Conclave is designed to be as flexible and enjoyable as possible, so, specific settings and play styles incorporate tweaked rule sets. The rulebook includes the most common of these variants for everything for mechanical aspects of play like character creation and the end game scoring as well as setting specific aspects like having one character as a 'traitor' or ending the game at a set time, such as when the police come to investigate the strange sounds from the attic.

The second step is to determine characters. In Conclave, you never determine your own character, rather, everyone contributes to every character, as in each step of creation, characters are passed along to the next person to write the next attribute. Characters each have unique advantages (such as having a contact in the FBI) and flaws (like having a zombie-bitten daughter) that they, or other characters, can invoke during the game. 

Then, being a card driven game, 2 sub-decks are formed. Conclave uses two types of sub-decks: The event deck and the player deck. These are formed through distribution of the cards in a normal 52 card deck. The event deck determines what types of events your community will face, and the player deck determines the range of players actions towards each other. Each suit determines either the outcome of the event or the player action. Considering both sub-decks are created from the same 52 card poker deck, a game can be played with balanced decks, especially harsh events but limited player action or vice versa. The sub-decks can further be customized by the removal of cards. These sub-decks will then be shuffled.

Next, play starts. Every character is given a hand of cards and one player is chosen to be the starting narrator. An event card is flipped over and, based on suit and number, the narrator describes what happens. Then, players are allowed to respond however they'd like, through playing cards (which are only replenished by very specific draws from the event deck, and thus valuable), committing individual actions or calling for a vote. In the case of a vote, both sides of an issue are discussed, and then all players vote (unless they choose to abstain). If there is a tie nothing happens and you're forced to wait until the next round to vote again, meaning that if, for example, you can't decide whether to lock your town down from the invading orcs or mount an offensive, neither happens, and you put everyone at risk. Play continues, the narrator switching to the next player counterclockwise at the end of every turn, until an end condition is met. Many scenarios can have custom end conditions but the standard end condition is 3 turns after the prime goal is met, or when the event sub-deck runs out. 


"It's been tough, you know? Really tough. This whole werewolf thing."

-Veronica Ehlers

What is this money being used for?

The money from this campaign will be used for all of the design and preproduction work to transform an idea residing in a few spiral bound notebooks and sessions of play into an actual product. There are four rewards to choose from:

  • PDF - You will receive a PDF of Conclave as soon as it is finished for $5. You will be listed in the rulebook as a supporter.
  • POD - Through DriveThruRPG, you will be able to order a high quality Print on Demand copy of Conclave at cost. This reward costs $8. This comes with a free PDF copy as well. You will be listed in the rulebook as a supporter.
  • Character - Either you or a character of your formulation will be included in the rulebook in an example scenario. This costs $20 and comes with a PDF and POD copy as well. You will be listed in the rulebook as a character supporter. Limited to 5.
  • Scenario - A scenario of your writing, complete with setting, end condition will be used as an example in the rulebook. This costs $50 and will include a PDF and POD copy. You will be listed in the rulebook as a scenario supporter. Limited to 3.

Most of the text in Conclave is already written. All that's left to do is the design work and to pick and write the scenarios to be included with the game. In light of this, I hope to get the project done in mid November, however, the estimated delivery date is December, just in case any problems arise or if stretch goals require the addition of content. This affords me a buffer zone of a month. 


"Lets just say that everything you've ever dreamed of. Every glow, every feeling, every shadow. It's all true."

-Eldrar, Patron of the Eye

Stretch Goals

I won't make any announcements until we get over funding, but I've got a ton of cool stuff that I want to pack into Conclave but can't until I have a guarantee of a certain amount of funding, including brand new variants, fresh setting material and, if possible, a deck of custom cards!

Major stretch goals will be added to Conclave for each $1000 raised and minor ones at every $250 raised. 

So far the game includes more than a few starter scenarios, but I hope to eventually increase that number to 20 or more and also add specific illustrations for each scenario.

Stretch Goal #1-$750- 3 New scenarios!

So excited to be funded! I'll be adding 3 new scenarios to every copy of the game at $750!


Conclave was written and designed by Marco Kaisth.

This will be Heathen Kings Press' first (hopefully of many) games, and while we are using POD and not living up to the 'press' in our name, we hope to change that soon with your support. 

Everyone who pledges this project will be entitled to discounts on all future Heathen Kings products (I'm designing a low-tech space RPG about getting man kind to a livable planet and quick and hope to share it with the world after this project is sent out to backers).

I also just wrote a free game for the 2014 RPGGeek 24 Hour RPG contest. It can be found here.


Thank you for supporting indie game designers!

story:
Rollspelet Western är på väg ut i en fjärde helt reviderad upplaga, där all text, delar av regelmotorn och alla illustrationer är helt nya. Spelet tar sitt fokus i Amerika 1876 och blandar den klassiska västernmyten med pulserande storstadsliv i New York och plantagernas sydstater, där bitterheten efter Inbördeskriget fortfarande är stor. Western ger en god inblick i en dynamisk och spännande epok, där den tekniska utvecklingen går framåt med stormsteg och ändrar hela landet. Rollpersonerna möter kallhamrade desperados, skoningslösa prisjägare, omutliga lagmän, tappra indiankrigare, korrumperade indianagenter och svavelosande domedagspredikanter. Ranchkrig blossar upp, guldruscher lockar tusentals lycksökare, byar lever i skräck för stora banditgäng och rättvisa skipas av den som drar snabbast. Western är ett spel för äventyrare och hjältar.

Då denna kampanj är avslutad kommer vi att förbereda de två grundböckerna Rollpersonen och Regelboken för tryck. Samtidigt har vi så otroligt mycket extra vi vill göra för att expandera spelet ytterligare – och med din hjälp hoppas vi att det blir möjligt.

Här nedan kan du ladda ner en förhandstitt på några uppslag ur Grundbok I och II.

  

Förhandstitt Rollpersonen                                Förhandstitt Regelboken

Här hittar du en beskrivning av de olika perks du kan välja för att stödja utgivningen av Westerns fjärde utgåva. Alla priser är i Euro. Inom parentes anger vi priserna i svenska kronor enligt den valutakurs som gällde då crowdfundingen inleddes, men vi ansvarar inte får valutakursförändringar.

Alla priser inkluderar frakt inom Sverige. Lägg till 20€ för frakt inom Europa.

Ditt stöd betyder mycket för oss. Det ger oss möjlighet att lägga mer tid på spelutveckling och ge ut fler tillbehör till vårt favoritspel. Alla som deltar i crowdfundingen kommer att bli tackade i Grundbok 2: Regelboken. Väljer du någon av våra Limited Edition-perks blir du tackad på Guldklimpsnivå, tar du grundböckerna i standardutförande tackas du på silvernivå och väljer du någon annan form av stöd står du med under ”Bly”. 

€19 (175 kr) Western i bilder

Några av de bästa illustrationerna Lukas Thelin har gjort till Western. Bilderna har tryckts på tjockare papper och ges ut i en begränsad och signerad utgåva. De har därefter lagts i en mapp som pryds av omslaget till Westerns regelbok. Sätter du upp bilderna på väggen kan du sedan med fördel använda mappen för ditt rollformulär och andra anteckningar inför ert Westernspelande.

€24 (220 kr) En Handfull Artiklar (PDF)

Denna samlingsvolym är exklusiv för Westerns Crowdfundingkampanj. I sitt nuvarande utförande består En Handfull Artiklar av 34 olika artiklar, många helt nyskrivna och unika för crowdfundingen. Men det finns även med westernartiklarna ur Fenix med – nu omarbetade för den nya upplagan av spelet.Är intresset tillräckligt stort kommer vi att erbjuda en möjlighet att uppgradera till en tryckt bok.

€25 (230 kr) En Handfull Äventyr (PDF)

Exklusiv samlingsvolym för denna crowdfunding. Den innehåller tidigare opublicerade äventyr som Revolverns Lag, Frihetens pris, Kalla Hjärtan, Förrädarnas skatt, Det stora äventyret, En pyramid i New York, Djävulen i vitt och svart och Kuppen i Mission Hill samt fyra kortare äventyr som tidigare publicerats i Fenix och som nu har omarbetats för Western IV. I nuläget är äventyrssamlingen över 200 sidor. Om kampanjen går bra kommer vi att erbjuda en möjlighet att uppgradera till en tryckt bok.

€26 (240 kr) Gunslinger

Vapenkortlek

    Inga delmål under denna kampanj kommer att försena trycket av Westerns två grundböcker Rollpersonen och Regelboken. Istället har vi valt att ge ut två unika samlingsvolymer – En handfull artiklar respektive En handfull äventyr - i pdf-format. Dessa två samlingar kommer endast att finnas tillgängliga under denna kampanj. Där samlas en del tidigare material med nytt, tidigare opublicerat. Andra typer av delmål är att vi garanterar utgivningen av nya tillbehör, och när en titel på detta sätt blir upplåst kan du också beställa den. I en del fall har vi valt att sätta delmål som utökar dessa nya titlar med mer material.

    I listan över delmål som följer har vi valt att markera varje nivå med en av tre olika symboler. Sheriffstjärnan markerar att det tillägg vi vill göra är antingen att vi förbinder oss att trycka en helt bok till Western, eller att vi utökar någon tryckt bok till Western på något sätt. Kortleken markerar att samlingsvolymen En Handfull Artiklar utökas med nytt material, medan Derringern visar att utökningen sker i den andra samlingsvolymen, En Handfull Äventyr.

    I månens klara sken

Dessa belöningar är bara tillgängliga för dig som deltar i vår crowdfunding (eller har förhandsbokat Western IV sedan tidigare). Vad det blir för belöning varje gång avslöjar vi först då målet har passerats. För att göra det extra tydligt att det är dags för en Belöningsnivå har vi markerat alla dessa med ett guldmynt, en double eagle från 1876.

    • 16-sidigt äventyr - Alla som deltar i vår crowdfunding, eller har förhandsbeställt Western IV, kommer att få ett exklusivt äventyr som inte går att beställa efter crowdfundingen.

    • Texas Ranger - Specialskriven och illustrerad bonusroll med egna livsöden. Skickas i pdf-format.

    Under de år vi har utvecklat Westerns fjärde utgåva har vi arbetat parallellt med frilansare för att kunna hålla en hög utgivningstakt när spelet väl släppts. Under crowdfundingens gång kommer flera av dem att bli upplåsta, vilket innebär att vi garanterar att de blir av och du kunna skaffa dem som helt nya perks under kampanjen. De böcker som ligger närmast är Grundbok III: Amerika 1876, Dakota & Deadwood, New Mexico & Santa Fe, Postorderkatalogen samt New Orleans. Du kan även hjälpa oss att utöka dessa moduler med extra material, framför allt i form av fler spelledarpersoner och äventyrsuppslag, som finns med som egna delmål.

    Den största nyheten är dock att vi är beredda att garantera en stor äventyrskampanj i tre delar, förutsatt att den blir upplåst och dessa delmål uppnådda. Det blir ett renodlat Åskfågelnprojekt, där Anders och Tove Gillbring skriver materialet, medan Lukas Thelin illustrerar.

    Grundbok III: Amerika 1876

    I Amerika 1876 står de forna nordstaterna för den ekonomiska och politiska makten. Här görs överenskommelser i slutna rum som betyder skillnad på liv och död i resten av landet. I industrialismens skugga växer slummen – och reformrörelser som nykterhetsrörelsen, suffragetterna och abolitionisterna. I den politiska och byråkratiska maktapparaten är korruptionen utbredd, alla kan köpas och makt för maktens egen skull är ledstjärna.

    I de forna sydstaterna vädrar rasisterna morgonluft då den militära ockupationen rullas tillbaka och det direkta politiska styret från norr avslutas. Ku Klux Klan har svårare att verka öppet, men den organiserade rasismen breder ut sig. Gevärsklubbar där alla är klädda likadant driver politiskt propaganda i formation och med vapen i hand – på dagarna genom att skjuta i luften och visa upp sig, på kvällar och nätter genom hotfulla och våldsamma besök hos svarta, idealister och profitörer från norr. Redeemers pratar om delstaternas rätt till självstyre och att skatt innebär ofrihet och korruption, men deras förslag leder till rasistisk särbehandling. Militären saknar mandat att ingripa mot det rasistiska våldet. Rasisterna möter dock motstånd, på orter som New Orleans har svarta makt och är fruktade även i bredare kretsar (rykten om voodoo hjälper till).

    I västern möts alla intressen. Hit tar sig människor i hopp om en bättre framtid. Många lockas av drömmen om lättbrutet guld, andra har lämnat fattigdomen i Europa för en egen farm. En del söker äventyr, letar försvunna skatter, drar runt mellan spelhålor i Kansas boskapsstäder, osv. Andra vill bara vara ifred. De flesta ser indianer som ett hinder. Vissa har personliga skäl att frukta och hata indianerna, andra vill bara åt deras mark. Indiankrigens centrum är Black Hills. Där har de vita hittat guld, och i depressionens skugga kan en ny guldrusch få igång ekonomin igen, så indianernas reservat är i vägen. I Arizona leder Geronimo apachernas motstånd. San Francisco är porten mot Asien, med ett stort Chinatown.

    Amerika 1876 är en mångfacetterad och dynamisk spelvärld, med plats flera många olika sorters äventyr. Vi har proppat denna grundbok full med beskrivningar av organisationer och sammanslutningar till ögonblicksbilder av vad som händer i olika delar av landet.

    Boken trycks i fyrfärg med hårda pärmar.
    Släpps Q2 2015.

    Amerika 1876 – Gruvmagnater
    George Hearst kommer att få sällskap av flera illustrerade gruvmagnater i avsnittet om Gruvdrift. Det kommer även att ingå äventyrsförslag kopplade till gruvdrift. 

    Amerika 1876 – Boskapsbaroner
    Avsnittet Boskapsindustrin i kampanjboken Amerika 1876 kommer att utökas med flera illustrerade boskapsbaroner. Detta är personer som kan fungera som allt ifrån uppdragsgivare till antagonister för rollpersonerna.

    Amerika 1876 – Diligenskungar
    Avsnittet Diligenser i kampanjboken Amerika 1876 kommer att utökas med flera illustrerade diligenskungar som William Fargo och Henry Wells samt äventyrsuppslag som kretsar runt diligenser och fraktbolag.

    Amerika 1876 – Järnvägsbaroner
    Avsnittet om järnvägar i kampanjboken Amerika 1876 kommer att utökas med flera illustrerade järnvägsbaroner samt äventyrsuppslag som kretsar runt järnvägen.

    Amerika 1876 - Suffragetter
    Suffragettrörelsen kommer att läggas till som en ny sammanslutning.

    Amerika 1876 - Irländska organisationer
    Kapitlet om Sammanslutningar i Amerika 1876 kommer att utökas med ett avsnitt om irländska organisationer som Feniska brödraskapet, Clan na Gael och Mollie Maguires. Många som kämpar för ett fritt Irland tvingas lämna den gröna ön för att undkomma britterna, men kampen och motståndet fortsätter i USA. I detta avsnitt berättar vi mer om olika organisationer, deras planer, nyckelpersoner (med bild) samt äventyrsuppslag. Materialet kan användas som bakgrund för rollpersonen eller som motståndare eller allierade i ett äventyr eller en kampanj.

    Amerika 1876 - Nykterhetsrörelsen
    Kapitlet om Sammanslutningar i Amerika 1876 kommer att utökas med ett avsnitt om nykterhetsrörelsen, och några av de mest hängivna i kampen för att förbjuda alkohol. Självfallet blir det illustrerade spelledarpersoner och äventyrsuppslag kopplade till denna organisation.

    Amerika 1876 – Frimurare
    Vi lägger till Frimurare bland sammanslutningarna i Grundbok III: Amerika 1876, tillsammans med en illustrerad spelledarperson och äventyrsuppslag. Få organisationer är lika inflytelserika och de flesta hemliga sällskap har sneglat på Frimurarna när de har lagt upp sin egen struktur.

    New Orleans

    Ny kampanjbok till Western IV om en stad som inte liknar någon annan – och omgivningen runt omkring New Orleans. Joakim Andersson har skrivit denna omfattande stadsmodul, där ett pulserande nöjesliv blandas med misär, korruption, plantageliv och voodoo. Det kryllar av platsbeskrivningar, illustrerade personer och äventyrsuppslag inom allsköns områden. Dessutom ingår en liten turistbroschyr som kan delas ut till nyanlända rollpersoner på besök.

      Denna samlingsvolym är exklusiv för Westerns Crowdfundingkampanj, du kommer bara att hitta den här. I sitt grundutförande innehåller den tidigare opublicerade artikeln Santa Fes Spritualistiska Förening, en sammanslutning som presenteras med spelledarpersoner och äventyrskrokar. Dessutom har vi med de bästa Westernartiklarna ur Fenix, som nu fått en ordentlig genomarbetning för att anpassas helt till den nya upplagan av spelet (alla spelvärden har konverterats, materialet sätts om i Westerns nya mallar, etc).

      Sedan hoppas vi förstås att samlingen kommer att innehålla väldigt mycket mer innan vi är klara, inte minst eftersom vi haft kontakt med flera av våra favoritskribenter och bett dem bidra med extra material som kan bli upplåst via delmål. En del namn är gamla Westernbekanta, som Henrik Örnebring, Christoffer Krämer, Johan Englund, Joakim Andersson samt Michael Pettersen och Gunilla Jonsson. Andra står beredda att skriva sitt första större Westernmaterial, som Kenneth Hite, Anders Blixt, Marcus Brissman och Arvid Björklund. Vårt mål är att det här skall bli en galet välmatad samling med massor av inspirerande material. Blir intresset tillräckligt stort för att kunna göra ett tryck rimligt rent kostnadsmässigt kommer vi även att lägga till en möjlighet att uppgradera till en tryckt bok.
