If you have any other safety or comfort concerns, info@quest.org will reach the Secretary, who will be happy to check or arrange whatever will help you have a good time. Her happiness is certain, as she is the one writing this sentence.

  What if...?
 What's going to happen if we don't meet our goal? Well, we'll be sad, obviously, but the closer we get to our goal, the more likely we'll be able to cut enough corners to push the game through anyway. Of course, it won't be as awesome as it could be without your help.
On a more cheerful note, Quest as an organization has been running LARP events since 1991. We have solid experience, both in our GM staff and in general. We even have a proposal ready! In short, if we do make our goal, there need be no worry about the game failing to take place, pending unavoidable circumstances, natural disasters, and so forth. Past weekend games have been a lot of fun, controlled chaos and all, and we have every expectation of being able to bring you an equally delightful experience.
And if we exceed our goal? The first stretch goal will be revealed when we reach $3500, so if you want to see what exciting bonuses we've thought of, you know how to make that happen!

  What else can I do?

Don't have money to contribute? Or don't have enough money to commit to registration right away? That's fine with us! Tell your friends, tell their friends, just spread enthusiasm around until some of it sticks!Pre-registration will be open until a month before the game, so even if you can't pay right now, you're not missing your chance to attend at the reduced price. Contact longwayhome@quest.org at any time to register or ask game-related questions.Or, if you have more time than money, we can always use NPC staff! Fighters, face characters, and kitchen staff would all be deeply appreciated at any level of experience. Again, contact longwayhome@quest.org if you're interested.

story:
I'm Simon from bloomengine.com. I want to continue creating interactive fiction and developing Blink! a web-based engine for making hypertext interactive fiction. 


I have a day job and do some web design, but donations will go toward helping me make more of this, this (an example Blink! game) and this instead of making people's logo's bigger. Donate something and you'll get a copy of the Blink! engine to make your own games. (Rough beta version)


What I want to do:

Over the next 2 months, I want to make a short piece of interactive fiction that fuses text and illustration together. The illustration won't just decorate the text, but will be intrinsically tied to it, completing it. I also want to keep developing the Blink! engine.

What the next game will be about: 

In a world without humans or organic life, a robot artist has a terminal disease known as Rust. In his last days of his life, he obsesses with finishing his final sculpture: a tour de force to prove to the art critics that he still can work his magic. Hopefully his arm won't fall off before he finishes. His sister obsesses with giving him treatment to lengthen his lifespan. In the periphery, his little brother daydreams about finding a real-life human near the ruins of a nearby city. 




This will be a short game focusing on mood and characters rather than puzzles. It should be playable in 20 minutes to half an hour. Art style will be approximately like the stuff on my site.


Impact of donations:
Covering daily costs: food, shelter and clothing so I can spend more time making stuff that you will hopefully enjoy and to develop tools for you to create your own games. 


What I want to add to the engine:
* Offline play mode
* Debugging tools that can run locally on the computer
* Improving the save game system so it uses a compressed URL which is not human readable.
* Different visual template styles. 


If you like the stuff I've done, please spread the word. 
Thanks

story:
Our Story

Me and my brother have the dream to make a mobile game that will please from the very casual gamer to the hardcore gamer in a very entertaining yet challenging manner,

this is though to be a survival horror~ish game that will start pretty easy for the casual gamers but picking up as you make more points and proof worthy of the hardest challenges.

We just started the game. he is a graphics designer and animator and I'm going to be doing all the programming, yet even though we are just 2 people right now, we need to buy computers and software needed to complete the development of our title.


The Impact

This game is a game made by gamers, for gamers. We have been playing games all our life, and we know what differentiates a good game from a bad game, and we strongly believe this game can create a new pop culture trend in the community. 


What We Need & What You Get

As previously mentioned, we will need money to buy computers and software to bring our vision to life, but trust me, your generous donations will not go unnoticed. We are yet to think of good ways to thank all of you people for the support but ideas go from having your name implanted in the actual game to special avatars for you to play it with.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money, we completely understand, but there is still way you can help. Word of mouth is a very powerful too. Tell your friends, tweet at some of your favorite internet personalities! The more people see our campaign, the higher the chances that we can make this happen.

story:
^Demo progress ^ The first Demo is complete :D




What type of game is it?
Wicked Love is a western version of an Otome game (a visual novel that combines  elements of romance simulations with some rpg and adventure game mechanics like stat building and mini- games/puzzles). DRM-FREE Copies of the game will definitely be available and I hope to release for Window, iOS, and Ubuntu for Linux, and if greenlighted, Steam.

THIS WILL BE A COMPLETE GAME, it will NOT be released in chapters that you must buy, or pay extra to unlock other story elements. I personally loathe episodic Otome games, and I find it is impossible to immerse myself in the story as a player.

What is the story?

The player controls Eerie Bones, an eccentric human woman with plenty of moxie who mysteriously wakes up in a house called Limbo in the captivating underworld city of Tartarus, a city divided into 7 different districts, each one is heavily plagued by a different sin. Without knowing how or why she ended up in Limbo, Eerie finds out she only has 100 days to prevent a rather grim fate. You will decide Eerie's destiny as you make difficult choices, solve puzzles, and develop relationships with the denizens of Tartarus. With 7 different romance options (including a same sex option), 21 different endings, and an unlockable secret path, plenty of easter eggs, can you uncover the mystery surrounding Eerie's fate?

Anything else?

Wicked Love may have a name that sounds like a cliche' paranormal romance novel, but this playful game engages the player in an adventure to reflect on the way love, choices, vices, and virtues shape our paths. It is both thoughtful and scandalous. If you enjoy otome games, Catherine or the Persona series, or choose your own adventure novels then this game is for you :D



-Why I am asking for help-

The Game skeleton is already completely coded, so there is no worries on the game not being completed, as an avid contributor to crowdfunding I thought it was imperative before I sought any outside investment help that I was in a position where at least I could publish the game as is. So no matter what you will see the finished game and the release date is set around July at the latest perhaps I can even release it earlier.


With stretch goals I really would like to make this a unique otome experience by making it much more inclusive and diverse for all pIayers, if I raise enough money I can implement things like a male version of the protagonist, different skin tone options for the main character so that more players can relate to the main character.  If I raised $18,000 I would love to hire an illustrator to do traditional Japanese Anime style character skins so players could play with either the default graphic novel art style characters or more of a lovely traditional bishounen Otome art style. It would provide a new experience to the players and help with the replay value. I would simply release that version with the final game, so with the default game you would also get hot Bishies version. :3

I need help funding more of the art assets mostly to make this game provide the best player experience. The list of things that are already completed finished are the following:

  • The entire game skeleton including mini games/puzzles has been coded
  • 6 out of the 10 characters have been finished
  • Most of the soundtrack, I have the background music already licensed and implemented.
  • 6 out of 12 backgrounds
  • 2 out 21 cg scenes
  • The interface assets (i.e buttons/menus/stat bars) are finished.
  • The writing/ plots are finished as well as the story branches

I have hired professional artists from respected companies around the world with excellent work history, I did this to insure I would not have a team member that would bail on the project during production as they are all contracted professionals. I did not do any of the art except the interface art as I have been quite busy with the coding. This means you will not receive any excuse after this campaign of delays due to issues frequently incurred by people who form a project team from friends. The budget is for the following:

4 characters x $125 = $500

3 song licenses x $60 = $180

6 backgrounds x $115 = $690

19 CG scenes x $150 = $2,850

Animations (nothing crazy here as that would cost a lot and I am not going to ask that on an indie game, but I would love to have an animation for the intro) =$800

Voice acting about 30 minutes for each main character and 15 minutes for each non main character character x 10 characters = $4500

Publishing fees to different platforms = $400

This comes to a total of $9,920

If the budget is not met that is okay, :D I am still releasing the game, I will most likely cut the voice acting down and animation out if the budget is smaller.  The most important things are the characters, backgrounds, and cgs.



-To show our appreciation-

Please check out our perks for contributing, thank you!



-The Risks/Challenges-

To be honest, Wicked Love will be created even without the success of the crowdfunding, but without these supporters the scope and quality I would love to give players for a more unique gaming experience will certainly not be achieved. To me it is very important to gauge a game's success by how much fun and entertainment it provides the players. To me this project's real success hinges on support.

Unforeseen events happen, unlucky things happen, and something unexpected will surely occur as this is the game development business, but rest assured I am the type of person who doesn't see an obstacle as a lay down and play dead moment, but I like the challenge of figuring out a way to accomplish something within certain parameters. which is most likely from the gamer side of me, or the inner Sherlock fan :D.

-Other Ways You Can Help-

Some people just can't contribute with their pocket paper, but that is okay :D

  • Please feel free to get the word out about the campaign (you can use the share tools), I appreciate your time, thank you :3
  • If anyone desires to contribute artistically via game assets (graphics, scenes, animation, music,etc..) you will receive everything from the Acedia Perk and be credited. (this help would reduce overall asset costs in the budget and make the game even more dynamic, I like the combing art styles in a way that is cohesive and engaging (similar to graphic novels like Sandman or Fables)
  • If anyone has the time to spare and is familiar with coding, I coded the entire game myself, and would love to ask a few questions.  (this would reduce any development fees I might have to place the budget towards to enhance the player experience, or fine tune game mechanics)
In turn I am also very willing to help anyone else if they have questions about creating a game, or digital art. Perhaps if you or a child you know is interested in how to get started, and whatnot. If you have any questions let me know, thanks for taking the time to look at this campaign.

story:
If you want to order Constructo once the campaign is closed, please contact us on hello@inventurecloud.com and we will tell you how to book it.

Si quieres encargar Constructo una vez terminada la campaña, por favor envíanos un email a hello@inventurecloud.com y te diremos cómo realizar el pedido.

------------ (Versión en español más abajo) -----------------

In Constructo 2 players face off to see who raises more towers. No matter who is involved in the construction of a tower, whoever puts the last piece wins that tower.

This exciting game of minimalist aesthetics has been endorsed by many experts and fans of boardgames and we now seek your help to launch it into production. The rules are very easy to learn, and as a game with great strategic and tactical depth you will enjoy many hours of fun with friends or family.

“Abstract games do not usually win competitions, but when you do find one with this great combination of moves, possibilities, boards, with the simplicity of herimis... Then, you clearly have a winner for the competition.” Teresa Serván (Jury of VI Award of Granollers 2013)

Awards: Winner VI award of Granollers 2013, winner Inventure Cloud 2014.

Rules of the game

2 players  |  15 minutes  |  +12 age

The goal is to build towers on top of the opponent's bases, the winner is the one with the most bases on the top of the towers at the end of the game. Players can perform one of these actions per turn:

  • Place a base on an empty tile.
  • Move a base to an adjacent tile on top of an oponent's base (once there is more than one base on a single tile, they cannot be moved).

The game ends when a player can no longer perform any action. Each tower scores 1 point to  the player who placed their base on top of it. The winner will be the one with the most points from 2 rounds.

Check extended rules here

Components: 9 hexagonal tiles, 9 plain bases, 9 engraved bases.
Measures: Tiles, 60 x 55 mm. | Diam. bases: 3 of 40mm, 3 of 30mm, 3 of 15 mm.


About us

Author

Santiago Eximeno is a game designer with over 10 years of experience.

Santi is devoted to seeking perfection in game design, reducing it to its minimum necessary elements to achieve a complex strategy from minimalist mechanics.




   


Editor

The final aspect of the game has been designed within the community of collaborative invention InventureCloud where any creator may ask for support with a product's design. Depending on a product's popularity it will go through various stages of development until it's ready for commercial launch.

Goal of the campaign

The first edition of Constructo will be produced by lasercut at FabLab Valencia. Costs of development and prototypes may reach 3,000€. Half of the costs will be met by Inventure Cloud and with your generosity we hope to fund the rest with this campaign.

As a thank you for helping us, you will appear on the game as a contributor and receive these great rewards:

--- Rewards ------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT, please add the following shipping costs to your reward:
HAND PICK 0€ (Valencia, Madrid or Berlin)
SPAIN  4€  |  EUROPE  10€  |  REST OF THE WORLD  20€

  • 1 Game travel version  14€
    MD tiles, plywood bases, manual, cardboard box


  • 1 Game maker version  24€ (picture below)
    MD tiles, plywood bases, manual, MD box

    •    

  • 1 Game premium version  54€
    MD tiles, wood bases, manual, wood box
    (Picture coming soon)

--- Add-ons ----------------------------------------------------------------------

  • Print & Play blueprints +2€
    Print it on cardboard and play with this DIY version
  • Lasercut blueprints +5€
    Make your own Constructo with the lasercut blueprints of the game and box    
  • Engraved Constructo keyring +4€
    Get your own exclusive MD keyring
  • Custom lasercut engraving +10€
    Send us your own text to customize your Constructo tiles or box

Every bit counts

If you can not contribute financially, but you like Construct and want to support us, please share our campaign!

We are giving 2 games away among those of you who help us to promote Constructo with these initiatives:

Rate Constructo on BoardGameGeek

Try the print&play version and rate it here. We are giving away 1 Constructo to a lucky one from all the ratings we receive, until the end of the campaign.

Share it with your friends

Tweet the campaign or share it on Facebook. The tweet or post with the most retweets during the campaign, will receive a free Constructo.

Use the hashtag #inventure on Twitter and mention our Facebook page, so we can find you ;)


Thank you so much for your support! This would be impossible without you.
Santi


     

collaborated in the development of this project.
----------------------- VERSION EN ESPAÑOL -----------------------------

En Constructo 2 jugadores se enfrentan para ver quién levanta más torres. No importa quién participa en su construcción, lo único que cuenta es quién coloca la última pieza en la torre.

Este apasionante juego de estética minimalista ha sido avalado por numerosos expertos y aficionados a juegos de tablero y ahora buscamos tu ayuda para editarlo. Sus reglas son muy fáciles de aprender y a la vez contienen una profundidad estratégica que te hará disfrutar de muchísimas horas de diversión con tus amigos o en familia.

“Generalmente los juegos abstractos no ganan concursos, pero cuando te encuentras uno con esa gran combinación de jugadas, posibilidades, tableros [...] la sencillez del herimis, pues claramente tienes un ganador para el concurso.” Teresa Serván (jurado VI Premio Granollers 2013)

Premios: Ganador VI premio de Granollers 2013, ganador Inventure Cloud 2014.

Reglas del juego

2 jugadores  |  15 minutos  |  +12 años

El objetivo del juego es levantar torres sobre las bases del contrario. El ganador es aquel con más bases en la cima de las torres en una partida de dos rondas. Los jugadores pueden realizar una y solo una de estas acciones en su turno:

  • Colocar una base propia en una loseta vacía.
  • Mover, siempre que no haya más de una base en la misma loseta, una base propia a una loseta adyacente sobre una base del contrario.

El juego termina cuando un jugador ya no puede realizar ninguna acción. Cada jugador suma un punto por cada torre que tenga una de sus bases en la cima. El ganador será aquel que sume más puntos en 2 rondas.

Consulta aquí las instrucciones completas

Componentes: 9 losetas hexagonales, 9 bases blancas, 9 bases grabadas.
Medidas losetas: 60 x 55 mm. | Diám. bases: 3 de 40mm, 3 de 30mm, 3 de 15 mm.


Sobre nosotros

Autor

Santiago Eximeno es un diseñador de juegos con más de 10 años de experiencia.

Santi tiene la vocación de buscar la perfección en el diseño de juegos, reduciéndolos a los mínimos elementos necesarios para conseguir una estrategia compleja desde una mecánica lo más minimalista posible.



   


Editora

El aspecto final del juego se ha diseñado en la comunidad de invención colaborativa InventureCloud donde cualquier creador puede pedir apoyo con el diseño de un producto. Los productos más populares van pasando de fase hasta su lanzamiento comercial.

Objetivo de la campaña

La primera edición de Constructo la vamos a producir por corte láser en FabLab Vlc. Para cubrir los costes de desarrollo y prototipos necesitamos 3.000€. La mitad la aporta Inventure Cloud y la otra mitad esperamos conseguirla con esta campaña.

Como agradecimiento por ayudarnos, aparecerás como colaborador en el juego y recibirás estas estupendas recompensas:

--- Recompensas ------------------------------------------

IMPORTANTE, añade los siguientes gastos de envío a tu recompensa:
RECOGIDA EN MANO 0€ (Valencia, Madrid o Berlin)
ESPAÑA  4€  |  EUROPA  10€  |  RESTO DEL MUNDO  20€

  • Juego formato viaje  14€
    Losetas de DM, fichas de contrachapado, instrucciones, caja de cartón

  • Juego formato Maker  24€
    Losetas de DM, fichas de contrachapado, instrucciones, caja de DM

    •    

  • Juego formato Premium  54€
    Losetas de DM, fichas de madera grabadas, instrucciones, caja de madera grabada
    (fotos próximamente)

--- Add-ons, para añadir a cualquier recompensa ----------------------

  • Planos para Print & Play +2€
    Imprímelo en cartulina y juega con esta versión DIY
  • Planos para corte láser +5€
    Fabríca tu propio Constructo con los planos CNC del juego y la caja
  • Llavero Constructo grabado +4€
    Consigue un exclusivo llavero en DM.
  • Inscripción láser personalizada +10€
    Envíanos un texto de tu elección para añadir a la caja o el tablero

Todo suma

Si no puedes contribuir económicamente, pero te gusta Constructo y quieres apoyarnos, ¡comparte la campaña!

Regalamos 2 Juegos formato Maker entre quienes nos ayudéis a promover Constructo con una de estas iniciativas:

Valora Constructo en BoardGameGeek

Prueba la versión print & play de Constructo y valóralo aquí. Sorteamos 1 juego entre todos los ratings obtenidos hasta el final de la campaña.

Compártelo con tus amigos

Twittea la campaña o compártela en Facebook. El tweet o post que tenga más retweets o sea compartido más veces durante la campaña, conseguirá un juego Constructo.

Para twitter utiliza el hashtag #inventure y para facebook menciona nuestra página, para que podamos encontrarte ;)


¡Muchas gracias por vuestro apoyo! Sin vosotros esto sería imposible.
Santi

En el desarrollo de este proyecto han colaborado:
story_txt:
If you want to order Constructo once the campaign is closed, please contact us on hello@inventurecloud.com and we will tell you how to book it.Si quieres encargar Constructo una vez terminada la campaña, por favor envíanos un email a hello@inventurecloud.com y te diremos cómo realizar el pedido.------------ (Versión en español más abajo) -----------------In Constructo 2 players face off to see who raises more towers. No matter who is involved in the construction of a tower, whoever puts the last piece wins that tower.This exciting game of minimalist aesthetics has been endorsed by many experts and fans of boardgames and we now seek your help to launch it into production. The rules are very easy to learn, and as a game with great strategic and tactical depth you will enjoy many hours of fun with friends or family.“Abstract games do not usually win competitions, but when you do find one with this great combination of moves, possibilities, boards, with the simplicity of herimis... Then, you clearly have a winner for the competition.” Teresa Serván (Jury of VI Award of Granollers 2013)Awards: Winner VI award of Granollers 2013, winner Inventure Cloud 2014. 
Rules of the game
2 players  |  15 minutes  |  +12 ageThe goal is to build towers on top of the opponent's bases, the winner is the one with the most bases on the top of the towers at the end of the game. Players can perform one of these actions per turn:Place a base on an empty tile.
Move a base to an adjacent tile on top of an oponent's base (once there is more than one base on a single tile, they cannot be moved).
The game ends when a player can no longer perform any action. Each tower scores 1 point to  the player who placed their base on top of it. The winner will be the one with the most points from 2 rounds.Check extended rules hereComponents: 9 hexagonal tiles, 9 plain bases, 9 engraved bases.Measures: Tiles, 60 x 55 mm. | Diam. bases: 3 of 40mm, 3 of 30mm, 3 of 15 mm.About us









Author
Santiago Eximeno is a game designer with over 10 years of experience.
Santi is devoted to seeking perfection in game design, reducing it to its minimum necessary elements to achieve a complex strategy from minimalist mechanics.




     



Editor
The final aspect of the game has been designed within the community of collaborative invention InventureCloud where any creator may ask for support with a product's design. Depending on a product's popularity it will go through various stages of development until it's ready for commercial launch.


Goal of the campaign
The first edition of Constructo will be produced by lasercut at FabLab Valencia. Costs of development and prototypes may reach 3,000€. Half of the costs will be met by Inventure Cloud and with your generosity we hope to fund the rest with this campaign.As a thank you for helping us, you will appear on the game as a contributor and receive these great rewards:


--- Rewards ------------------------------------------------
IMPORTANT, please add the following shipping costs to your reward:HAND PICK 0€ (Valencia, Madrid or Berlin) SPAIN  4€  |  EUROPE  10€  |  REST OF THE WORLD  20€






1 Game travel version  14€ MD tiles, plywood bases, manual, cardboard box



1 Game maker version  24€ (picture below) MD tiles, plywood bases, manual, MD box

    

1 Game premium version  54€ MD tiles, wood bases, manual, wood box(Picture coming soon)





--- Add-ons ----------------------------------------------------------------------



Print & Play blueprints +2€Print it on cardboard and play with this DIY version


Lasercut blueprints +5€Make your own Constructo with the lasercut blueprints of the game and box     


Engraved Constructo keyring +4€Get your own exclusive MD keyring


Custom lasercut engraving +10€Send us your own text to customize your Constructo tiles or box




Every bit counts
If you can not contribute financially, but you like Construct and want to support us, please share our campaign!We are giving 2 games away among those of you who help us to promote Constructo with these initiatives:


Rate Constructo on BoardGameGeek

Try the print&play version and rate it here. We are giving away 1 Constructo to a lucky one from all the ratings we receive, until the end of the campaign.



Share it with your friends


Tweet the campaign or share it on Facebook. The tweet or post with the most retweets during the campaign, will receive a free Constructo.
Use the hashtag #inventure on Twitter and mention our Facebook page, so we can find you ;)

Thank you so much for your support! This would be impossible without you.Santi       collaborated in the development of this project.
----------------------- VERSION EN ESPAÑOL -----------------------------En Constructo 2 jugadores se enfrentan para ver quién levanta más torres. No importa quién participa en su construcción, lo único que cuenta es quién coloca la última pieza en la torre.Este apasionante juego de estética minimalista ha sido avalado por numerosos expertos y aficionados a juegos de tablero y ahora buscamos tu ayuda para editarlo. Sus reglas son muy fáciles de aprender y a la vez contienen una profundidad estratégica que te hará disfrutar de muchísimas horas de diversión con tus amigos o en familia.“Generalmente los juegos abstractos no ganan concursos, pero cuando te encuentras uno con esa gran combinación de jugadas, posibilidades, tableros [...] la sencillez del herimis, pues claramente tienes un ganador para el 
concurso.” Teresa Serván (jurado VI Premio Granollers 2013)Premios: Ganador VI premio de Granollers 2013, ganador Inventure Cloud 2014. 
Reglas del juego2 jugadores  |  15 minutos  |  +12 añosEl objetivo del juego es levantar torres sobre las bases del contrario. El ganador es aquel con más bases en la cima de las torres en una partida de dos rondas. Los jugadores pueden realizar una y solo una de estas acciones en su turno:Colocar una base propia en una loseta vacía.
Mover, siempre que no haya más de una base en la misma loseta, una base propia a una loseta adyacente sobre una base del contrario.
El juego termina cuando un jugador ya no puede realizar ninguna acción. Cada jugador suma un punto por cada torre que tenga una de sus bases en la cima. El ganador será aquel que sume más puntos en 2 rondas.Consulta aquí las instrucciones completasComponentes: 9 losetas hexagonales, 9 bases blancas, 9 bases grabadas.Medidas losetas: 60 x 55 mm. | Diám. bases: 3 de 40mm, 3 de 30mm, 3 de 15 mm.Sobre nosotros








Autor
Santiago Eximeno es un diseñador de juegos con más de 10 años de experiencia.
Santi tiene la vocación de buscar la perfección en el diseño de juegos, reduciéndolos a los mínimos elementos necesarios para conseguir una estrategia compleja desde una mecánica lo más minimalista posible.




     



Editora
El aspecto final del juego se ha diseñado en la comunidad de invención colaborativa InventureCloud donde cualquier creador puede pedir apoyo con el diseño de un producto. Los productos más populares van pasando de fase hasta su lanzamiento comercial.


Objetivo de la campaña
La primera edición de Constructo la vamos a producir por corte láser en FabLab Vlc. Para cubrir los costes de desarrollo y prototipos necesitamos 3.000€. La mitad la aporta Inventure Cloud y la otra mitad esperamos conseguirla con esta campaña.Como agradecimiento por ayudarnos, aparecerás como colaborador en el juego y recibirás estas estupendas recompensas:


--- Recompensas ------------------------------------------

IMPORTANTE, añade los siguientes gastos de envío a tu recompensa:RECOGIDA EN MANO 0€ (Valencia, Madrid o Berlin) ESPAÑA  4€  |  EUROPA  10€  |  RESTO DEL MUNDO  20€




Juego formato viaje  14€Losetas de DM, fichas de contrachapado, instrucciones, caja de cartón



Juego formato Maker  24€Losetas de DM, fichas de contrachapado, instrucciones, caja de DM

    

Juego formato Premium  54€Losetas de DM, fichas de madera grabadas, instrucciones, caja de madera grabada(fotos próximamente)



--- Add-ons, para añadir a cualquier recompensa ----------------------



Planos para Print & Play +2€Imprímelo en cartulina y juega con esta versión DIY


Planos para corte láser +5€Fabríca tu propio Constructo con los planos CNC del juego y la caja


Llavero Constructo grabado +4€Consigue un exclusivo llavero en DM.


Inscripción láser personalizada +10€Envíanos un texto de tu elección para añadir a la caja o el tablero




Todo sumaSi no puedes contribuir económicamente, pero te gusta Constructo y quieres apoyarnos, ¡comparte la campaña!Regalamos 2 Juegos formato Maker entre quienes nos ayudéis a promover Constructo con una de estas iniciativas:


Valora Constructo en BoardGameGeek

Prueba la versión print & play de Constructo y valóralo aquí. Sorteamos 1 juego entre todos los ratings obtenidos hasta el final de la campaña.



Compártelo con tus amigos

Twittea la campaña o compártela en Facebook. El tweet o post que tenga más retweets o sea compartido más veces durante la campaña, conseguirá un juego Constructo.
Para twitter utiliza el hashtag #inventure y para facebook menciona nuestra página, para que podamos encontrarte ;)

¡Muchas gracias por vuestro apoyo! Sin vosotros esto sería imposible.Santi
En el desarrollo de este proyecto han colaborado:

story:
As some of you know, tidbyt.es is a weird experimental thing I'm currently developing. It's goal is to release biweekly games and other internet oddities, all completely free, similar to how webcomics operate. Weird little projects that are short and to the point, with some upcoming ones like Win RL Stine's Money, "Busey", and whatever this is . It's also a shitload of work, and a complete labor of love that I don't expect to make a cent off of. If you want to know more about the project, I wrote up some of my concerns and feelings and reasons here.

I'm also incredibly broke and at the point where I have to seriously consider abandoning this to take on more commercial projects, which I'm really trying to avoid (though I still am doing commercial work, time is a Thing). I think the internet needs more weird things, and I want to see more games and interactive art that can be small and bizarre. 

So I've finally gotten talked into doing this despite a lot of grumping and wounded pride on my behalf. I want to give everyone more little free games, constantly, and if it goes well enough I can bump it up to weekly updates (which is the goal). I've currently got a few finished projects ready to go, and am just (at the advice of smarter people than I) finishing up a little backlog to ensure that updates don't get derailed, and intend to launch soon providing I can just get a little further and don't have to drop it to chase some dollars to feed my obnoxious food habit.

No stretch goals, anything over will just help me keep this project going for that much longer. Any dollar contributed adds to the lifespan of how many weeks I can keep churning this stuff out.

Thanks for reading this. I will now slink off to a cave to be horribly embarrassed about my finances.

(also sorry for making 2 campaigny things, people requested an indiegogo after finding that gofundme doesn't accept paypal for some strange reason)

story:
My name is Proco and I will help in a major saving mision.
Lost Canyon will be an iOS 3D runner game for iPhone & iPad. 


After the crash of a big meteor, canyon starts to collapse. I will try to save myself and collect eggs along the way to preserve the dino species.

You gotta help me to avoid all the obstacles and collect as many eggs as possible!

 

 

 








RoosterBee is a small creative children edutainment & mobile gaming studio from Croatia, Europe.

Team is made of just a few people who want to see and hear children’s laugh.
Zvonimir Juranko - Producer & Creative Director, Mario Pispek – Programming, Andreja Krobot - Design & 3D modeling.

You can see their games on www.roosterbee.com

 



 

This is their first big project.
They are working on my game for eight months now, hoping that after a huge effort they will be able to properly introduce me to the world.


Their current projects don't bring them enough financial resources to hire a programmer, 3D animator and music composer to speed up the release of the game.

 

 

 




3.000$  
To complete the game (interface, music, wheel of fortune), launch & store graphics
5.000 $  
To make additional 3D elements & graphics (obstacles & land), new powerups & upgrades

8.000$
To build new dinos, different dinos movements & dinos personalization (shirts, hats, boots, sneekers & outfits)

12.000$
To build Android version of the game

 

 

  

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/RoosterBee or
Twitter: https://twitter.com/RoosterBee
Comment the updates or give me your thoughts & suggestions.

Thank you!
Your Proco

 

Thanks to ZIMO and Hrvoje for recording & making the video

story:
Hello Indiegogoers!

 My name is Gary O'Brien and I'm an accountant from Ireland but living in Middlesbrough. I'm here to ask you kind people for some money, with which I want to open a retro video gaming arcade. 

Our aim is to break down boundaries, and bring gamers from all walks of life, and all abilities, together. From internationally recognised professionals to the new face just starting out and everybody in between. This is the place to come, make friends and achieve your goals. We truly believe that bringing communal gaming out of the bedroom and back into the social environment is the future for the way of life we all love so much. We hope you can join us for the journey ahead.

What will be in the Retro Gaming Arcade?

We want our arcade to include all types of gamers and we will have a diverse range of machines. There will be all kinds of gaming consoles from the Megadrive to the N64. We will have a large catalogue of games spanning the last 35 years for customers to play along with regular tournaments and leagues. Every week there will be a dedicated Tekken night and we will have regular nights for classics such as Goldeneye 64 and Mario Cart. We hope to purchase some CITY machines which hold classics such as King Of Fighters 98, Street Fighter Alpha 2 and 3, Super Street Fighter 2 Turbo and Street Fighter 3: 3rd Strike. Along with this we will have lots of classic arcade machines such as Donkey Kong, Tetris, Time Crisis  and sit down Naomi DX’s running titles such as King Of Fighters 2K2, CVS2 and Guilty Gear XXAC. 

The amount of machines we have will be as a direct result of how much we can raise so if we can raise over the initial amount then we have more of everyones favourites.

Why a Retro Gaming Arcade?

Ever since I was a child I was fascinated by computer games. I spent most of childhood in my room with my best mate playing all the classics. I want to turn my passion in to a business so I can do this full time.

There is a distinct lack of places where gamers can go and play all their favourite games with their friends, or with complete strangers. People see gamers as people who sit in their house on their own when in actual fact we are very social and love to mingle with others who share their passion of video games. I want to bring all these people together, under one roof for the ultimate gaming experience. 

What will the invested money go towards?

The bulk of the money will go on buying gaming machines. Some money will be set aside for the design and look of the arcade too. We will be purchasing numerous tvs, both old type and flatscreen. We will be stocking small amounts of soft drinks and sweets as well as having some hot and cold foods, as we know that countless hours of gaming can leave one feeling hungry! 

Our intention is not to make loads of money, but to bring something great to the community. 

If anyone has any suggestions for other rewards then please let us know, we always take comments on board and want to give back something that people will enjoy. Likewise, if anyone would like to know any more information about the project or just have a question then please don't hesitate to contact us.

Thank you for taking the time to check out our Kickstarter and hopefully you believe in it enough to make a donation.

Risks and challenges

Our biggest challenge will be getting all the stock needed to make this a real success. It will require a lot of time going around and collecting games, mostly from individuals who are selling online, for the catalogue we will have in the arcade. But that is nothing that a few weeks searching online won't fix. We believe in this project 110% and no matter what challenges we face, we will beat them.

How You Can Support Retro Gaming Arcade

We understand not all of you can contribute to our campaign to open a retro gaming arcade but we'd like to give you some ways that you can help our campaign even if you don't have spare cash.

  • Social Media
    Tweet our campaign out there, Facebook it, whatever you need to do, just share it!
  • Blog or Write About Us
    If you have a website, or you write for a site, blog, or another publication why don't you do a quick write-up of our campaign?
  • Youtube
    Are you a Youtuber? Why not tell folks on Youtube about our campaign?
  • By sending us any old games or consoles that you no longer use. The more games and consoles we have the less money we need to spend on buying them!
Thanks you to everyone who has viewed our project.

story:
After much consideration and discussion, we've finally got a stretch goal decided upon- Super Boss. Super Boss will be a slightly reworked version, for your PC. Jason and I will be working hand in hand to ensure that it will retain the spirit of the Atari game, while introducing a few minor additions and tweaks.
 

If we hit this stretch goal and get to build Super Boss, ALL of you folks who have supported the Boss campaign will get a copy, before we officially publish it. 
We hope to have Super Boss ready for you by the time the cartridge and Collector's Sets ship.

BOSS is a single player shoot em up that is cut from a slightly different cloth. You pilot your ship against one massively powerful boss ship at a time. These enemies vary in size and behavior, and get stronger as you go. 

The one constant is that they're tough! It's a constant battle of attrition that tests your reflexes, patience, and planning. Before you know it, these titans are filling the screen with their shots, and mixing up their patterns. It's the equivalent of a bullet-hell shmup on the classic Atari!

 


My name is Dave Vogt, and I'm an independent game developer, publisher, and in general a huge gaming enthusiast. I have worked on a variety of things from classic Doom and Wolfenstein 3D mods in the past to PC, mobile, Wii U, and web games and software. When not developing, I care for my four children, play a fair bit of guitar, shoot for world records in games, and a bit of charity work.


The developer of BOSS, Jason Santuci, has worked in the I.T. industry for decades. At various times a Tech Monkey, Software Tester and finally Indie Game Developer. Focusing on using beginner friendly tools Jason has created over a dozen games ranging from Atari 2600, Sega Genesis and PC.

You can learn more about his myriad of work at www.gemintronic.com

 

One day not so long ago, I was talking with Jason. The conversation found its way to funding woes; when Jason generously suggested that he had an Atari 2600 game he had completed, but never took to production. That game is BOSS.

This campaign brings BOSS to life at last, and funds left after production will go towards development costs of new and upcoming games.

 

Things are extremely simple at this point. Your contribution pays for the production of your game! 

So, what can you get? 

  • BOSS Atari 2600 Cartridge, loose. That means just the labeled cart, that plays on your Atari 2600 system!
  • BOSS, boxed! This way you get the game complete with a box and manual, plus a rad handmade BOSS perler keychain!


     
  • BOSS Digital Download, which you can run in your favorite Atari 2600 emulator! Comes with a full digital manual, too!
  • Digital Wallpapers, so you can really snaz up the place with BOSS images for your PC and Mobile Devices!
  • Our Thanks! Even if you can only spare a dollar, you'll be making a huge impact. Game development is a difficult and fickle business, as rewarding as it is. Any contribution gets your name listed on the BOSS webpage- and being the internet, it's there forever!

 

The game is 100% complete, and our vendor is lined up. The only issues could be in unforseen supply chain shortages, which could lead to copies being slightly delayed, by waiting for restocks or switching vendors. We're completely ready and have contingency plans for these scenarios, however!

 

If you can't financially contribute, that's ok! You can still spread the word! Share using Indiegogo's tools, and tell your friends!

Digital Wallpapers, so you can really snaz up the place with BOSS images for your PC and Mobile Devices!
Our Thanks! Even if you can only spare a dollar, you'll be making a huge impact. Game development is a difficult and fickle business, as rewarding as it is. Any contribution gets your name listed on the BOSS webpage- and being the internet, it's there forever!


 

The game is 100% complete, and our vendor is lined up. The only issues could be in unforseen supply chain shortages, which could lead to copies being slightly delayed, by waiting for restocks or switching vendors. We're completely ready and have contingency plans for these scenarios, however!

 

If you can't financially contribute, that's ok! You can still spread the word! Share using Indiegogo's tools, and tell your friends!

story:
Short Summary

It's Halloween and I can't sit back and watch it go by without a celebration of epic proportions. I've rented the Varnum Armory (See photo below), which is a badass castle with an huge open hall, stage, catwalks, and general awesomeness. Not to mention that the proprietors told me Ghost Hunters were just there filming. Halloween in a haunted castle? Yes please.

What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately I can't pay for the whole thing myself. The amazing venue, snacks, food, a certified bartender, sound, lights, etc. is going to total about $1250. Myself, and co-hosts Jesse Stuckey and Lewis Mai will be contributing $500 to make this happen for you lovely people, but that still leaves us $750 short. Help fund the event by making pledges with tickets as your reward!

I hate even having to charge, and $15 is steep I know. So if we 100 tickets (or raise $1500), we will 'buy' everyone a drink via a drink voucher with every ticket (Must be 21+ to redeem). This way we can still fund the party but give you something extra.  

The venue cost is fixed and known, but the rest are estimates only. If we find ways to reduce the estimated costs, we will use the money to improve the quality of the event (better food, entertainment, etc.)

Breakdown Of Costs: 
$650 Venue 
$50 Crowdfunding Fees 
$50 Plates/Napkins/Utensils/Cups 
$150 Food/Drink (Non-Alcoholic) 
$150 Decorations 
$200 Bartender (TIPS certified bartender required by venue to serve alcohol) 

The Impact

If we can't get funded by the deadline, then nobody pays the pledge amount, and we'll have to try again next year.

Other Ways You Can Help

Invite your friends and get as many people (that you know please) to buy tickets as you can so we can make this thing happen! Any donations of any of the things we are budgeting for will also help make this happen!

Perk Eligibility 

Please note that to receive a ticket as a pledge reward, you must be eligible. This means you must be able to attend the event on October 29th, 6pm - 10pm. You must also know a host or someone who is also attending that can vouch for you. We are liable for the venue, which is also a museum, so we reserve the right to deny a ticket or entry. If you aren't sure if you are eligible, feel free to e-mail us first! We will be collecting names for a guest list that will be checked against ID's upon entry.

story:
Vine Back Playing Cards

  • Hello I'm Alex Day magician card expert and designer.
  • I love card magic and playing cards and thats why I want to produce these amazing cards for you. I think the back design is one of my best. They remind me of a vintage deck of playing cards. Also this will have a custom tuck box. The faces will be standard Bicycle. You will probably would want to keep them because they will go up in value.
  • The cards are printed on a 310gsm stock air cushion finish and come with a double backer and a douplicate ace of clubs.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $500.00 to send to the printers so they can make the decks and ship them to me. I've searched all over for a way to make quality cards.

I will be sending lot's of decks to contributors.

If I don't reach my total I will still produce the decks at a higher cost and sell them on ebay.

You have My word

  • This will be a good way of getting a great design to people that enjoy card magic.
  • I don't mean to brag but I have over 500 positive feedbacks from ebay buyers.

Tell your friends!

  • Tell people about this deck of playing cards by Alexander the magician. It's the newest on the block.

The cards are printed on a 310gsm stock air cushion finish and come with a double backer and a douplicate ace of clubs.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there, My name is James and I am the owner of atween.net which is a new virtual pet site unlike any other, it is unique. We are about to enter the Alpha stages of the site and would like just a little bit of funding to keep us going in terms of programming and other works as well such as art. I have been creating this game for 2 years, where I have been gathering ideas and doing my research. This is very important to me as it is my life in a way, I love the vps industry and I always wanted to have one for myself so this money would be great for me. Contributers will help us achieve to get into the Alpha stages of the site. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need £500 to spend on programming and art. This is the main part of my site and they both work with each other. I will be spending £250 on programming and £250 on art respectively. Any extra donations will be used to help me search for more contractors for the site such as moderators and admins.

I have unique perks as they will only be avaliable via this, a couple of them will be avaliable via subscription but that will not be released for a long time so you will get pre access to pets and areas.

If we dont reach our entire goal, as much money as possible will go into the programming. We will share it between programming and art.

 

The Impact

My project is very valuable to you the contributor as you get things out of it no one else will, for one you will get pride but another thing you will get are these perks, no I cant change the world in one day but I can provide employment for some people which can change the world for them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, thank you for looking at this page, thanks for even considering contributing, there is other ways you can help such as sharing this page to all your friends wether it be by word of mouth, facebook or even email. GET THE WORD OUT.

story:
❝I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.❞ – Thomas Edison

Well, one. Sure, we have learned that Indiegogo is not an ideal medium to raise funding for intangible products like websites (though it is great for tangible gadgets and independent films), but we want to say thank you to all our contributors who believed in this page (your contributions have taken us important steps closer), the press who praised us, the firms who put their names behind us, and the people who are supporting us in other ways. 

99.9% of you want to see our site launch, and this campaign has given us invaluable market research, so we're celebrating that! 

We are now looking into more fundraising options, to bring you the world's marketplace to turn your thoughts into things. Thank you again, and please see our closing update here if you'd like more info.

Creatively,

– The Team

Original pitch:

As supported by:


❝A service that we’ve been hoping for practically our entire lives❞


❝Prediction: This Is The Next Big Idea❞


❝Innovations can now be transformed into reality❞


❝An 'Ebay for Ideas'❞

A fraction of the world's most innovative companies we will beam your ideas to at launch†

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

Your Big Idea Can Lead to Big Change – For the World and in Your Pocket. 
Help Us Make that Happen.

Do you have an idea of any kind that you've never been able to get out there due to bureaucracy or prejudice, but that know could make a big difference and big money? If you have, or are a company that embraces innovation, we've got an idea...

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

❝Hell, there are no rules here - we're trying to accomplish something❞ – Edison

  • Due to funding problems, Charles Babbage died before his invention was completed. That invention was the first computer.
  • For every one we know about, how many more world-changing ideas die away because there isn't a Babbage Jr. or Mrs Babbage to carry on the fight?
  • Global innovation is being slowed by an estimated 2300% because of this.
  • The culprits are prejudice and the Patent system which – founded in 15th century Italy – is an archaic, extortionate roadblock to innovation.
  • The solution to this problem will come through the computer itself...
With your support "bid-ee-uhs" will be a revolutionary, private auction website to crowdsource & detect the billion dollar "Eureka!" moments of everyday Edisons & Mrs Edisons like you and us, when they're still affordable, and 'blind auction' them confidentially to innovative company buyers in every market - no race or gender roadblocks, and no patent required.

And you'll get a lot more than just success in return. Pledge $20 today, get $190 to use at our site. Pledge $35+, get $285! See 'Perks' for more great deals, and pledge now!

Usage examples:

  • You think of a clever company slogan you want to pitch to big ad agencies...
  • You think of or write an innovative movie idea...
  • You come up with an amazing toy or game idea...
  • You write a seriously catchy song...
  • You invent a baby or mom product that solves a big problem...
  • You discover a scientific breakthrough or formula...
  • You create an advanced type of electric car battery...
  • You have a great idea for a mobile app that could make millions...

...but until now you had no idea where to take it? Let our site turn your thoughts into things!


THE SELLER'S PROBLEM: In days of yore when you thought about selling – for example – second hand goods, it meant hoping for the best, using random shop windows and local newspapers, before eBay and Craigslist revolutionized that. Don't you think the laborious way ideas themselves are bought and sold belongs in the past too? $30,000 patents, million-to-one competitions, nerve-wracking TV shows, cold calls, sharks, dragons, unsolicited rejection letters, lawsuits... It's a minefield! Indiegogo is one of the few genuinely fun arenas for innovation out here.

So whether you’re an ad-man or soccer mum, writer or composer, architect or father of three, where do all these amazing ideas go? Sadly, often nowhere. You think about them from time to time, try to get them out there, companies refuse to open their door, the ideas just die away, and mother earth loses out. This slows down global innovation. Don't you think that's crazy?

THE BUYER'S PROBLEM: And if you were a company, would you rather: 

  • Use the best idea from your perceptibly "safe" in-house team & colleagues, or;
  • Play it safe until a great idea makes it big, then buy it, but for millions extra, or;
  • Safely receive the best new idea that day in the world, whilst it's still great value?

We have that solution. Our unique business model and groundbreaking mechanisms solve both conundrums, and rather than drive prices up like a traditional 'auction,' they predict the genetic fingerprint of future game-changers, thus saving the company money while making you a relative small fortune. See "Our big idea" below for more on all that in a moment.

And let's never forget all the women who have world-changing ideas like those of Mary Anderson (windshield wipers) or Stephanie Kwolek (Kevlar), but whose innovations instead died away because they faced gender roadblocks in male-led industries. We want to create one level playing field to turn every human being's thoughts into things, via one friendly interface.

And crucially, the whole process will take place whilst protecting both parties equally through a legally watertight confidentiality agreement, and a few trade secret special twists (they're our special sauce). Furthermore, unlike the public offerings on eBay, ours is a private portal where only the top companies we hand pick will be able to view your idea.


We'll be working with top L.A. copyright and entertainment law firm, Lowe & Associates.

Remember, companies already engage in blind 'auctions' every day – from film script bidding wars to inventors shopping round their ideas for the best deal. We securely tidy that process up for the good of all, without it even seeming like an auction, because companies must innovate better and cheaper to win big, and the key to that is your big idea.

❝Innovative companies .. understand innovation never happens in a vacuum .. are not afraid to break with the norm and push past conventional wisdom that causes people to think in a box.❞ – Rebecca Bagley, Forbes

❝A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.❞ – JFK
Just like crowdfunders get ideas cheap by supporting them early, so can companies. And your mind is amazing! We know that you have that world-changing idea within you, that you'd rather not start your own company to sell. Especially when there's already a perfectly good company out there that could buy it. Nobody needs that much company.

❝...but now, corporate America is reaching out to the independent inventor .. You’ve got successful kid inventors .. grandmothers and everybody in between.❞ – United Inventors Association


❝The patent system is broken❞ – The Verge, Daily Tech, & many more

Transceive ideas privately with buyers in the world's new secure inno-bubble.

The patent system is largely unchanged since it began in 15th century Italy. The Internet is amazing. Why haven't the two been effectively linked yet? Recent studies show the average cost of the 5% of infringements that don't settle out of court is actually $1 million per case.

Yes, the copyright systems are decrepit and being abused. But out of the flames of the old, imagine what our world will be like if world-class organizations could tap safely into the innovation stream of all the world's ideas through a global 'one-stop-shop'. With your pledge we'll no longer have to imagine. 

❝The small-time inventor appears to be making something of a comeback .. A surprising number of those pursuing better mousetraps .. are still garage and bedroom tinkerers.❞ – Mike Brunker, NBC

So this is the private idea crowdsourcing portal being built for the people. That's why we're coming to Indiegogo. We have to raise funds to complete the website, app, and our team, so it can partly be built by the people. Our founders know from experience that having to answer to big bucks investors often leads to a stifled, boxed in product, and we're all about thinking outside the box. We hope you agree.

Great companies need great ideas.
People with great ideas need great companies.
Who are open and innovative enough to listen.


Help us disrupt antiquated systems of stuffy rubber stamps and certificates you put in a frame, following practices from the 15th century. It's really starting to show (–Electronic Frontier Foundation). Because when that flood of new stuff appears via our site, it will quickly feel like we're living in the 22nd century.

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

THE SOLUTION: You could think of this also as a sort of 'online dating' that happily marries innovators to companies. If Cupid can use a helping hand, why can't Genius?


The site and app will be a secure, private, bid-and-auction marketplace for you to get that idea in your head, sold, simply and quickly. Keep reading to find out how.

❝It's not clear that we really need patents in most industries ... It's a problem.❞
– Federal Judge Richard A. Posner (Reuters)

We agree, Judge. Where there’s a problem, there can be a solution. Welcome to our big idea!

Companies' fear of being sued if they let you show them your "Eureka!" moment is an outdated, false economy that loses them an innovative edge, and therefore money. And if they're losing money, so are you. So our big idea includes a groundbreaking umbrella of review and detection mechanisms that will clear the long-standing, fossilizing hurdles – and ours are patent pending for what it's worth, so yours don’t have to be. 'It just works.' More on that in a second...

Furthermore companies already work with old-school brokers every day, as do innovators with agents. With us as the secure hi-tech broker and agent in one, the need for such early red tape and bureaucracy that officials like Judge Posner criticizes, falls elegantly away. Goodbye old friend.

We do this using a special, patent pending (rather ironically) combination of NDAs, defensive publication, tracked company clicks, and trade secret law. Click here for a Wikipedia "Patent" article that discusses just some of that in more depth. 

We realized that, by trading your idea in our watertight bubble – with only companies who have signed our unique confidentiality contract – we could remove the need for an 'up-front' patent that would protect you from nothing yet choke your purse-strings, and instead let the resourceful company obtain the idea safely first, and the expensive patent second, if at all. And the same goes for other forms of copyright.

Just like digital was the future of photography, we believe crowdsourcing is the future of innovation. We want big companies and your big ideas to be part of that future, rather than a 'Polaroid' of the world that fails to innovate, and like a photo, fades away...

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

We will finally give your big idea wings, while you're still in your PJs. Here's where the magic happens!:

  1. Upload your big idea!
    As much or as little of it to the private, secure area of our site. (See FAQ for categories.)

  2. Pick its sector!
    And pay an all-in-one fee, from just $10 - $95 depending on the sector.
    (Though we'd love to do it for nothing, we believe the industry expert opinions you'll receive, plus taking days of pitching work off your hands, has value.)
  3. Stay safe
    By agreeing to our special and unique Terms & Conditions that - with a few clever and novel twists - protect both parties equally.

  4. Sit back, get fingerprinted & rated!
    Included in the small fee, our hand-picked panel of Industry Experts in each sector queue then analyze and rate your submission based on a number of factors (some of which stay behind-the-scenes). Our mechanisms then generate a likelihood score (out of 5 stars or 100%) as to whether your idea has the genetic fingerprint of later success on its early seed. Magic! This rating alone gives you invaluable feedback + market research as to your idea's viability.

  5. Sent!
    We queue then privately send your idea directly to the inboxes of only those company's buyers, in that same category, who fit with receiving that success-star rating of idea or higher. Crucially company buyers only ever receive 1 such email per day, max. (They love this.)

  6. SOLD!
    Those companies can then exchange as much more info/prototypes with you as needed – if any – and place their one 'best offer' to hopefully secure the rights to your big idea and their next. The 'blind auction' means nobody knows what each company has bid except you. Then just like in real world deals, the best offer wins. Simples.
It's that simple. Speculate to accumulate, #AuctionYourEurekas, then cash out, all without having to pick up the phone. And the companies win big too, with a broader spectrum of 5-star ideas at their e-doorstep, just once a day.

'Microsoft and Google started a bidding war over my software idea, and Apple came in late and won!' – Possible future user & I.T. Student

This is our big idea. Please PLEDGE and SHARE now, so we can help you sell yours. Because the clock is ticking before someone else comes up with your idea and profits from it instead (we know, we've been there). If you start, others will follow, so show the world what an innovator you are.

❝Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.❞ – Albert Einstein


But it shouldn't have to be. Help us change that.

                   


⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

The value proposition promotes a rare but genuine win-win-win situation for all parties:


Summary of how each party benefits:

Companies:

  • Get access to the next big thing at a cut cost price to them (still a small fortune to the creator)
  • Retain their innovative competitive edge over their competition

Creatives:

  • Get to market their brainwave without the expense of antiquated legal protections
  • Get to cash out on their big idea without the stress of having to start their own company 
    (because the above company is already a company!)

It's also a perfect complement to Indiegogo or other crowdfunding platforms. You could for example use Indiegogo to raise money to build a really great prototype, or even patent your idea (not that you need to with us), or hire a ghostwriter, or get your song professionally recorded, or have your fashion designed... you name it. Then, after your campaign closes, you can move the results onto our site for expert rating and to be opened up to secure bidding.

'They walked with me and my 5-star screenplay every step of the way until I was offered 7-figures by 20th Century Fox' – Possible future screenwriter
Either way, we know this will revolutionize the world of innovation, just as eBay revolutionized the antiques market, and sites including Indiegogo have revolutionized the market for raising capital. That's why you're here.

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

We did our due diligence in buckets. (Not literally, that would be weird.) Our market base is established, and growing. And so are the companies who thrive on and rely on a constant stream of innovative ideas to survive and compete effectively.

❝We wake up inventing (breakfast bacon chips – Patent No. 6,699,520) and go to bed inventing (arm pillow – Patent No. 6,691,353).❞ – Mike Brunker, NBC

It is an interesting challenge to fully estimate the innovation market size and its growth patterns. As a general guideline, however, we can use data from the US “Kauffman Index of Entrepreneurial Activity” to show qualitative trends of growth. The amount of new entrepreneurs has been steadily increasing since 2001 in the US when entrepreneurs created about 4.7 million new business. In 2011—the most recent year for which the US Kauffman Index has data—entrepreneurs created about 6.8 million businesses that year. An increase of 43%! We see that the growth is similar in other markets such as the UK.

❝This is an extraordinarily inventive age.❞ – Arthur Molella, Smithsonian Institution

It's also an extraordinarily open age for innovative companies. Entrepreneurism is alive and well around the world, and with the recession and the unfortunate job cuts, more so than ever. We want to help. And due to the rapidly expanding market there is no reason why it will not grow to become the next big Internet friendly giant, to rival those such as eBay. (And the patent and copyright houses.) But...

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

1) Please hit the social media buttons under the video ⇡

2) Share this page now in all your favorite places:

                   

3) Follow and Like us via the social media and website buttons below our blurb ⇣

And maybe your friends will thank you with a finder's fee when they sell their big idea.

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯


It's nice to e-meet you too! For more info about all of us, please click on the team member links below (desktop) or in the "About" tab (mobile). See you there partner.

❝We're building our product because we got tired of having to knock on doors that wouldn't open to get my invention / song / scientific breakthrough / film script, to companies that we knew would've thrived on them... if they'd been open enough.

If you've read this far, your mind is probably like ours and never stops. Let's harness that energy. It is as unique as your ideas. And we firmly believe it’s the ultimate one-stop-shop home for them. If you're intrigued and would love to use the site... so would we! Simply, I'm excited to bring this portal to the world, because it's a product that I want to use. So please pledge now so our team can build your brain's new summer home (and maybe your real one).❞ 

– The Team

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯
