story:
Game Truck Australia will be Adelaide's first mobile video game arcade: a 21-foot trailer decked out with four widescreen TVs and consoles, available to visit children's birthday parties and other events. It is designed to bring back the 1980s experience of arcade gaming and the old school LAN party but with today's top console technology. 

When you order a party from Game Truck Australia, you can expect the ultimate in gaming entertainment. We will bring an awesome gaming experience to up to sixteen guests, with a variety of games on offer to cater for gamers of all ages and levels. But a party from Game Truck Australia isn't just a gaming party; the package also includes:

* a website service that manages all your invitations and RSVPs - all you have to do is print off customised invitations and we'll let you know who has RSVPd for the party;

* a trained and thoroughly vetted Game Coach to ensure that all guests have a fantastic time and to provide a little help getting into the game if needed;

* flexible network options to allow for a variety of groups and teams;

* a guaranteed safe gaming experience for all partygoers, with supervision, guidance, and of course age-appropriate games;

* a loot bag for all guests and hosts at the end of the party to serve as a physical reminder of the most awesome party experience they have ever had;

* an online space to share memories, connect with other gamers, and discuss how to make gaming a positive experience for all.

But doesn't everyone already have access to a gaming consoles at home? There's nothing wrong with games on my phone! Perhaps, but online multiplayer gaming is not only difficult to manage and supervise, it just doesn't have the same face-to-face joy that you experience playing side-by-side with your friends and working towards a common goal. There is nothing like sharing a memorable gaming experience with your friends in person, and that's what Game Truck Australia offers.

Finally, it's not just kids' birthday parties that can make the most of this experience. Adult parties, bucks' nights, educational gaming workshops, and even major corporate events will never be the same once you've experienced Game Truck Australia: 'epic gaming together, brought to you'.

Funds will be used for some of the basic costs in setting up the business. Obviously the biggest cost is building and fitting out the van itself, and it involves a lot of labour: there is a builder, cabinetmaker, upholsterer, electrician, data guy and internal fitters to bring it all together. Then there's a bunch of equipment: consoles, TVs, controllers, headsets and games: all this is essential to get it happening.

Supporting the launch of Game Truck Australia will put you on the ground floor of an entertainment service that is completely unique in Adelaide and will allow you to build memories that will last forever. This will contribute to the entertainment landscape in Adelaide like nothing else: five years ago we had never heard of food trucks, now they are an essential ingredient in our city's cultural makeup. Events like AVCon, the Fringe, and even local fairs will never be the same again.

This is a new project and you may know it's my first foray into business, but when I do something I do it properly: witness PhD, academic career, life in general. My business plan and cash-flow forecast was enough to get a bank to trust me with a pretty decent loan, largely unsecured: if you know banks, you'll know what that counts for. I've been gaming since the Atari 2600 was cutting-edge, and I've never experienced anything else with the potential for fun, social bonding, and learning that I have with gaming. I think you can be a part of this.

Game Truck Australia is going ahead no matter what, so if this campaign doesn't quite reach its goal it will still help to ease the cash-flow pressure in the first few months. However what I really want is to build a community around this thing and add to gaming culture in Adelaide, so even if you can't or don't want to contribute financial support, please use Indiegogo's sharing tools and tell your friends and family about Game Truck Australia. You'll earn my undying gratitude and maybe a quick crack at some Game Truck fun during a public event.

* For all event perks: Parties must be booked via the Game Truck Australia website after launch (TBC), and will only be available on weekends and during South Australian School holiday periods for venues within the Adelaide metropolitan area. (Events outside these dates and locations are negotiable.) All hosts and guests must agree to standard Terms and Conditions via the website when it is launched, but you can confirm your event date ofter donating. We expect to launch operations on the June long weekend (June 7th), but this may be subject to project delays.

You'll earn my undying gratitude and maybe a quick crack at some Game Truck fun during a public event.* For all event perks: Parties must be booked via the Game Truck Australia website after launch (TBC), and will only be available on weekends and during South Australian School holiday periods for venues within the Adelaide metropolitan area. (Events outside these dates and locations are negotiable.) All hosts and guests must agree to standard Terms and Conditions via the website when it is launched, but you can confirm your event date ofter donating. We expect to launch operations on the June long weekend (June 7th), but this may be subject to project delays.

story:
Because MineTheftAuto become so popular, we thought about new dedicated servers, which will improve the server performance for having a better experience!


OPEN BETA LIVE AT 5 - 10 - 2013

There were alot of GTA servers in Minecraft, but be honest.. that were just some faction servers with guns and a 'city world'... This server will change everything! We prepared it for about 2 months now, and we're still not done.


Information
Mine Theft Auto is simular to Grand Theft Auto, but now, GTA meets Minecraft! With custom plugins your gameplay while be fantastic! We try everything to give you the real GTA Feeling!



Features

  • Houses? - You can buy houses, not just /home but real houses! (In minecraft, not RL) You can invite your friends or gang to your home and get a cup of coffee.
  • Weapons! - Pew! Pew! You can buy your own weapons at our Ammu Nation, you can shoot people and much more! It is suggested to use our own Resource Pack, to have real guns!
  • Economy - There is a well organised economy for players. Prices are fine and the lottery doesn't ruin the economy! All lottery tickets are going into the winners money.
  • Police! - FREEZE! I you join the first time, you have to choose what you want to be, a COP or a Civilian? Choose!
  • Wanted Levels - This finishes the whole server! You can have stars from 0 to 6, if you have less than 4 stars (1-3) you have to pay a ticket, if you have more than 4 stars, you will go in jail!
  • Cars - Race with cars, drive with cars, destroy cars, do everything! It's a little bit buggy, but we'll fix that!
  • Fast server - You can play LAG FREE! This all is done with our amazing fast server! Specifications: Intel Xeon E5 @ 1,90Ghz, 12 cores with 4GB of Ram and an uplink of 1GBit!

Website: www.minetheftauto.eu

Server IP: join.minetheftauto.eu


​We hope to see you soon, this server will be international!

story:
Obesity is more than a serious problem, it’s a global crisis! You don’t need statistics as proof – just look around. As gym owners, we spend all our time keeping fit and helping others achieve fitness. It’s always been our dream to make a powerful difference in the fight against childhood obesity – a dream we’ve talked about for YEARS with a mixture of frustration and helplessness. That is until now… 

                

 

From Left: Donna Phelan, Director of Sales and Author; Former International Karate Champion, Ian McCranor, Creator of MacXTag; Arthur Sanford, Director of Marketing and Social Media; Marcia Erne, Director of Games Development and ACE Certified Personal Trainer

 

 

              With MacXTag and your help,

               we CAN make a difference!

MacXTag combines the discipline of regular exercise with the carefree fun of tag in a game that encourages physical activity in kids by rewarding them with collectible TAGs featuring their favorite stars, teams and sport heroes. In short, it blends the benefits of exercise with the thrill of a modern day video game. MacXTag will improve the health, self-esteem and social skills of children in the same way that exercise does, without the fight to get them participating! For organized MacXTag leagues and classes, instructors can also utilize our upcoming unique social media platform that offers a system of points kids can redeem for prizes, reinforcing their continued regular involvement.

MacXTag offers something for kids, for parents and for business owners who share our passion!  

Kids love the pure fun of MacXTag!

 

Ryan and Ellie during early testing of MacXTag

But, wait, there's more....!

 

Kids love the collectibles!  Whether its their favorite team, the completer piece in a MacXTag puzzle, or a rare collectible they’ve been lucky enough to win, the fun of finding that special TAG never gets old. 

 

But, wait…there’s more! 

 

Parents appreciate the many skills acquired and lessons learned as their children play MacXTag games. 

 

But, wait…there’s more!

 

Available only thru businesses offering organized MacXTag classes, the coded collectible TAGs can be redeemed for points that kids accumulate for prizes. 

 

 

But, wait…there’s more!

 

As kids scan their coded TAGs, their online community of friends is notified, keeping MacXTag and their MacXTag club top of mind!

 

But, wait...there's more!

 

Exclusive club rewards, challenges, discount notifications and unique offerings.  For more information go to www.macxtag.com.

…Kids have fun without even realizing they are exercising.

…Parents encourage healthy habits and social skills for their children in an educational environment.

…Business owners see their business grow through classes, the purchase of collectible TAGs and the redemption of TAG points.

 …And most importantly…

 

We ALL do our part to fight childhood obesity!

                

           Why does MacXTag work?

While teaching his own popular TaeRobics class one afternoon, former international karate champion Ian McCranor had a realization.  His classes were packed with women – most with no martial arts background – who loved the punching and kicking AND executed both with surprisingly good technique.  Yet, whenever Ian tried to incorporate a focus on self-defense into one of his classes, these same women were simply not interested.  Punching and kicking in an energized room pulsing with upbeat music and the whooping and hollering of their friends produced endorphins.  Punching and kicking as a defense against an attack – even a simulated one – produced adrenaline.  In short, his clients ran toward the pleasure and excitement (endorphins), and ran from the fear (adrenaline). 

 

This revelation got Ian thinking.  For kids, exercise for the sake of exercise is hard work and drudgery and most parents have a fight on their hands getting their kids to participate.  If Ian could figure out a way to introduce exercise to kids disguised in a fun, endorphin-producing package, he would be a hero to all parents concerned with the health and happiness of their children.  Within days of this light bulb moment MacXTag was born!

 

Extensive R&D on MacXTag has taken place

 

The first prototype for MacXTag had its issues, but we knew we were onto a winner. 

 

That's right, Ben, even Edison started somewhere

We immediately set about patenting our concept and gear, and trademarking the MacXTag name. Research and development continued, resulting at times in gear that was – shall we say – interesting.

 

Hey, Rachel, Rocky the Squirrel has been looking for that haa

Hook and loop was a major ingredient in the design of the MacXTag gear.  We experimented with different thicknesses and strengths, and spent hours in MacXTag classes with kids, testing and retesting the equipment.

This much hook and loop and Nate will stick to anything

 

With seamstresses and engineers working around the clock, the MacXTag gear changed, evolved and improved until the gear was complete.

 

 

Now we are getting somewhere, right Lauren?

 
 

Now that we had a working model, we set about designing the introductory MacXTag Lite kit.  This simple design provides everything we need: it's lightweight, completely functional and easy to pull on and off. 

 

MacXTag Lite Vest

 

MacXTag Lite Holder and TAG

 

That brings us to today.  With your help in meeting our goal, we can begin production of the MacXTag Lite kit and start offering the MacXTag system to children, parents and business owners in the United States and Great Britain. 

Take a look at our cool rewards - you can choose more than one reward by adding up the total of the rewards you want and enter that as the pledge amount.  Then select the rewards you want.  With your help, Kickstarters, we WILL make this happen!

 

 

See how you can offer MacXTag in your Club!

 

 

THANK-YOU!!

 

For more information and to find out how you can become involved, please visit us online at MacXTag.com.

story:
Forgive me is a fantasy adventure focused on exploration and the player’s moral choices. The plot begins after the death of the main character, who finds himself hurled in an alternative dimension where the souls of those who committed suicide are gathered. In this lush moor he will soon find out that is soul is not eternal but is gradually vanishing. The only way to avoid complete oblivion will be finding five souls that will help him to gain strength and unlock the sealed doors of a mysterious Tower that dominate the landscape. But what the Tower represents and what’s in its insides will be unknown until the end of the game. In his search, the player will have to pay attention to an evil force that has the power to corrupt and destroy the surrounding land.

The gameplay mechanics will be based mainly on exploration during the sections set on the outside of the Tower. The player will have to unveil the mystery that links the five previous suicides,  in order to free their souls with a simple and intuitive mechanic. Every soul gained will then be necessary to the player to gain access to different floors of the Tower: two souls will be enough to get in, and a maximum of five can be obtained. This will unlock different choices and endings Inside the Tower there will still be exploration, with the addition of free moral choices concerning both the main theme of suicide.

The complete experience of Forgive Me is hard to explain in a few words since we prefer to leave space for personal interpretations. We don’t want to develop a linear game with a single explanation of the facts, but an adventure capable of adapting to the mindset of the player, without fear of kindling controversial feelings. The game is set to be released on PC (2014/2015) and Mac (late 2015).


Fabiano Zaino, game designer of Forgive Me, begun developing the idea at the beginning of 2013 as a simple hobby, soon making it an almost daily job. Towards the second half of 2013 it became obvious that other professionals were needed, and so it’s decided to create Gangster Games: a small group of people driven by a common passion.

The team is composed of Fabiano “deimos” Zaino who deals with the writing and the design. Luca Lo Priore is the one behind programming and visuals, while Stefano Cortese and Luca Bancone are the guys who take care of the concept art, respectively as character artist and environmental design. Alessandro Faiella and Giuseppe Cuomo are two recent additions that deal, the latter, with sounds and music, and the former with character modelling.

Forgive Me is our first game, and our intention is that of continuing developing the game with great care and to create a title capable of stirring up players, thanks to a mature story and a simple but captivating gameplay.


During 2013, Forgive Me grew both in ambition and people involved. Recently we realized that without funding, the game wouldn’t see the light of day for a long time.

Thanks to your contribution, we want to improve Forgive Me in terms of graphic and content: the gameplay is currently less dynamic compared to what it could be, if we get the chance to work on all the ideas we had to discard during pre-production.

The experience that we are trying to create, much depends on the resources invested: what is already implemented has been completed thanks to the few assets we could afford. Unfortunately many gameplay or stylistic choices aren’t viable at the moment.

Lets see what features we could improve with your help:

1) The plot is currently told through a series of diaries, scattered throughout the game’s world. Our greatest hope is to replace this text files with five animated 3D models with whom the player could interact with. Our animator is working hard on this option, but the development time of a single character is really long for just one person. Moreover we want to add various animated cutscenes that will add depth to the visual experience of the game.

2) Forgive Me is being developed with the free version of Unity which allowed us to realize a big environment, but with some small limitation, both from a management and graphical point of view. We would like to get the pro version of Unity so as to enhance the whole technical side of the title and grant a better performance.

3) One of the major aspects of the game is the audio, we managed to create some tracks and sound effects but with your support we could bring to life a full-blown soundtrack capable of underlying the themes that we want to deal with.

4) At the current state we could only achieve one of the three endings that we envisioned for the title, stripping it of all the moral choices we wanted the players to confront with. With the additional money we could complete the project without making any drastic cut.

5) We would love to add Oculus Rift implementation for the game, since we believe that it would fit perfectly with the overall tone of “Forgive Me”.

- 45.000€   1 more 3D artist and 1 more Composer.
- 55.000€   1 more 3D artist, 1 more programmer and 1 more Composer.
- 65.000€   2 more 3D artists, 1 more programmer and 1 more Composer.
- 80.000€   2 more 3D artists, 1 more programmer, 1 more 2D artist and 1 more Composer.
- 100.000€   1 more programmer and 1 more 2D artist

15€ Early Digital Edition – The Game (digital Copy).

20€ Digital Edition – The Game, Soundtrack (digital copy) + Your name as a Backers (Credits).

30€ Digital Deluxe Edition – The Game, Soundtrack, Ryan Gibson Postcard (digital copy) + Your name as a Backers (Credits).

80€ Collector's Edition – The Game, Soundtrack, Artbook and Ryan Gibson Postcard (physical copy) + Your name as a Backers (Credits).

160€ Extreme Edition – The Game, Soundtrack, Artbook, Ryan Gibson Postcard, T-Shirt (physical copy) + Your name as a Backers (Credits and Artbook).

300€ Please, Forgive Me Edition - The Game, Soundtrack, Artbook, T-Shirt, Charlotte Buchant Postcard, The Comic Book (art by Davide Pascutti) Prequel the game (physical copy) + Your name as a Backers (Credits and Artbook).

1) When will a demo be released?
- We planned the official release of a demo by the third week of May 2014.

2) How many hours will the game last?
- The length will vary from player to player but we estimated that it would go between the two and five hours. If we manage to reach the necessary stretch goals, a couple more hours of gameplay are expected.

3) What does the game actually consist of?
- Forgive Me is a fantasy adventure set in an open environment, completely explorable from the beginning of the game.

4) The game’s formula isn’t new, how does “Forgive me” stand out from the crowd?
- The main value of forgive me is its subject, an uneasy topic that we hope will keep you engaged from the beginning to the end of the story. There won’t be any fights, but you’ll have to reach the solution before your soul is completely lost.

5) Will there be any obstacles preventing me from reaching the end?
- As we said before, even if our character is already dead, there is a Game Over. Your soul is not immortal and needs sustenance from the NPC located in the world in order to reach the end of the fame.

6) What languages will be supported at launch?
- The game will have Italian and English text from the beginning. With the stretch goals we’d like to add French and German, together with Italian and English voiceover.

7) When will it be released?
- We believe that with your support the game will be ready by the end of 2014, but should we reach the higher stretch goals we  may need to postpone it to 2015.

The true power of crowdfunding is the possibility of including you, those for whom we are making this game with great love and passion, in the process. So, if you want to contact us please do so on our email, or on our profiles on Twitter and Facebook. Fabiano will answer personally your every question.

http://forgivemegame.com
gangstergames@forgivemegame.com

story:
Summary-

  Hello everyone! My name is Randy, I’m the host of an annual Super Smash Bros 64 tournament called Super Smash Bash. For 4 years this event has been held in private but has grown in guests upwards of 34 participants and additional spectators. This is growth is exciting but also means that the event needs to be facilitated on a larger scale, which is why helping out and spreading the word about this fundraiser is so important to us. With your contributions Super Smash Bash will be open to the public and will provide up to 100 attendees with food, prizes, and safe fun entertainment for all ages in the community. Our goal is to share this fun opportunity with everyone whos interested, and only your contributions can make it happen!

 

What we need & what you get-

  We need $4,000 to make this happen so every little contribution helps. If you’re wondering where your money is going the breakdown is like this:

$1950 -Renting and seating in the hall

$  600 - Buying a brand new 50” TV for use at the event

$  135 -Food and beverage at the event.

$  155 -Prizes and trophies at the event.

$1160 -Used to make and distribute IGG Perks.

 

Some of the perks include;

-Digital copies and physical prints of digitally drawn artwork by one of our creators Katie! View some of her work here: http://misfortuneee.deviantart.com/.  

- Vinyl decal of the Super Smash Bash logo!

- Your name on the Super Smash Bash site as a donator! Visit our site here: http://www.supersmashbash.com/

- Downloads and hard copies of our Super Smash Bash promotional video!

- Access to a Livestream of the event if you can’t make it out here to play!

- The possibility to name one of the two trophies given out at the event!

- Accreditation as a producer for our project!

- A one of a kind N-64 controller customized by hand in the theme of our event!

 

If our project doesn’t get completely funded, we will be putting this money towards the perks for you, our funders, and towards renting the hall and food for the players.



The impact-

  If this fundraiser fails the event cannot go public and will remain private for another year. If you donate you will be helping to create a great event that will provide kids and young adults a way to socialize and network while being an active part in their community. Nobody coordinating this event is getting paid unless we exceed our goal. This is our first indiegogo project and we would love nothing more to see it though.

 

Other ways you can help-

  We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they still can’t help. If funding our cause is not an option be sure to help us get the word around to others by telling them about this project and by using the share tools provided.

 

 Check out last years promo! http://youtu.be/Qd_YT6qeCbw
story_txt:
Summary-
  Hello everyone! My name is Randy, I’m the host of an annual Super Smash Bros 64 tournament called Super Smash Bash. For 4 years this event has been held in private but has grown in guests upwards of 34 participants and additional spectators. This is growth is exciting but also means that the event needs to be facilitated on a larger scale, which is why helping out and spreading the word about this fundraiser is so important to us. With your contributions Super Smash Bash will be open to the public and will provide up to 100 attendees with food, prizes, and safe fun entertainment for all ages in the community. Our goal is to share this fun opportunity with everyone whos interested, and only your contributions can make it happen!
 
What we need & what you get-
  We need $4,000 to make this happen so every little contribution helps. If you’re wondering where your money is going the breakdown is like this:
$1950 -Renting and seating in the hall
$  600 - Buying a brand new 50” TV for use at the event 
$  135 -Food and beverage at the event.
$  155 -Prizes and trophies at the event.
$1160 -Used to make and distribute IGG Perks.
 
Some of the perks include;
-Digital copies and physical prints of digitally drawn artwork by one of our creators Katie! View some of her work here: http://misfortuneee.deviantart.com/.  
- Vinyl decal of the Super Smash Bash logo!
- Your name on the Super Smash Bash site as a donator! Visit our site here: http://www.supersmashbash.com/
- Downloads and hard copies of our Super Smash Bash promotional video!
- Access to a Livestream of the event if you can’t make it out here to play!
- The possibility to name one of the two trophies given out at the event! 
- Accreditation as a producer for our project!
- A one of a kind N-64 controller customized by hand in the theme of our event!
 
If our project doesn’t get completely funded, we will be putting this money towards the perks for you, our funders, and towards renting the hall and food for the players.

The impact-
  If this fundraiser fails the event cannot go public and will remain private for another year. If you donate you will be helping to create a great event that will provide kids and young adults a way to socialize and network while being an active part in their community. Nobody coordinating this event is getting paid unless we exceed our goal. This is our first indiegogo project and we would love nothing more to see it though.
 
Other ways you can help-
  We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they still can’t help. If funding our cause is not an option be sure to help us get the word around to others by telling them about this project and by using the share tools provided.
 
 Check out last years promo! http://youtu.be/Qd_YT6qeCbw

story:
Velocity Stream is Cavelight Entertainments core project, the sole purpose for the creation of the team! In Velocity Stream one player flies an aircraft called a "Paver" which leaves a trail of energy in its wake. On this trail, the other players race each other.

This praised idea was one of six nordic game concepts to move on to the interview phase in the Dare to be Digital competition in 2011. Now we want your help to make 2013 the year that this bird takes to the skies!

 

  • Genre: Racing

  • Format: PC

 

Victory decided by skill. Not track memorization!

Why do people generally not want to play racing games when visiting their friends? In a traditional racing game, you are given a quantity of preset tracks. As a player, you are going to play this track over and over again. Invariably, you’re going to memorize the track.

In Velocity Stream, one player takes control of the Paver, a spacecraft that leaves a trail of energy in its wake. It’s on this trail that the other players race. This unique mechanic results in a brand new track being created by a human player in each race. Hence not only creating an infinite amount of tracks, but also resulting in the elimination of track memorization.

 

Do you refuse to keep on racing when you know you’ve already lost?

In Velocity Stream, we’ve got a new and exciting feature called the Activator Mode. Once you’ve lost, you are placed in the back of the Paver. Here you can place out obstacles and zip pads for the remaining racers to hit or avoid. We are also experimenting with a range of different activator modes, such as a fighter jet mode where players get to shoot down the Paver or annoy the Racers.

Do you think it’s a chore and a bore to wait in lobbies, waiting for a race to start?

In most racing games, when you want to join a race online, you enter a lobby and then wait for enough players to join. And if you’ve got bad luck, people drop out at the same pace that they join, not to mention that a lot of people drop during races as well. With Velocity Stream, we have the philosophy of zero downtime. To achieve this, players will join the match of their preference and are immediately placed in the Activator mode, while waiting for the next race, which commences without returning to the lobby.

 

Click here for more pictures, news and videos!

Well, beyond our eternal gratitude, and because in space no one can hear us say “thanks man, you rock”, we’re offering plenty of unique and unbelievable rewards. Among other things, Velocity Stream is one of very few, if not the only game that lets you include your own level in the game. We’re also happy to let you have your own, custom paint jobs and we’ll even make you the racer of your dreams!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you know someone else who might like Velocity Stream? Spread the word! Sharing this campaign on facebook, twitter or any other community will help us reach our goal. We cannot thank you enough for helping us reach others…

 

 

 

Funding and stretch goals

20 000 : This will ensure another talented 3d artist is on board for the duration of the project ensuring more content, more cars and richer looking graphics.

25 000: At this level, we're going to add a third artist to the project, further increasing the graphical fidelity of the game, as well as increasing the ammount of racers. At this level the game will see a Wii U release as well.

How we'll use your contributions

Are we going to go on a vacation to Greece or buy the worlds most advanced mocap-studio?

Well, no, actually. Most of your contributions are going to be used to pay wages and taxes so that we'll be able to spend the whole summer developing Velocity Stream. The goal is to have a releasable version by the end of August. Having five people working on a game full time is somewhat costly!

Q: What formats is Velocity Stream being developed for?

A: Velocity Stream is currently being developed for a PC release on Desura, but our ambition is to firstly get the game out on Steam, and later release it as a digital download for home consoles. The main candidates for this is the Nintendo Wii U and the Ouya.

 

Q: Have you considered to post your game on Steam Greenlight?

A: Yes. Our plan is to post it there shortly

story:
Hello concerned community,

     My name is John Rasberry and I have been involved with basketball and chess, whether coaching or playing, for the past thirty five years. In short, the better part of my life.

     The Hall of Game is raising funds to finance a basketball and chess tournament. It is a major investment in youth from various neighborhoods in Brooklyn and the surrounding New York City area. It is more than a simple chess or basketball tournament. The principles that these youth develop can be used for a lifetime. You have an opportunity to be a change agent in the lives of over 120 youth. This investment can have an exponential effect!

     The chess philosophy teaches them to think strategically about the move they make before they make it. This is extremely relevant because we all make mistakes, however some are catastrophic because we reacted before we thought about the decision that was made.

     The basketball tournament promotes interpersonal communication by utilizing team work. "There is no I in team" and to be productive in life we must learn how to thrive and get along with others. Sometimes we need to utilize a defensive strategy in order to protect what is valuable to us. Sometimes we must utiilize an offensive strategy in order to go after our goals.

     We have had great success in the past. You can look at the video and see some of our past work or go to the website www.hallofgame.org The challenge for us is that both segments of the tournament are growing and we don't have the financial resources to accommodate the demand.

     There are six teams in each age division. There are two age divisions. 14&under and 16& under. Each team will play 5 games. This does not include the playoffs. Each team will make the playoffs. The referee(ref) fee for each game is 80$. There are a total of 25 games each division will play. The ref fee for both divisions is 80$x50games=4,000$ This fee does not include play off games.There will be an additional 6 playoff games.That is an additional 480$. In addition to the referee fee we have to order 120 uniform tops, print Hall of Game logo on the front and put iron on numbers for the back.Those three things will cost a little over 1,100$We will also need money to buy trophies and present the championship and runner up teams with hoodies of the tournament logo printed on them. Thank you for your generosity and support!Your contriubtions can make a brighter today for the paticipants in the Hall of Game basketball and chess tournament.

story:
The Great Fusion - for iOS and Android

 

What is all about The Great Fusion?

Year 2022: society has truly changed during the last decade, the good old times have vanished. Help Max to survive through this unusual and hilarious adventure. For iOS and Android.

The Great Fusion is a third person graphic adventure inspired by our childhood’s old classic point and click games. It has been touch optimised for mobile devices.

  • Hilarious story
  • Spicy dialogues
  • Hand-drawn art
  • Original Soundtrack




 

 

The Game: Tired of 1st person shooters?

We have personally spent really great times playing old classic graphic adventure games such as Monkey Island or Day Of The Tentacle. Those funny conversations, the story interaction with other characters… It was a unique and unforgettable experience.

Our first priority has always been to make a funny and alternative game regarding current issues and problems. In addition to this, we have developed an intuitive and fresh interface in order to make the best possible experience. The gameplay idea is basically the same than our childhood’s classic graphic adventure games. It's not about being a hero, nor about dominating the world. The Great Fusion throws you into one of the plausible futures towards which society is unfortunately going straight to. How would you deal with it?

 

 
 
 
 

Don’t you need millions to make a game like this?

We know what it takes to make a top-tier game.

The development of The Great Fusion has already started, the game will be a reality. We are crowdfunding the project to be able to finish it properly, after the hard work and resources that have already been invested on it.

Our team has 5 years of experience on games development. On top of that, we have been working as leads on Proyect-Z (Source HL2MP) and The Passenger (iOS). In the last 2 years we have developed several apps and games but this is definitely the funniest and most enjoyable project we have ever been involved with.

 

Help us spreading the word!

The fact that you can’t contribute doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Make some noise: tell your friends or anyone you think that could be interested in The Great Fusion.
  • Sincere words: let us know your opinion, we will really appreciate it.
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Problem

Video game journalism is plagued by people who don't understand the audience they're writing for. Far too often, we see people who don't know the first thing about the industry plastered all over our TV screens and websites. They're paid to look good on camera while holding a controller or reading a game review someone else wrote. The event that suffers from this the most is E3. Since it's closed to the public, we have no choice but to spend each year watching pretty faces drone on about their exclusive access to some game they obviously have no interest in.


Our Solution

The best way to solve this problem is to provide the gamers who truly care with coverage that meets their standards and matches their style. Giving the readers a hand in the creative process will allow for content that appeals to a more focused audience, satisfying communities that have demanded a more direct connection with E3 and the industry as a whole.


What We Need & What You Get

I've partnered with the fantastic team at Gematsu to gain access to the show and press conferences. In return, I'm going to be producing content for their site while covering the event as a volunteer. This will give me enough material to provide separate articles for my blog, which will be written during my free time before and after the show hours when all of my Gematsu work is completed. The only thing standing in my way is actually getting there. A flight across the country and a week's stay in California isn't cheap, and while I would love nothing more than to provide my services for free, financing the such a trip is an issue. If you can send me to California, each person who contributes $10 or more will become part of my team of editors that controls the types and topics of content I produce over the course of E3. By helping me, you're allowing me to reach out directly to the gaming community and allow access and influence to conference coverage and articles. Ten $50 contributors will even get to select a piece of my E3 swag to keep!


Along with the location requested by each article's backer, I will post my content on the blog I created for this project. The link can also be found under "Website" at the bottom of this description.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with funding, do your best to spread the word about my effort. Post my link on your forums or message boards and tell your friends. I don't need lods emone, so every tiny contribution is a huge help to me.


I can be reached via email at kevin@gematsu.com.


Thanks to everyone for your time, effort, and most importantly, money.

story:
Keep in mind that you will be charged the minute you make a successful contribution.
" Your credit card will be charged the contribution amount immediately if your transaction was successful, not at the end of the campaign" -Indiegogo

Want to try out Dogs of Combat before making a contribution? Try out our prototype demo here: Dogs of Combat Demo

***Sept 22nd: REWARDS HAVE BEEN UPDATED***

Follow Dogs of Combat news!
  • Twitter hashtag: #DogsOfCombat
  • Website: www.closedumbrellagames.com

Dogs of Combat is an online multiplayer first-person shooter originally developed for the now-defunct PlayStation Mobile platform.  Powered by the Unity game engine and networking provided by Photon.



There's plenty you can do in Dogs of Combat
  • Battle against other players competitively
  • Chat with people in the Lobby chat
  • Go solo in free-for-all deathmatches
  • Unite with other players in team deathmatches
  • And more stuff will be added to the game!

All of this awesome action right in the palms of your hands for $5 when it goes on the App Store!

Players start with the language selection (English or Japanese).  After you select your language, you are taken to this main menu:

  • Connect - connects you to the online lobby where you can create a room, join a room, and chat with other players.
  • Store - This is where the In App Purchases will be.  To start with, we're leaving these out for the first version. 
  • About - Go here to see some info about the game. 

Once you are online, this lobby will appear:

Screenshot of iPad lobby prototype

Since Dogs of Combat uses a room-based system, the lobby shows a list of available rooms, but you can also create your own room. 

When creating a room, you can name your room anything you like as long as it's shorter than 24 characters.  You can also choose how many players can be in your room (min. 2, max. 8) as well as the room's map and game mode. 

When you're in your room, wait for players in join, and the match can begin.  Matches are 3 minutes long, and the player with the most points at the end of a match (if the match is a Free For All match) wins.





My name is Jake Bayer.  I'm a 17-year old independent game developer and I run a small indie game development business called Closed Umbrella Games (CUG).  We have participated in the Boston Festival of Independent Games (FIG) at MIT over the past few years.  We have made 5 games in total, the most recent being Dogs of Combat. 

You can read more info about CUG on our website: www.closedumbrellagames.com

Dogs of Combat was originally released on the PlayStation Mobile platform in March 2015.  It was downloaded over 18000 times! But, a few days later, Sony announced they will be shutting down PlayStation Mobile, leaving Dogs of Combat without a home.  So, we decided to start developing for Apple's iOS platform.  The problem is, we don't have the right hardware and software.

That's where this Indiegogo campaign comes in.  We need your help to bring Dogs of Combat and our future titles to the App Store.  Our game development community here in Meriden isn't strong, but we believe we can help it become strong by making great games like Dogs of Combat. 

Having your support means a lot to us.  This project is important to us because we not only want to deliver a growing game to a larger audience, but we also want to have a place in the large and strong Apple community.  But, most important of all, we want YOU to be part of our story!

This Indiegogo campaign uses flexible funding, so that all the funds go towards the development of the iOS port of the game.  After this campaign ends, we will begin developing Dogs of Combat into an iOS app.  We will make sure we keep our backers up to date with the latest info and status of the game. 

If we do pass our goal, we can reach our stretch goals and make the game even better.  And, if we go past THAT, we will use the extra funds to maintain some of the licenses.

Should we fail to reach our $4900 goal, we will use the funds raised to buy what we can afford with it. 

Once the campaign ends, we will start working on porting Dogs of Combat to iOS. One of the challenges I face as an indie game developer is that I'm younger than the average game designer.

There are always chances that getting all the hardware and software might cause some delays in development and getting the builds to beta testers. The possibility of Apple rejecting the game the first time can also contribute to this.  Dogs of Combat has been rejected before by Sony, but we worked hard to undo the wrongs and in the end, Dogs of Combat was accepted. There's one thing to remember: businesses, especially rookie companies like us, run into obstacles all the time, and you have to overcome them to be successful.

While there are many of these obstacles along the road, we believe we can overcome them and be the best we can be.  Even if we don't get funded, we won't give up on our dream.

"Success is not final, failure is not fatal; it is the courage to continue that counts." -Winston Churchill

Another big risk is not getting the funds we need.  Dogs of Combat may not look as compelling and innovative as other shooters, but we can make it better.  And, that's why we need your support so we make Dogs of Combat a game that everyone can enjoy on their iPhones and iPads. 

Crowdfunding isn't crowdfunding without awesome rewards for our backers!  With the exception of one physical reward, all of our rewards are 100% digital.  Yep, that's right! This is so that we can focus more on porting Dogs of Combat to iOS than shipping more physical rewards. 

A few things to keep in mind about our rewards:

  • All digital reward tiers ship worldwide (some will be sent by email)
  • Sticker Man is only available in the United States and will not be included with rewards shipping outside the United States.
  • We will keep all backers updated with estimated delivery times
  • We do not charge shipping fees

If you just can't contribute, but still want to see Dogs of Combat on the App Store, you can still help us! Here's what you can do:
  • Spread the word about this campaign
  • Post it on social networks using the share tools

It would mean a lot to us if you did either of these things!

If you have any questions about the campaign or Dogs of Combat itself, don't be afraid to post a comment! You can also email us at closedumbrellagames@gmail.com, or you can email me personally at jakebayerct@gmail.com.
story_txt:
Keep in mind that you will be charged the minute you make a successful contribution." Your credit card will be charged the contribution 
amount immediately if your transaction was successful, not at the end of
 the campaign" -IndiegogoWant to try out Dogs of Combat before making a contribution? Try out our prototype demo here: Dogs of Combat Demo***Sept 22nd: REWARDS HAVE BEEN UPDATED***Follow Dogs of Combat news!
Twitter hashtag: #DogsOfCombat
Website: www.closedumbrellagames.com











Dogs of Combat is an online multiplayer first-person shooter originally developed for the now-defunct PlayStation Mobile platform.  Powered by the Unity game engine and networking provided by Photon.






There's plenty you can do in Dogs of Combat
Battle against other players competitively 

Chat with people in the Lobby chat
Go solo in free-for-all deathmatches
Unite with other players in team deathmatches
And more stuff will be added to the game!


All of this awesome action right in the palms of your hands for $5 when it goes on the App Store!

Players start with the language selection (English or Japanese).  After you select your language, you are taken to this main menu:



Connect - connects you to the online lobby where you can create a room, join a room, and chat with other players.

Store - This is where the In App Purchases will be.  To start with, we're leaving these out for the first version.  


About - Go here to see some info about the game.  


Once you are online, this lobby will appear:


Screenshot of iPad lobby prototype

Since Dogs of Combat uses a room-based system, the lobby shows a list
 of available rooms, but you can also create your own room.  
 
When creating a room, you can name your room anything you like as long 
as it's shorter than 24 characters.  You can also choose how many 
players can be in your room (min. 2, max. 8) as well as the room's map 
and game mode.  
When you're in your room, wait for players in 
join, and the match can begin.  Matches are 3 minutes long, and the 
player with the most points at the end of a match (if the match is a 
Free For All match) wins. 




My name is Jake Bayer.  I'm a 17-year old independent game developer and I run a small indie game development business called Closed Umbrella Games (CUG).  We have participated in the Boston Festival of Independent Games (FIG) at MIT over the past few years.  We have made 5 games in total, the most recent being Dogs of Combat.  
You can read more info about CUG on our website: www.closedumbrellagames.com
Dogs of Combat was originally released on the PlayStation Mobile platform in March 2015.  It was downloaded over 18000 times! But, a few days later, Sony announced they will be shutting down PlayStation Mobile, leaving Dogs of Combat without a home.  So, we decided to start developing for Apple's iOS platform.  The problem is, we don't have the right hardware and software.That's where this Indiegogo campaign comes in.  We need your help to bring Dogs of Combat and our future titles to the App Store.  Our game development community here in Meriden isn't strong, but we believe we can help it become strong by making great games like Dogs of Combat.  Having your support means a lot to us.  This project is important to us 
because we not only want to deliver a growing game to a larger audience,
 but we also want to have a place in the large and strong Apple 
community.  But, most important of all, we want YOU to be part of our story!





This Indiegogo campaign uses flexible funding, so that all the funds go towards the development of the iOS port of the game.  After this campaign ends, we will begin developing Dogs of Combat into an iOS app.  We will make sure we keep our backers up to date with the latest info and status of the game.  If we do pass our goal, we can reach our stretch goals and make the game even better.  And, if we go past THAT, we will use the extra funds to maintain some of the licenses.Should we fail to reach our $4900 goal, we will use the funds raised to buy what we can afford with it.  
Once the 
campaign ends, we will start working on porting Dogs of Combat to iOS.  
One of the challenges I face as an indie game developer is that I'm 
younger than the average game designer.  
There are always chances that getting all the hardware and software 
might cause some delays in development and getting the builds to beta 
testers.  The possibility of Apple rejecting the game the first time can also 
contribute to this.  Dogs of Combat has been rejected before by Sony, but we worked hard to undo the wrongs and in the end, Dogs of Combat was accepted. There's one thing to remember: businesses, 
especially rookie companies like us, run into 
obstacles all the time, and you have to overcome them to be successful.
While there are many of these obstacles along the road, we believe we can overcome them and be the best we can be.  Even if we don't get funded, we won't give up on our dream.
"Success is not final, failure is not fatal; it is the courage to continue that counts." -Winston Churchill
Another big risk is not getting the funds we need.  Dogs of Combat may not look as compelling and innovative as other shooters, but we can make it better.  And, that's why we need your support so we make Dogs of Combat a game that everyone can enjoy on their iPhones and iPads.  

Crowdfunding isn't crowdfunding without awesome rewards for our backers!  With the exception of one physical reward, all of our rewards are 100% digital.  Yep, that's right! This is so that we can focus more on porting Dogs of Combat to iOS than shipping more physical rewards.  A few things to keep in mind about our rewards:
All digital reward tiers ship worldwide (some will be sent by email)
Sticker Man is only available in the United States and will not be included with rewards shipping outside the United States.

We will keep all backers updated with estimated delivery times
We do not charge shipping fees










If you just can't contribute, but still want to see Dogs of Combat on the App Store, you can still help us! Here's what you can do:
Spread the word about this campaign
Post it on social networks using the share tools


It would mean a lot to us if you did either of these things!

If you have any questions about the campaign or Dogs of Combat itself, don't be afraid to post a comment! You can also email us at closedumbrellagames@gmail.com, or you can email me personally at jakebayerct@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

Squirrel Diamond is a game about a Squirrel that collects Diamonds.

Each level you have a certain amount of moves and a certain amount of Diamonds to collect. Click a Diamond and the Squirrel will take the shortest path to the Diamond, collecting all the Diamonds along the way. Collect all the Diamonds in the amount of moves required and you beat the level.

As levels progress they become bigger, they will  also change from left to right, to right to left, or up to down, or down to up, as well as other features.

 A Pine Cone - Hit a pine cone and you lose.

 A Shovel - Hit a shovel and a hole is dug.

 A hole may help you by allowing you to go a different path, or hurt you by making you go a path you don't want to go.

 An Acorn - Hit an acorn and it will unlock a bonus level. These levels will be HUGE!

 Enemies - Hit an enemy and you will lose, enemies may move back and fourth, or only move when you move.

(Even more features may be added. Graphics may change as well and Audio will be added later.


►DOWNLOAD THE DEMO◄


What We Need & What You Get

Up and till now Squirrel Diamond has been created using the free version of Game Maker Studio, however Game Maker Studio limits the amount of resources you can have in the free version. So in order to continue development I need to upgrade my software.


Goal $500 - Bring Squirrel Diamond to HTML5


This will allow me to upgrade my Game Maker Studio Software and allow me to export to HTML5 so I can I put the game on it's own website and that way it can be played on all platforms (PC, MAC, IOS, and ANDROID)


The money will also allow me to pay for 2 years for the domain, and the fees associated with IndieGoGo. Money left over will be saved for the stretch goal.


$270 | IndieGoGo Fees and towards Stretch Goal

$100 | Game Maker Studio Professional

$100 | Game Maker Studio HTML5 Module

$30   | Domain Name and Domain Privacy for 2 years.


Stretch Goal $1650 - Bring Squirrel Diamond to IOS and HTML5


This will allow me to upgrade my Game Maker Studio Software so that I can export to IOS and HTML5.


The money will also allow me to get a Mac Mini, mouse, and keyboard, so that I can export my game to IOS and pay the Apple Developer fee for 1 year.


$920 | Mac Mini, Mouse, and Keyboard

$200 | Game Maker Studio IOS Export

$198 | IndieGoGo Fees

$100 | Game Maker Studio Professional

$100 | Game Maker Studio HTML5 Module

$100 | Apple Developer Fees

$30   | Domain Name and Domain Privacy for 2 years


Rewards :

$1   | It will help me reach the goal that much quicker, so thank you for your awesome donation you will get to play the game when it is released.


$5   | Previous Reward + Your name will be added to the credits page in the game.


$10 | Previous Rewards + I will contact you with an in game secret that makes your Squirrel Cooler.


$20 | Previous Rewards + I will contact you and you can design a small level for the game.


$50 | Previous Rewards + I will contact you and you can design a big level for the game.


If we can't reach the goal :(


If I can't reach the goal of $500 but have reached a goal of $50...

 Squirrel Diamond will still be released as a downloadable game for the PC. All extra money will be saved towards upgrading my software so that I can bring Squirrel Diamond to other platforms in the future.


If we go over the stretch goal :)


If we go over the stretch goal all the extra money will go towards my personal debt and bills, so I can focus more time on even more levels, as well as future games :)


The Impact

Squirrel Diamond is a fun game, even after playing the same level over and over for testing I still find it enjoyable, and when I reach the goal and have the money to upgrade my software. There isn't anything stopping me from making EVEN MORE levels. So you'll never get bored.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but want to help the game reach it's goal.

Then please share this campaign with your friends, twitter, facebook etc. It will help me out a lot, and hopefully make Squirrel Diamond a reality, instead of just a dream.

Thank You!

story:
Welcome to the crowdfunding campaign for Archangel 2: Red Colony, an original full 3D space Point & Click quest adventure game by indie development team comprised of two members.

The purpose of the campaign is to make a sequel for the first part Archangel: Martian Orbit, that almost ready without any help from the side. You will see the first part final product for Android mobile devices before this campaign ends. So, you can try (for free!) and decide if the sequel is worth your attention and help.

As game designer I started to create 3d models and game environment on October 2012, without any possibility to work only on my project. But it was a Dream - to make something like this and to show for large people auditory the final result - new look of interactive Point & Click mobile game.

Archangel episodes originally oriented for mobile devices, at least the first part. Its alternative historical event, reproduced in Point & Click sci-fi quest adventure game. 

In the first part of the game that almost ready, you play as the last awaken crew member on Archangel soviet spaceship. Most things were created different than "regular" Point & Click quest. We tried to make much more flexibility for gameplay and the game interactivity. How?

1. All scenes are fully modeled and rendered in 3d software allowing more options to move. You have huge spaceship to explore, four completed decks with at least 20 original sections. The main puzzle is the spaceship itself. While in a sequel - martian surface with its structures will be the main puzzle to solve.

2. Each action that your character do - all in movie clips. And you can see your hands, feel your body. You have total of 141 movies in the first part of the game. In a sequel will be less movies, but each movie much longer.

3. Mission is not so linear, you can decide and try different ways and devices, not every movie is a must, some of them can be played unlimited times for fun.

For more details, idea & game guide, screenshots and full list of features - you can visit game site or check out gameplay simulation. Demo-version for Android is now available - see updates!

There are only two of us:

Dmitry - game creator, responsable for all 3d aspects of design, animation and render processes. For this moment, sound and music in the game are also in my sphere of work.

George - an experienced programmer, which can take all this mess of hundreds images, movie clips, schemes and soundtracks to create the final product on MULTIPLE PLATFORMS.

We are not working in the same office or even country, but our team is strong enough for creating nice projects without negative affects from secondary conditions. You can see - it works!

Well, about 10 month of work on Archangel's first part and its ready to go! Actually, it can be done much more faster, I will explain that point later. So, why the sequel needs funds?

For now, we have not enough time to make it, we need to work for family, bills and food. We can't stay away from the other jobs. The second part of Archangel will take years to develop without any financial help or significant changes. So, if you think it worth and you want to help, check out the plan for the sequel.

Now its clear what can be done better in a sequel, or more correctly to say - different. You can find some info also on the game site, but here are few points:

1. Game zone will be significally changed - not only closed environment like rooms and sections, but also miles of the martian surface. Like a desert? No.

2. Martian surface will be represented in 3d world according to NASA's footages of Cydonia region. At least 4 different locations - Martian Face, Soviet colony and Pyramids area. Forth location is another human colony from the past with its features (see Astronaut perk for more details). Interiors and exterior zones. 

3. There will be another characters for interaction, not only you and robots like it was before in part one. Friend(s) from Archangel spaceship, hostile cybernetic systems (from Earth), another nations astronaut(s).

4. This time - no silence. The characters can speak and interact.

5. Space suits will be redesigned for several versions with advanced textures and better animation flexibility. Few space transports will be also available.

6. Creation of realistic faces for the characters. Every emotion, speech, yell etc. will work in the game.

During this development, George will assist me with programming solutions and the best options that I will need for innovations and game requirements. At the final step, George will create again his unique engine in Unity3d.

Generally, a lot of  options can be done, we can't mention each of them, its a matter of imagination and project time. But, important to remember, that the sequel will be the same Point & Click quest game, available for mobile devices (priority), PC, Mac and Lunix. 

Our campaign is for flexible funding, so every dollar will be used for game creating progress, with possibility to pay the bills and food for several months. First step (me) - concepts, scenario, modeling and 3d environment render for images and animations. Second step (George) - interface adaptation, multilanguage versions, code for several platforms. Third step (both) - testing processes, upgrades and corrections, marketing, promotional material (trailer, site, press), music and sound.

To be honest, we need much more funds to make this kind of game, but we are estimating additional income from the almost completed Archangel's first part sellings. Anyway, here is a list of priorities:

1. My work is at least for 4-5 months to create all 3d game scenes and characters: models, textures, rigging, animations and renders (about $15 000)

2. George need about 3 months to create the code in Unity and suit it on multiple platforms. Tests and so on... (about $15 000)

3. The most significant time loss while working on Archangel: Martian Orbit was the render process of thousands frames for animation. So, in fact, all models and animated scenes were ready on January (first 4 month of work), then about 5 month of almost non-break rendering process on one machine. 

Same situation can happen again with the sequel. If we reach our goal - strong computer especially for render purposes can be purchased, so the game development will be much faster, release earlier.

4. This time we need third-party to be involved - Sound records studio. They will have not so much work to do - only multiple short dialogues/emotions between characters according to the scenes. We need the same high-quality result, so the price can vary around estimated $2500. Sound and music can be done separately like before by our own possibilities. 

5. Some part of money will be spend for you, our friends. Digital and hand-made exclusive presents for backers. Free shipping worldwide.

6. Fees... 

* Game trailer, site and all graphic needs can be done by me, no need to pay to nobody else. At this stage you will start to see your names on "Hall of Glory" page - created especially for the people who helped us here with our project.

If we have a luck and get above what we ask for - where the money go:

  • Party with cakes for me and George on Skype conversation.
  • Just joking. More powerfull render station(s) can be purchased - see next point.
  • Game scenario can be extended for more exciting zones and characters modeling. In addition, mega-cool effects in 3d and video, still on time schedule, because render station processes run fast. Only one limit - game size. It can't be 1 GB for mobile devices.
  • Additional software like ZBrush can be purchased and used for better result in characters look. Plus may be couple weeks to timeline for studying these tools (online).
  • Professional composer can be hired for several needs.
  • Extra-present for everyone who participated in our campaign.
  • We are always open to receive your feedback and change these plans if it seems right step to all of us. 

As you can see from descriptions, your perk can be very special and unique, you will be not only listed on the game site, but also with possibility to affect the game and influence storyline. In addition, if it seems campaign running to pass its goal - there is an option to extra-present for at least officers staff - hand-made high-quality medal of honor. 

Important note: perks including shipping price - registered package with number, so you can track your order. All life examples of physical gifts like key-holder, medals, Archangel character figure will be represented here for your evaluation of quality and look.

Another note: everybody who helped, doesn't matter how much - will be listed in "Hall of Glory".

Caporal $5

A digital copy for PC, Mac or Linux. DRM free. 

Caporal Special $10

Choose one from mobile or PC platforms that enough for you. In both - your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory". 

Sergant $20

All above + Mobile version for iOS or Android.  Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".

Lieutenant $40

All above +  3 digital desktop wallpapers, original soundtrack and digital book with a great selection of art work, character profiles, locations, models and extra features!  Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".

 

Captain $75

All above + early access to BETA version + Archangel's key-holder.  Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".



Major $120

All above + hand-made bronze Archangel character (about 1,5 inch). Design your own item for game environments. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory". 


Commander $250

All above +  A3 physical poster, physical art book and game pack for all platforms we can develop, hand-made bronze Archangel character. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory". 

 

Rescue Team $400 - special offer.

Exclusive for our first serious backers! Same as Colonel rank + additional A3 poster designed special and ONLY for Rescue team members - real names, space suits with country flag and color by wish, location background from the game for you choose! Or any other design you prefer. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".


Colonel $500

All above (except Rescue team offer) + access to secret zones inside the game + additional exclusive A3 poster with 5 Colonel's real bakers collective picture, space suits with country flags and color by wish (or any other design you prefer). Archangel character with silver and gold elements. All the games we will produce till 2020, for free, in any platform. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".


General $1000

All above (except Rescue team offer) + first 3 generals backers in "Hall of glory" header picture in full height, real names, space suits with country flag and colored by wish. Modeled real faces as in game characters (limited to 5) + your real photo (or your wife, baby, pet) in game locations - as example poster or portrait on wall in living modules, elevators, inside spaceship etc. All generals will get hand-made bronze Archangel character with silver and gold elements.

Astronaut $1500

All above (except Rescue team and General offers) + hand-made bronze Archangel character with silver and gold elements. In game location as Monument of astronauts from previous human mission to Mars (not grave!), stone-made, recognizable your full name on it, company(?) and country. Also, additional smaller colony structure with its name and interior according to backers wish. Visiting these areas will be a must for game success (solving puzzle/collecting artifact). First backer will have priority in final decisions about leader country (or international crew) and design elements. Possibility to affect the game scenario. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".

Hero $2500

Thank you! You are the guy! This one who was on Mars before Archangel's crew and still alive. You have all above (except Rescue team, General and Astronaut offers) + exclusive hand-made Archangel character with silver and gold elements and lifetime access for all the games we will produce, for free, in any platform.

You will be one of constant characters in the game, with your real name in storyboard, animated alive person, visible in actions with his positive affect on gameplay and story. Game site will introduce and highlight your character with your name and game role in the best way for design and storyboard needs.

Your character will be referred for any country you choose, it means, that he will speak in his language. English, German, Spanish, Swedish, Greek, Indian, Arabic, or whatever you want. But 2 limitations:

  • not Russian, because it's contrary to storyboard,
  • not very exotic like Nigerian, because wee will need to find and hire native speaker for voice records.

Your character will be necessarily person for game success, will appear in several actions, will speak and think. How he can communicate with Russians? That's a fun part - you will see.

Additional options (not sure yet - depends of funds):

  • hero's face can be your face, 3d modeled animated as well,
  • with your wish and possibility, you can find sound records studio near your location, so they can record your voice for your character in game - we can assist in payments.

Anyway, if you think this perk for you - please contact us before, so we can guarantee that basic options fits you.

Executive producer $3000

Contact us before and we will decide together about the best offer for the special person like you.

Thank you for reading our campaign! We really appreciate your interest and time. Whatever you are, or you are not one of our backers, your feedback is also very very important! Like us on Facebook, share with your friends, leave a comment here or there, follow our updates - stay tuned! We will not stop to develop our best ideas for cool games!

Also, we will post updates of sequel development progress and Archangel's first part release date for Android. You will be able download it for free as trial version and if you like - buy it from inside the game for only $2. Feedback and critique are always welcome.

Feel free to ask us about any additional info for these projects, we are always open to our friends and Indiegogo community.

Thanks and welcome aboard!
