There are only two of us:
Dmitry - game creator, responsable for all 3d aspects of design, animation and render processes. For this moment, sound and music in the game are also in my sphere of work.
George - an experienced programmer, which can take all this mess of hundreds images, movie clips, schemes and soundtracks to create the final product on MULTIPLE PLATFORMS.
We are not working in the same office or even country, but our team is strong enough for creating nice projects without negative affects from secondary conditions. You can see - it works!

Well, about 10 month of work on Archangel's first part and its ready to go! Actually, it can be done much more faster, I will explain that point later. So, why the sequel needs funds?
For now, we have not enough time to make it, we need to work for family, bills and food. We can't stay away from the other jobs. The second part of Archangel will take years to develop without any financial help or significant changes. So, if you think it worth and you want to help, check out the plan for the sequel.
Now its clear what can be done better in a sequel, or more correctly to say - different. You can find some info also on the game site, but here are few points:
1. Game zone will be significally changed - not only closed environment like rooms and sections, but also miles of the martian surface. Like a desert? No.
2. Martian surface will be represented in 3d world according to NASA's footages of Cydonia region. At least 4 different locations - Martian Face, Soviet colony and Pyramids area. Forth location is another human colony from the past with its features (see Astronaut perk for more details). Interiors and exterior zones. 
3. There will be another characters for interaction, not only you and robots like it was before in part one. Friend(s) from Archangel spaceship, hostile cybernetic systems (from Earth), another nations astronaut(s).
4. This time - no silence. The characters can speak and interact.
5. Space suits will be redesigned for several versions with advanced textures and better animation flexibility. Few space transports will be also available.
6. Creation of realistic faces for the characters. Every emotion, speech, yell etc. will work in the game.
During this development, George will assist me with programming solutions and the best options that I will need for innovations and game requirements. At the final step, George will create again his unique engine in Unity3d.
Generally, a lot of  options can be done, we can't mention each of them, its a matter of imagination and project time. But, important to remember, that the sequel will be the same Point & Click quest game, available for mobile devices (priority), PC, Mac and Lunix. 
Our campaign is for flexible funding, so every dollar will be used for game creating progress, with possibility to pay the bills and food for several months. First step (me) - concepts, scenario, modeling and 3d environment render for images and animations. Second step (George) - interface adaptation, multilanguage versions, code for several platforms. Third step (both) - testing processes, upgrades and corrections, marketing, promotional material (trailer, site, press), music and sound.
To be honest, we need much more funds to make this kind of game, but we are estimating additional income from the almost completed Archangel's first part sellings. Anyway, here is a list of priorities:
1. My work is at least for 4-5 months to create all 3d game scenes and characters: models, textures, rigging, animations and renders (about $15 000)
2. George need about 3 months to create the code in Unity and suit it on multiple platforms. Tests and so on... (about $15 000)
3. The most significant time loss while working on Archangel: Martian Orbit was the render process of thousands frames for animation. So, in fact, all models and animated scenes were ready on January (first 4 month of work), then about 5 month of almost non-break rendering process on one machine. 
Same situation can happen again with the sequel. If we reach our goal - strong computer especially for render purposes can be purchased, so the game development will be much faster, release earlier.
4. This time we need third-party to be involved - Sound records studio. They will have not so much work to do - only multiple short dialogues/emotions between characters according to the scenes. We need the same high-quality result, so the price can vary around estimated $2500. Sound and music can be done separately like before by our own possibilities. 
5. Some part of money will be spend for you, our friends. Digital and hand-made exclusive presents for backers. Free shipping worldwide.
6. Fees... 
* Game trailer, site and all graphic needs can be done by me, no need to pay to nobody else. At this stage you will start to see your names on "Hall of Glory" page - created especially for the people who helped us here with our project.
If we have a luck and get above what we ask for - where the money go:

Party with cakes for me and George on Skype conversation.
Just joking. More powerfull render station(s) can be purchased - see next point.
Game scenario can be extended for more exciting zones and characters modeling. In addition, mega-cool effects in 3d and video, still on time schedule, because render station processes run fast. Only one limit - game size. It can't be 1 GB for mobile devices.
Additional software like ZBrush can be purchased and used for better result in characters look. Plus may be couple weeks to timeline for studying these tools (online).
Professional composer can be hired for several needs.
Extra-present for everyone who participated in our campaign.
We are always open to receive your feedback and change these plans if it seems right step to all of us. 


As you can see from descriptions, your perk can be very special and unique, you will be not only listed on the game site, but also with possibility to affect the game and influence storyline. In addition, if it seems campaign running to pass its goal - there is an option to extra-present for at least officers staff - hand-made high-quality medal of honor. 
Important note: perks including shipping price - registered package with number, so you can track your order. All life examples of physical gifts like key-holder, medals, Archangel character figure will be represented here for your evaluation of quality and look.



Another note: everybody who helped, doesn't matter how much - will be listed in "Hall of Glory".

Caporal $5
A digital copy for PC, Mac or Linux. DRM free. 

Caporal Special $10

Choose one from mobile or PC platforms that enough for you. In both - your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory". 

Sergant $20
All above + Mobile version for iOS or Android.  Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".
Lieutenant $40
All above +  3 digital desktop wallpapers, original soundtrack and digital book with a great selection of art work, character profiles, locations, models and extra features!  Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".
 
Captain $75
All above + early access to BETA version + Archangel's key-holder.  Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".


Major $120
All above + hand-made bronze Archangel character (about 1,5 inch). Design your own item for game environments. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory". 

Commander $250
All above +  A3 physical poster, physical art book and game pack for all platforms we can develop, hand-made bronze Archangel character. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory". 
 
Rescue Team $400 - special offer.
Exclusive for our first serious backers! Same as Colonel rank + additional A3 poster designed special and ONLY for Rescue team members - real names, space suits with country flag and color by wish, location background from the game for you choose! Or any other design you prefer. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".

Colonel $500
All above (except Rescue team offer) + access to secret zones inside the game + additional exclusive A3 poster with 5 Colonel's real bakers collective picture, space suits with country flags and color by wish (or any other design you prefer). Archangel character with silver and gold elements. All the games we will produce till 2020, for free, in any platform. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".

General $1000
All above (except Rescue team offer) + first 3 generals backers in "Hall of glory" header picture in full height, real names, space suits with country flag and colored by wish. Modeled real faces as in game characters (limited to 5) + your real photo (or your wife, baby, pet) in game locations - as example poster or portrait on wall in living modules, elevators, inside spaceship etc. All generals will get hand-made bronze Archangel character with silver and gold elements.
Astronaut $1500
All above (except Rescue team and General offers) + hand-made bronze Archangel character with silver and gold elements. In game location as Monument of astronauts from previous human mission to Mars (not grave!), stone-made, recognizable your full name on it, company(?) and country. Also, additional smaller colony structure with its name and interior according to backers wish. Visiting these areas will be a must for game success (solving puzzle/collecting artifact). First backer will have priority in final decisions about leader country (or international crew) and design elements. Possibility to affect the game scenario. Your name, country and rank in "Hall of Glory".
Hero $2500
Thank you! You are the guy! This one who was on Mars before Archangel's crew and still alive. You have all above (except Rescue team, General and Astronaut offers) + exclusive hand-made Archangel character with silver and gold elements and lifetime access for all the games we will produce, for free, in any platform.
You will be one of constant characters in the game, with your real name in storyboard, animated alive person, visible in actions with his positive affect on gameplay and story. Game site will introduce and highlight your character with your name and game role in the best way for design and storyboard needs.
Your character will be referred for any country you choose, it means, that he will speak in his language. English, German, Spanish, Swedish, Greek, Indian, Arabic, or whatever you want. But 2 limitations:

not Russian, because it's contrary to storyboard,
not very exotic like Nigerian, because wee will need to find and hire native speaker for voice records.

Your character will be necessarily person for game success, will appear in several actions, will speak and think. How he can communicate with Russians? That's a fun part - you will see.
Additional options (not sure yet - depends of funds):

hero's face can be your face, 3d modeled animated as well,
with your wish and possibility, you can find sound records studio near your location, so they can record your voice for your character in game - we can assist in payments.

Anyway, if you think this perk for you - please contact us before, so we can guarantee that basic options fits you.

Executive producer $3000
Contact us before and we will decide together about the best offer for the special person like you.

Thank you for reading our campaign! We really appreciate your interest and time. Whatever you are, or you are not one of our backers, your feedback is also very very important! Like us on Facebook, share with your friends, leave a comment here or there, follow our updates - stay tuned! We will not stop to develop our best ideas for cool games!
Also, we will post updates of sequel development progress and Archangel's first part release date for Android. You will be able download it for free as trial version and if you like - buy it from inside the game for only $2. Feedback and critique are always welcome.
Feel free to ask us about any additional info for these projects, we are always open to our friends and Indiegogo community.
Thanks and welcome aboard!

story:
UPDATE: Our first game is Jack Houston and the Necronauts, a traditional point & click graphic adventure game set in an Edgar Rice Burroughs/Frank Frazetta inspired sci-fi world of bubble helmets, rockets ‘n ray guns!  Full story and TONS of images here: http://www.warbirdgames.com/games/jack-houston-and-the-necronauts/


 

"What is Warbird Games?"

Hi, I'm Stacy Davidson, lead designer at Warbird Games! We are a Dallas area-based indie game studio that exists as a collection of artists of various breeds working both locally and remotely.  We each bring unique skills in the areas of game design, dramatic writing, traditional art, 3D animation, sculpting/molding, practical and visual motion picture effects, sound design, acting and vocal direction, and music composition and recording.

Since I am at the core of this team, I thought I would start by giving you a little background on myself.

"Stacy Who?"

My love of computer games began when I was eight years old with the introduction of a TI-99/4A computer in the household. I learned Extended Basic and programmed my first game, a simple text adventured called The Quest where the player could pick up a sword and lantern, explore a swamp and castle, and little else! I later developed simple action and RPG games on my dual C64 & C128 systems and ran a local C64 gaming BBS. I played my first graphic adventure game on my 286, where I experienced Space Quest III and IV, King’s Quest V and VI, Conquest of Camelot and many more.

As I upgraded, I fell in love with games like Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Full Throttle, and finally the adventure game that convinced me that anything was possible in the genre: the beautiful and haunting sci-fi masterpiece The Dig.

As an avid gamer, I have owned a dozen game systems and even enjoy fixing up old arcade machines and collect boxes of arcade boards.

In my professional career, I spent a year in QA at Origin Systems/EA during their last days, published my own shareware game Shadow of the Lost Citadel, and have spent the last eleven years working in motion pictures as a producer, director, cinematographer, editor, sound designer and visual effects supervisor at my own studio, Odyssee Pictures.

Returning to games really feels like going back to my roots. I spent many years living and breathing games, and the prospect of designing multiple adventure games would be nothing short of a dream come true for me. To this end, I’ve now set my sites on the point ‘n click world, starting with my lifelong pet project idea Han Solo Adventures, a purely “for fun” fan-game idea I’ve been recently making a reality.

However, under the banner of Warbird Games, I’m looking forward to exploring original ideas in my neverending quest to recapture the glory days of Sierra On-Line and LucasArts, where mysteries were solved and legends were born one click at a time!

"What's the money for?"

Warbird Games is just now in it's infancy, and we need to get cracking on every front. By pre-ordering our first title, you will be helping us do things like:

  • Visualize our concepts through terrific artwork and clay maquettes.
  • Develop the design bible and expand every detail so assets can be created.
  • Produce an exciting old-time radio drama podcast to help introduce our sci-fi universe.
  • Buy us time to work, because time is money!
  • Most importantly, prove that players are hungry for new adventure games in the vein of the Sierra and LucasArts classics we all remember and love!

"What will your first game be like?"

Jack Houston and the Necronauts is:

  • A serious point 'n click adventure game in the vein of Full Throttle and The Dig.
  • A pulpy, two-fisted, bubble helmets, rockets 'n rayguns sci-fi story in the tradition of Edgar Rice Burroughs and Frank Frazetta.
  • Set in the world of 1999 as envisioned by early 20th century sci-fi writers and artists like Chesley Bonestell.
  • An exercise in a rarely used, non-traditional animation technique with ZERO computer generated animation!

"So what do I get?"

For the low early bird price of $15, you will be entitled to our very first game title as a DRM-FREE digital download.

At higher levels, you will also recieve additional perks such as the soundtrack and a high quality making-of book with tons of full color artwork and behind-the-scenes images along with a complete journal of the game design.

In addition, as a backer, you will recieve special access to our private video dev blogs and development community where you will be ranked "Early Bird" forever, along with our gratitude for being the first to help us spread our wings and take flight!

Please help us spread the word by facebooking, tweeting, or sending this URL by way of carrier pigeon to the entire world!

Thank you!

-Stacy Davidson, Lead Designer

http://www.warbirdgames.com

An exercise in a rarely used, non-traditional animation technique with ZERO computer generated animation!

In addition, as a backer, you will recieve special access to our private video dev blogs and development community where you will be ranked "Early Bird" forever, along with our gratitude for being the first to help us spread our wings and take flight!
Please help us spread the word by facebooking, tweeting, or sending this URL by way of carrier pigeon to the entire world!
Thank you!
-Stacy Davidson, Lead Designer
http://www.warbirdgames.com

story:
Short Summary

All contributions will go towards the following, in the order specified:

 

1) Renewing the domain for www.TheROMShop.com

2) Renewing the domain for www.ROMGamer.net

3) Registering our mobile app with Google Play

4) Miscellaneous site upgrades (New logo, more space + bandwidth etc)

5) Advertising Campaign

What We Need & What You Get

Indiegogo only allows a minimum of $500 for our campaign. As a result, after the above mentioned site expenses are taken care of we will use any left over money to purchase prizes and incentives. These prizes would be given to contributors as a thank you and as prizes for site contests.

The Impact

At TheROMShop.com we work hard to provide the best service possible. We offer thousands of free games and the applications to play them on your Mac or PC. We also have a members site at ROMGamer.net, that offers bundlepaks and rare ROM files not found elsewhere. We offer free support and troubleshooting to our users and strive to continue to maintain ourselves as an excellent resource for retro and nostalgic gaming. Our Facebook community of over 7K strong enjoys a daily schedule of entertaining posts in their news feed that was painstaking built by volunteers. We've done all this without charging a cent for any service and refusing to resort to smearing our sites with ads and pop-ups like most of the other ROM sites out there. All this bandwidth, web hosting and more doesn’t come free and unfortunately the minimal advertising that does exist on our site does not cover operating costs. In an effort to stay active beyond our current domain expiry date, we are reaching out to the public for support. No contribution is too small, you can also rest assured your donation will be wisely used and greatly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can afford to donate. If that wasn't the case we'd just pay these expenses out of our pockets. For anyone wanting to help but not able to assist financially, you may do one of 3 things. 

 

1) Tell your friends and family about TheROMShop.com

2) "Like" us on Facebook and share our page with your friends

3) Share this fundraiser with anyone that may be interested in the cause.

story:
Zebop’s Escape  is a SIDE-SCROLLING DRIVING GAME which follows our lovable hero Zebop on a low gravity ride across an Alien landscape.


Command Zebop in his All-Terrain-Graviton-Deca-Rover across Exoplanet G70 before it goes 

Super Nova!

 

Many Great Features!

- Great Physics!

- Level Objectives!

- Trophies!

- Wacky and Exciting Story!











We are a small group of developers, designers, and artists, located in Los Angeles who want to make creative and useful applications that are inspired. Our designs are unique and innovative. We do this because, well, what else would we do?!


We do this because THIS is our passion! 


However,

"The road to success is not always paved with gold," and in this case it is very true; we need your help. 


My partner Jason's wife recently gave birth to two beautiful babies (July 14th 5pm), and time has run out to take things slow. That is why it is so important that we find a way to make this project a success otherwise we may need to shut down shop. I don't want this to happen.



Our Goal


If we can raise enough money to support our team to develop this project we will accomplish several things

- We will create a fun and unique game with loads of character!

- We will make Gengius a success.)

- So many more ideas/applications will be possible for our team to share with the app community whom we know will find them useful and entertaining. (Our team is talented and has experience, what we lack are resources)


What will it take and How can you Help?

The projected cost for "Zebop's Escape" is based on an engineering plan that includes the cost of our engineers, our artists, our designers, our composers, marketing, and our QA Team over the 2 months it will take to complete

the project. 


There are various perks available depending on the contribution which can be viewed in the right column.

Perks are available to anyone who supports the making of this game.


Additional Ways You Can Help?

If you have the time or inclination let people know about the app and have them download and play it. Also, if you know any generous individuals who would wish to support us please send them a link to our campaign as I am sure that would probably be the easiest way for them to get the information.

story:
Let me introduce myself:

My name is James Dance and I am the owner of Loading bar, a gaming café and cocktail bar based in the Southwest of England.

After graduating I came up with the idea to open my own gaming venue. I worked full time as a chef and I filled my spare time with research and development for a new type of gaming bar.

In 2010, after three years of inhuman hours and after sacrificing both my social life and sanity, Loading bar opened its doors, offering gamers a place to drink, relax and play.

Not your average bar:

My business is unique in its take on the “Gaming bar” format for the following reasons:

  • Use of our consoles is free, as is access to the internet.
  • Gaming cafe during the day, gaming bar during the night.
  • Unique, industry supported gaming events all year round.
  • High concept gaming themed cocktails such as this and these 

What's the plan?

We want to create a bar run by people focused on the venue not the profit margins, in London; The centre of the UK games industry. We would like to take the successful format we have down here in Cornwall and move it to the capital where we can serve a greater number of people as well as offering unique, industry sponsored events in a fit to purpose venue.

We will be Collaborating with Mitch and The Drunken Moogle to help curate drinks and Daniella from Gourmet Gaming to help lay on game themed snacks.

London based Nintendisco now Gamerdisco will be bringing their monthly ‘arcade for adults’ approach to the bar once a month as well, the aim really is to create a centre point venue for all things gaming culture in the UK and beyond.

We also want YOU to get involved to help us create something new and community driven.

Your support and contributions will ensure that London gets its first dedicated gaming venue. There are a few bars with consoles and a couple of competetive gaming centres in the UK but Loading is a different beast altogether; A celebration of the social side of gaming. Somewhere you can just come and spend time with your friends, grab a drink and play a few rounds of Mario-kart should you feel like it, no payment, no pressure.

How do we intend on achieving this?

The more eagle eyed (or prone to google) among you may be thinking “$50,000 is NOT enough to open a venue in London” and you would be correct.

The money will be used to allow us to secure the rest of the funding needed to make the project a reality. We already have the design, concept and experience and have been successfully running it on a smaller scale for two years, we know what we are doing and have already ironed out the bumps down here in Cornwall.

We will also be saving money by taking over the lease of one of the many pubs that are closing down in the city. These classic London pubs are perfect for two things; avoiding hordes of marauding zombies and developing into gaming venues.

Doing it this way rather than from the ground up not only saves us a bunch of cash, it also means that we avoid pricey and time consuming planning processes and issues.

The Perks:

 

From students to superstars, we have perks suitable for every wallet. We have various pieces of gaming “swag” we have been kindly donated by our sponsors as well as tshirts, hoodies and various other rewards of our own creation.

At our basic level however, all we are really asking you to do is pre order a cocktail and make your mark by having your own custom message printed onto our wallpaper!

So what happens if we do not reach our target?

We chose Indie-gogo because it is perfect because regardless of the outcome, we still get to deliver our perks to you, the supporters.

We are committed to this project and are determined that we WILL open in London one way or another. Having achieved what we have so far on a practically non-existent budget we can assure you that this project will happen even if we do not reach our target, it will just take a whole while longer.

All of the perks will still be valid including our drinks vouchers; you can use them at our bar in Cornwall, at any of our promotional events or just keep them as a keepsake as they will fold out into limited edition papercraft projects.

Why we think this is important:

As far as the gaming community goes, this project is valuable as it gives you, the community, a focal point, a place to gather and catch up whilst also having a damn good time.

On a grander scale, we feel it is important that venues like this start to be taken seriously. Places like Loading help legitimise gaming both as an adult activity and a genuine art form.

This is a space for collaboration and co-operation, a place you can be proud to be a part of and actively have a say in how it evolves on a day by day basis.

Some previous projects:

 

Our very first taste of internet fame when ‘The Drunken Moogle’ featured one of our drinks and since then, due to various projects and images, we have been featured by Edge, IGNUK, The Sun, GamesTM, Gamesmaster, Wired, The Daily Mail, G4TV, The Drunken Moogle, FHM and the Huffington Post as well as dozens of community blogs.

We’ve made branded cocktails for Capcom, EA, Guardian newpapers, THQ, Minecraft and loads more.

YOUR support means the world to us and will allow us to continue to do what we do best but on a larger scale and in a central city location.

Conventional lending would be take too much control over what we do and how we do it.

You guys however, can fund this project and become actively involved in a community rather than a business deal. Your ideas are always welcome as your support is the lifeblood of our business.

What happens if we exceed our target amount?

To put it simply, the more we get from the community, the less we have to rely on investors and banks and the more control we keep in our company. More details to follow in future updates but essentially, if we could raise enough to open the bar right now, we would be extremely happy.

I have no money, how can I help?

Already been cleared out by a recent steam sale or sunk the majority of your wealth into the latest releases? We still value your help.

Please share our video with your friends, show them some of the cool drinks we have made and help spread the word.

We rely on our audience to help us and you guys can rely on us to do the best we can to create a place for you to meet with like minded people, drink, relax and play.

Thank you for your support.
story_txt:
Let me introduce myself:
 
My name is James Dance and I am the owner of Loading bar, a gaming café and cocktail bar based in the Southwest of England.
After graduating I came up with the idea to open my own gaming venue. I worked full time as a chef and I filled my spare time with research and development for a new type of gaming bar.
In 2010, after three years of inhuman hours and after sacrificing both my social life and sanity, Loading bar opened its doors, offering gamers a place to drink, relax and play.
Not your average bar:

My business is unique in its take on the “Gaming bar” format for the following reasons:

Use of our consoles is free, as is access to the internet.
Gaming cafe during the day, gaming bar during the night.
Unique, industry supported gaming events all year round.
High concept gaming themed cocktails such as this and these 
What's the plan?

We want to create a bar run by people focused on the venue not the profit margins, in London; The centre of the UK games industry. We would like to take the successful format we have down here in Cornwall and move it to the capital where we can serve a greater number of people as well as offering unique, industry sponsored events in a fit to purpose venue.
We will be Collaborating with Mitch and The Drunken Moogle to help curate drinks and Daniella from Gourmet Gaming to help lay on game themed snacks.
London based Nintendisco now Gamerdisco will be bringing their monthly ‘arcade for adults’ approach to the bar once a month as well, the aim really is to create a centre point venue for all things gaming culture in the UK and beyond.
We also want YOU to get involved to help us create something new and community driven.
Your support and contributions will ensure that London gets its first dedicated gaming venue. There are a few bars with consoles and a couple of competetive gaming centres in the UK but Loading is a different beast altogether; A celebration of the social side of gaming. Somewhere you can just come and spend time with your friends, grab a drink and play a few rounds of Mario-kart should you feel like it, no payment, no pressure.
How do we intend on achieving this?

The more eagle eyed (or prone to google) among you may be thinking “$50,000 is NOT enough to open a venue in London” and you would be correct.
The money will be used to allow us to secure the rest of the funding needed to make the project a reality. We already have the design, concept and experience and have been successfully running it on a smaller scale for two years, we know what we are doing and have already ironed out the bumps down here in Cornwall.
We will also be saving money by taking over the lease of one of the many pubs that are closing down in the city. These classic London pubs are perfect for two things; avoiding hordes of marauding zombies and developing into gaming venues.
Doing it this way rather than from the ground up not only saves us a bunch of cash, it also means that we avoid pricey and time consuming planning processes and issues.

The Perks:
 
From students to superstars, we have perks suitable for every wallet. We have various pieces of gaming “swag” we have been kindly donated by our sponsors as well as tshirts, hoodies and various other rewards of our own creation.
At our basic level however, all we are really asking you to do is pre order a cocktail and make your mark by having your own custom message printed onto our wallpaper!
So what happens if we do not reach our target?
 
We chose Indie-gogo because it is perfect because regardless of the outcome, we still get to deliver our perks to you, the supporters.
We are committed to this project and are determined that we WILL open in London one way or another. Having achieved what we have so far on a practically non-existent budget we can assure you that this project will happen even if we do not reach our target, it will just take a whole while longer.
All of the perks will still be valid including our drinks vouchers; you can use them at our bar in Cornwall, at any of our promotional events or just keep them as a keepsake as they will fold out into limited edition papercraft projects.

As far as the gaming community goes, this project is valuable as it gives you, the community, a focal point, a place to gather and catch up whilst also having a damn good time.
On a grander scale, we feel it is important that venues like this start to be taken seriously. Places like Loading help legitimise gaming both as an adult activity and a genuine art form.
This is a space for collaboration and co-operation, a place you can be proud to be a part of and actively have a say in how it evolves on a day by day basis.
Some previous projects:
 
Our very first taste of internet fame when ‘The Drunken Moogle’ featured one of our drinks and since then, due to various projects and images, we have been featured by Edge, IGNUK, The Sun, GamesTM, Gamesmaster, Wired, The Daily Mail, G4TV, The Drunken Moogle, FHM and the Huffington Post as well as dozens of community blogs.
We’ve made branded cocktails for Capcom, EA, Guardian newpapers, THQ, Minecraft and loads more.

YOUR support means the world to us and will allow us to continue to do what we do best but on a larger scale and in a central city location.
Conventional lending would be take too much control over what we do and how we do it.
You guys however, can fund this project and become actively involved in a community rather than a business deal. Your ideas are always welcome as your support is the lifeblood of our business.
What happens if we exceed our target amount?
To put it simply, the more we get from the community, the less we have to rely on investors and banks and the more control we keep in our company. More details to follow in future updates but essentially, if we could raise enough to open the bar right now, we would be extremely happy.

Please share our video with your friends, show them some of the cool drinks we have made and help spread the word.
We rely on our audience to help us and you guys can rely on us to do the best we can to create a place for you to meet with like minded people, drink, relax and play.

story:
Download the demo here:

http://shadowofarawyn.com/

Hello my name is Don Carter I am a solo indie developer working on my first indie game.  I have always had a passion for video game, art and technology,  so at the start of this year (2013) I set out on a quest to make my own video game and I haven't looked back.

My game "The Shadow of Arawyn" is a windows based PC game set in a fantasy world were you fight to restore the land to its once prosperous state.  The land was divided in to four regions and there where four tribes placed at the edge of each region.  You fight your way as four unique characters each with a specific fighting style and weapons.  Your goal is to reach the center of the land and reunite the Kingdom.  Along the way each character will have their own dungeons to overcome but what you do in one dungeon will affect where you can go in another. That is all I can share about SOA without giving away to much.

With the help of YOU the backer will help me be able to afford such things as electronics and equipment,  licenses and software to make this one hell of an action adventure. 

For my project funding is crucial.  I'm in need of a much better computer and software (such as video and music editing tools) and equipment(various other devices so I can start work on trying to bring SoA to other platforms) 

Teir 1

  • 1$=     My humble graditude and a mention in the credits as special thanks. And a mention on Twitter and Facebook as well.
  • 5$=     A digital copy of the game when it is released and every reward below this level.
  • 7$=     Access to the beta version of the game (early access to the completed game shortly before its release) and every reward below this level.
  • 10$=   Access to the Alpha versions of the game (monthly updates even after the demo is complete.  Starts in November!) and every reward below this  level.

Tier 2:

  • 15$= All Tier 1 rewards and this awesome collectible button showing your support (US shipping only)

  • 20$=All Tier 1 rewards and this cool bumper sticker (US shipping only.)

  • 30$=All Teir 1 rewards plus this freaking sweet t-shirt sizes S,M,L,XL (US shipping only) 2XL is 4.00 extra

Teir3:

    • 45$=All Tier 1 and Tier 2 Rewards and the chance to be totally freaking awesome (limited availability) (US shipping only.) 
    • 100$=All Tier 1 and a SoA Top Contributor award with your own name for recognition (as always shipping to the US only. Remember that is only for the swag. not the game)

    • 200$=All Tier 1 and Tier 2 Rewards and a SoA Top Contributor award with your own name for recognition.




  • All the funds even if the goal is not reached will still be put into the game in one way or another.  Even if I dont make my goal I will still continue to make my game till completion it may just take a bit longer to get there.


Remeber you can try it out and see if you like the game yourself the latest version of the demo is on the website http://shadowofarawyn.com/


If you have any questions or comments I can be reached in a multitude of ways:

Email:

shadowofarawyn@yahoo.com

Twitter:

https://twitter.com/ShadowOfAwaryn

Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/ShadowOfAwaryn

Feel free to like and follow me there.

story:
Short summary

This game is about an intelligent robot shut down and thrown away because of a manufacturing defect. With the help of his reserve energy, he managed to reboot the operating system and looking around he finds himself in the ruin of a city that once thrived. He goes on to explore the vastness ahead of him, struggling to stay alive, facing the dangers of the post-apocalyptic world he knows nothing about to find a better place to live.


What we need and what you get

We are a team of two from Hungary working on the grahics and coding of the game, and our partners, Input Studio from Portugal working on the sounds. We want to create entertaining games with unique stories and share it with you, but for that we need your help. The softwares, upkeep of a unique website and rights are too expensive for our purse and we need your help to finish this game and make it available to you.

     If we reach our basic goal of 7000€:
         iPhone/iPad, Android and PC version

     If we reach 8500€:
         We will be able to produce 3D miniatures

     If we reach 10000€:
         We buy better softwares and create an even better game than it is now


Other ways you can help

  • Show us that you care - like our Facebook page
  • Share the project with your friends.

Thank you!

story:
Introduction

Heya! I'm Janosz. I'm a semi-professional 3D artist, hobbyist coder and passionate gamer, and over the past weeks I've put together the basis for the retraux FPS featured here as a bit of a loveletter to days gone by.

I'm also the only person working on this. For now, at least. In the future, who knows.

About Hecatomb

Hecatomb is intended to be a first person shooter from nowhen in particular, but definitely the 90s, with most objects and all enemies being 2D sprites rather than 3D models (of a sort - a lot of it is still 3D renders), at low resolutions and 256 colours. Also, no aiming up and down. Back in the good old days, the enemy was straight ahead, or the bullets smart enough to know when to rise and fall.

The Story

You are... Gary. (I'm not good with names.) Gary was just a regular everyman until he was kidnapped by an evil cult that intends to sacrifice him in order to summon some manner of awful demon. Gary's having none of it, breaks out of his (curiously unlocked) cell and starts prodding buttock.

It's a retro FPS. Story optional.

How Much Game There Will Be

Keeping in line with the shooters I am trying to invoke, Hecatomb has an intended three episodes with ten levels each, plus one secret level per episode. The level in the video is primarily a mockup to demonstrate the visuals and gameplay.

The first episode would, as in the olden days, be released for free as what used to be called "Shareware".

I have concepts for another twelve enemies and six weapons, bringing the totals up to fourteen and ten, respectively.

Where the Money will go

To me! Ahahahahah! Aherm. To allowing me to focus on development without worrying about how I'm gonna pay the next electricity bill, basically. And, should this be sufficiently successful, also toward equipment that I either need or really *really* want. A respectable desk chair that one can sit in for longer than an hour at a time would be nice, for instance. Or a computer that doesn't feel like it's going to BSOD any second now, though that's only if the campaign is *really* successful so I'm not holding my breath.

Then there's game assets I can't create myself. That'd be sound effects and, as evidenced by the video, music.I would love to get Andrew Hulshult to compose some amazing music (as he always does) but that's, well, not in the current budget.

story:
From the bottom of our hearts thank you so much for giving us the boost to get this project off the ground! We can't thank you enough!

If you'd like to donate to the project post Indiegogo please use the button below:


PRESS:

"A love song to the history of video games" ~IGN.com
"As an homage to video games over history [SAMQ] is set up to evolve in the style the game is played. The music will be designed to evolve as well" ~VICE Noisey
"Genre bending platformed that crosses the worlds of electronic music and video games" ~DJ Mag
"The nostlagia simply makes me want to play the game so badly!" ~The Gamers Cottage 
"Every single level of SAMQ takes you through the history of video games" ~VanCityBuzz

Update N.2: VICE Noisey did a massive story on us with some embarrassing anecdotes from Dan Mangan. 

Update N.1: After the outpouring of support for our project we're launching this campaign to get SAMQ into the hands of gamers as quickly as possible. With your help we're going to launch a 3-4 world 'Episodic' version of the game. Thank you SO MUCH for your support and welcome to the team!

We started this journey with a simple dream. To create a love song to the history of video games by combining the graphics of every generation. We also wanted to offer console quality controls on touch screen devices, without the use of a D-Pad.

The title says it all. Super Adventure Mega Quest combines elements from numerous classic titles into one vision. With our new control scheme we've dubbed 'D-Padless', you can finally experience perfect platforming on a touch screen device.



In a far away world, not unlike our own, lied a happy planet. It was filled with creatures who all lived in harmony. Unless they were eating each other.


Suddenly and without warning, a dark being who hated all things, de-pixalated the world. Reducing it to a monochrome nightmare.


Unable to cope with their low resolution, the animals of the forest began to revolt. It was then, when things looked their darkest, that a hero named Leonardo came to the rescue.


By spreading love around the land, he knew he could slowly return the pixels to the planet. Now his quest begins to track down the evil one who cannot be named! Whose name is Bill.


For the first time gamers will be able to experience precision controls on a touch screen device. We spent months fine tuning a new control system specifically for this title. The goal was to bring console platforming to the portable market.


There's no on screen buttons to obstruct your view. Tapping anywhere on the left side of the screen will change your player's direction. The right side of the screen is jump, or double jump. Controls so basic your grandmother could pick it up and play, but levels become increasingly difficult until mastery is required.

Every single level of SAMQ takes you through the history of video games. They start out looking like an old school gameboy game, and change dynamically in front of you as you power up by collecting hearts.

The coolest thing about the dynamic changes is that certain secrets can only be found in specific resolutions. For example, you might find a key in the 1-Bit mode, and the door can only be found in the 16-bit mode. You can replay a beaten level in any resolution of your choosing to try and collect all the secrets.

An incredible team of some of todays most exciting artists are all composing an original soundtrack to SAMQ. Featuring  Dan Mangan,The Frederik, Alex Mind,Prototype Raptor,Ryan Enzed,  and Marc Remillard. Each level will feature four different compositions to match the different graphic styles.

Starting out with humble chip tunes, the music changes dynamically in front of you while you play. Slowly as you power up the resolution, the music simultaneously becomes more complex.


Here's a selection of samples from the first level to demonstrate the process.


We wanted to do crowd funding from the very beginning. We love the idea of working with our fans to try and shape the game before we even release it. Any donation will give you access to our exclusive developers blog where we'll post every step of the process. You'll be able to comment and dictate how you like the direction of the game.


At this stage we've completed all major programming for the title and have it fully up and running beautifully. We want to take it to the next level by hiring professional pixel artists to really give the retro levels an authentic look.

This is a mom and pop operation at its very core. For the last year it's been a team of two people working countless hours and sleepless nights to lift this project off the ground.

At our current rate we are confident with the proper funding we can complete a 3-4 world early release by 1st Quarter 2015. We'll continue to finish and update the project as we receive direct feedback from early adopters. We also are very keen on bringing it to multiple platforms shortly after.

While initially for iOS and Android devices, we will eventually release both Mac and PC versions. We also have stretch goals to port to Wii U, 3DS, Ouya, and PS Vita. If we can generate incredible amounts of funding, we'd love to eventually bring it to PS4 and XboxOne.

Lance Lasheras(Creator, Lead Design, Concept Artist, Soundtrack)

Lance Lasheras is a graduate of the University of British Columbia, and a life long video game fanatic. He has worked extensively in electronic music, collaborating with numerous artists and labels such as Mau5trap records. His passion for game development started early, after being published as young as 16 in MacAddict magazine for the video game 'Super Pag'. He's also worked with IGN.com as the producer of the highly popular 'Retro Remix' series which explores the history of video games.

As one half of the new music act 'Contra', he has recently contributed to the soundtrack for the upcoming Simon Pegg film 'Hector and the Pursuit of Happiness'.

Matt Roszak(Art Design, Lead Programmer, Level Design)

Matt Roszak attended art school in New Jersey founded by the legendary comic book artist, Joe Kubert. He worked as a comic book illustrator until his passion for video games and art led him into game development. He has worked for several game studios including Double Helix Games as a Senior 3D Artist. He has also worked on cutting edge projects for Paul Oakenfold and designed all the visuals for Skrillex's Mothership Tour.

Michael Winters (Sound Effects, Audio Design)

                                                

Michael Winters studied directly under oscar winning sound designer David Stone. After attending Savannah College of Art and Design, he went on to work for such AAA titles as 'League of Legends' and 'Alien Rage'. 

This project wouldn't be possible without you and we honestly can't thank you enough. But to try and thank you enough we have some awesome swag for you.


All donators get access to our exclusive members only blog and a shout out on our official Twitter. You will get to vote on levels, costumes, bosses, and nearly every aspect of the game inside the blog.

T-Shirts, Plush Dolls, and signed soundtracks are some of the fun treats available at very low donations. Exclusive to this Indiegogo are also the opportunity to have your company logo appear in the game, advertising to thousands at a fraction of the cost.

If you're feeling extra generous, you'll have a chance to live inside the game itself with your own character. Or help design a new enemy, level, and virtually anything as a director for a day!

And if you feel like becoming out 'Executive Producer', enjoy being the guest of honour at our wrap party which will feature several of the musicians composing the soundtrack for the game.

Unable to cope with their low resolution, the animals of the forest began to revolt. It was then, when things looked their darkest, that a hero named Leonardo came to the rescue.
By spreading love around the land, he knew he could slowly return the pixels to the planet. Now his quest begins to track down the evil one who cannot be named! Whose name is Bill.
For the first time gamers will be able to experience precision controls on a touch screen device. We spent months fine tuning a new control system specifically for this title. The goal was to bring console platforming to the portable market.
There's no on screen buttons to obstruct your view. Tapping anywhere on the left side of the screen will change your player's direction. The right side of the screen is jump, or double jump. Controls so basic your grandmother could pick it up and play, but levels become increasingly difficult until mastery is required.
Every single level of SAMQ takes you through the history of video games. They start out looking like an old school gameboy game, and change dynamically in front of you as you power up by collecting hearts.The coolest thing about the dynamic changes is that certain secrets can only be found in specific resolutions. For example, you might find a key in the 1-Bit mode, and the door can only be found in the 16-bit mode. You can replay a beaten level in any resolution of your choosing to try and collect all the secrets.
An incredible team of some of todays most exciting artists are all composing an original soundtrack to SAMQ. Featuring  Dan Mangan,The Frederik, Alex Mind,Prototype Raptor,Ryan Enzed,  and Marc Remillard. Each level will feature four different compositions to match the different graphic styles.
Starting out with humble chip tunes, the music changes dynamically in front of you while you play. Slowly as you power up the resolution, the music simultaneously becomes more complex.
Here's a selection of samples from the first level to demonstrate the process.
We wanted to do crowd funding from the very beginning. We love the idea of working with our fans to try and shape the game before we even release it. Any donation will give you access to our exclusive developers blog where we'll post every step of the process. You'll be able to comment and dictate how you like the direction of the game.
At this stage we've completed all major programming for the title and have it fully up and running beautifully. We want to take it to the next level by hiring professional pixel artists to really give the retro levels an authentic look.
This is a mom and pop operation at its very core. For the last year it's been a team of two people working countless hours and sleepless nights to lift this project off the ground.
At our current rate we are confident with the proper funding we can complete a 3-4 world early release by 1st Quarter 2015. We'll continue to finish and update the project as we receive direct feedback from early adopters. We also are very keen on bringing it to multiple platforms shortly after.While initially for iOS and Android devices, we will eventually release both Mac and PC versions. We also have stretch goals to port to Wii U, 3DS, Ouya, and PS Vita. If we can generate incredible amounts of funding, we'd love to eventually bring it to PS4 and XboxOne.
Lance Lasheras(Creator, Lead Design, Concept Artist, Soundtrack)Lance Lasheras is a graduate of the University of British Columbia, and a life long video game fanatic. He has worked extensively in electronic music, collaborating with numerous artists and labels such as Mau5trap records. His passion for game development started early, after being published as young as 16 in MacAddict magazine for the video game 'Super Pag'. He's also worked with IGN.com as the producer of the highly popular 'Retro Remix' series which explores the history of video games.
As one half of the new music act 'Contra', he has recently contributed to the soundtrack for the upcoming Simon Pegg film 'Hector and the Pursuit of Happiness'.
Matt Roszak(Art Design, Lead Programmer, Level Design)Matt Roszak attended art school in New Jersey founded by the legendary comic book artist, Joe Kubert. He worked as a comic book illustrator until his passion for video games and art led him into game development. He has worked for several game studios including Double Helix Games as a Senior 3D Artist. He has also worked on cutting edge projects for Paul Oakenfold and designed all the visuals for Skrillex's Mothership Tour.Michael Winters (Sound Effects, Audio Design)                                                Michael Winters studied directly under oscar winning sound designer David Stone. After attending Savannah College of Art and Design, he went on to work for such AAA titles as 'League of Legends' and 'Alien Rage'. 
This project wouldn't be possible without you and we honestly can't thank you enough. But to try and thank you enough we have some awesome swag for you.
All donators get access to our exclusive members only blog and a shout out on our official Twitter. You will get to vote on levels, costumes, bosses, and nearly every aspect of the game inside the blog.
T-Shirts, Plush Dolls, and signed soundtracks are some of the fun treats available at very low donations. Exclusive to this Indiegogo are also the opportunity to have your company logo appear in the game, advertising to thousands at a fraction of the cost.If you're feeling extra generous, you'll have a chance to live inside the game itself with your own character. Or help design a new enemy, level, and virtually anything as a director for a day!
And if you feel like becoming out 'Executive Producer', enjoy being the guest of honour at our wrap party which will feature several of the musicians composing the soundtrack for the game.

story:
Say Hello to our best sale ever.

Escape Code - Coding Adventure puts coding, technology and artificial intelligence into a fun but challenging environment. Do you like Criminal Case, Can You Escape and Walking Dead? You'll love Escape Code - Coding Adventure.

Play a smart plot.

Help! Max gets locked in the #1 tech factory in the world over holiday break. This is so unfair. All employees have left – haven't they?

Max must stop an evil Artificial Intelligence from destroying the world! Only you can get Max out. Meet a good AI that needs your help. Solve puzzles and coding problems to save us all and escape!

To help fund Escape Code - Coding Adventure, you can get it cheaper than retail price here on Indiegogo. Once released on the App Store, the game will be more expensive.

We will release Escape Code very soon. Don't miss your chance to get the game before everyone else - only on Indiegogo.

The Making of Escape Code

Escape Code has been in development for years. We are excited to share it with you, but we need your help on Indiegogo for funding. Development has been a long and arduous process. We've polished the game for many months.

John's Story

I started coding in 1997 and have made tons of games over the years. I released an XBox 360 game in 2010. I've prototyped games and ran a tech business ever since.

I made Escape Code to realize one of my major life goals. I wanted to make an innovative game that involved coding. But I didn't want to make it overly educational.

That's why Escape Code is an adventure game where all learning is tangential. The main focus is the escape story. I have fun when I code, and through Escape Code you too will experience the joy you can get from coding.

A clean game in the SpriteKit game engine

We stand out because we made Escape Code entirely in SpriteKit. SpriteKit is Apple's official game engine.

SpriteKit is robust, but few developers make games in it. It's a new framework. We're excited to see SpriteKit grow. Be an early adopter by being the first to play Escape Code!

One of the biggest games made with SpriteKit– likely the biggest.

We made Escape Code exclusively on Macs. Our game will look stunning on your Mac.

Do you like escape room games? Escape Code is like an escape room from the comfort of your own home. Built, designed and optimized for a clean adventure quest experience. You will not have to tediously type ANY code.

Made for Apple enthusiasts.

We took a year to perfect our game in Apple's exciting game engine SpriteKit. We chose Apple’s official programming language Swift for the game's coding challenges. You do not need any coding experience to play Escape Code.

Important: this is Mac-only. Unfortunately Apple doesn't accept coupons for iOS. Through Indiegogo we will deliver the Mac app version of Escape Code.

Engaging for all ages.

You can be ANY AGE to find something in Escape Code for you. If you have coding experience, you'll have double the fun. Find our computing Easter eggs! Brush up on your binary.

And watch out for plot twists along the way. How will Max's story end? You can only find out by playing! Explore the TERA factory. Accept brain challenges the artificial intelligence throws at you.

 

Play hours of engaging fun. Escape Code is compact and will keep you entertained without droning on for a long time. Stay engaged for the Goldilocks span of time – perfect.

Pledge to our Indiegogo while it's available. This deal will end soon.

A unique game like no other.

Escape Code is a challenging adventure game with a coding mechanic tied into plot. We won't force you to learn to code. Max will learn a thing or two about coding along the way. 

Our coding feature is one of a kind. There is no other SpriteKit adventure game with such innovate mechanics.

Get free access to our online school.

Pledge now to get Escape Code for Mac. You'll ALSO get lifetime access to Mammoth Interactive courses and games.

We at Mammoth Interactive innovated the technology sphere with cutting-edge tutorials. But we've always been gamers at heart. By making tech tutorials we prototyped tons of mechanics that led to Escape Code.

Pledge $109 or more to ALSO get an Escape Code t-shirt. We designed this limited-edition shirt. You can't buy it anywhere else. Wear your Escape Code Indiegogo shirt to show your support for online learning. Meet and recognize other games fans everywhere you go.

Get tons of rewards for pledging.

If you pledge 32$ or higher you will also get our game Pluvo. We published this minimalist puzzle platformer in November 2017. Now we are back with Escape Code - Coding Adventure! With your help we'll be able to make more games.

Your pledge will reward you with in-demand tech skills. You will learn skills for which employers seek talent every day.

Meet our game developer.

John Bura has been programming games since 1997. John is the owner of the game development studio Mammoth Interactive.

Mammoth Interactive produces XBOX 360, iPhone, iPad, Android, HTML 5, ad-games and more. We have a long history of making game-related and tech courses. We have included them in this Indiegogo as rewards for you.

John provides game design, audio, programming, level design and project management. He has contributed to 40 commercial games for companies including Nickelodeon. Several games John produced rose to the Top 10 in the Apple's App Store.

He has a daughter named Charlotte. In his spare time, he likes to cycle, ski and play ultimate Frisbee.

Why it took us so long to make this game…

We planned to finish Escape Code in 6 months, but we doubled the time. We needed a bigger team of talent to make the best game possible. Our designers have years of experience.

We collaborated with creators around the globe to make beautiful art and music. Our master team made a pleasing aesthetic. There's something to notice at every step through the game's TERA factory.

We are almost ready to launch Escape Code on iTunes.

Pledge if you love technology and games

Got questions? Feel free to comment on our page. We respond Monday to Friday excluding weekends and CAN/US holidays.

Get this offer only available now

story:
By helping to fund Wander, you are taking part in the development of a new concept in gaming. Wander uses exploration, beauty, cooperation and transformation to give you a unique player experience. You begin life as a tree, brought to life by a mysterious and powerful flower and go through various transformations as you progress. The game encourages you to explore the beautiful world around you and discover others like you who work together and become new entities each with their own unique form and power. If you have ever wondered what it’d be like to soar the skies and feel the wind blow under your wings as a griffon, be one with nature as a noble ent or swim the depths of the ocean as a agile amphibian, you can find out in Wander.

 


 

As Wander is all about co-operation, community and exploration, there is no combat in this game. Instead players encounter challenges and puzzles that can be solved more easily with the cooperation of others. You can explore a lush rainforest and take in the gorgeous scenery, dive in the ocean or fly above the landscape, discovering other companions along the way who will share their discoveries. The idea is to relax in a non-competitive world and immerse yourself in the sounds and music carefully woven together to create an experience like no other. There are, however, unpredictable storms to be encountered and your success at this depends on your ability to work with others to find shelter and get your friends to them, where you can then ride out the storms.

Embark on a journey of discovery, form a fellowship and piece together the great mysteries waiting to be discovered in the worlds of Wander.

 

Wander is going to be released at PAX Australia, on the 19th of July 2013.

 

If you'd like to read what others think about Wander please see the articles at  

Indie Statik

PC Gamer

Rock, Paper, Shotgun

 

    

Wander is going to be released no matter how much funding we get, but it could be even better if we had some extra funds. Funds would go towards:

 

  1. Oculus Rift Dev Kit $300 (+$67 postage to Australia) *Goal Reached* - "Oculus Rift is a new virtual reality (VR) headset designed specifically for video games. With an incredibly wide field of view, high resolution display, and ultra-low latency head tracking, the Rift provides a truly immersive experience that allows you to step inside your favorite game and explore new worlds like never before." This sounds like exactly the kind of thing that would enhance the experience of Wander and make Wander a really unique experience for Rift owners.
  2. Amplify Virtual Texturing $175 *Goal Reached* - Would mean we can have much higher quality textures, and reduce the memory requirements of Wander, so players with older machines can still play.
  3. Triton Water, $475 - The default water in the game engine we are using isn't great, but writing a good water shader that is attractive and high performance is very hard. Triton is very good looking, the devs are friendly and the performance is great.
  4. Additional copies of Unity $1500 / each - Would mean we could use additional machines for light mapping, which would cut baking times down considerably, allowing us to increase the quality of the lighting a lot.
  5. Texturing tools $690 - allegorithmic’s Substance Designer and Bitmap2Material, would also make things easier for our texturing artists, speeding up asset creation. These are currently available as a special bundled deal for $690.
  6. little bit of money for paying musicians to play instruments that we can't play would also make the sound track better, as we’re keen to use live musicians for the soundtrack. We already have a large collection of wonderful musicians donating their time; including guitarists, bassist, percussionist and vocalists. Our lead voice is a lyrical soprano opera singer.

 

 

Aaron, Anjay, Alex, Birrin, Chris, Daniel, David, David, Elaine, Garth, Jack, Joe, Justin, Loki, Sarah, Shelley, Sinead, Tadgh and YueYue are the Wander team. Members of the team have worked on many games before including major studio releases like My Little Pony and indie games like Dear Esther and Fruit Vs Robot.

As well as, or instead of contributing financially there are lots of ways to help:

  • Become an alpha tester and give detailed feedback and bug reports
  • Tell your friends about Wander and the IndieGoGo campaign
  • If you’re a skilled writer, artist, web designer, cinematographer, animator, promoter or programmer and want to donate your time, please get in contact.
  • If you’re going to PAX Australia, or another event, cosplay as a Wander character.
  • Vote for Wander on Steam Greenlight

The Wander team are very thankful for the support of Scalify, who are providing their Badumna framework to us, to Microsoft who are providing hosting on Windows Azure and to Razer who are supporting our booth at PAX Australia and providing their Razer Hydra motion controllers for us to develop with.

If you are interested to see more about Wander, please see our IndieDB page, where we have a large collection of screenshots, an active forum and gameplay videos. You can also get involved as an alpha tester.

Vote for us on Steam Greenlight!

story:
IMPORTANT!!

Jerry McPartlin will be made. Reaching our Goal, speeds up the development.
NOT reaching the Goal, doesn't mean, we are not making that Game, it will just take a little longer!!!



Our Story

Ed Venture Studios is a bright new little game studio, focused on developing classic Point & Click Adventures.

Founded last month, we started to develop our first episodic game.




Till now, there is no Publisher in sight and my team of ten has to work hard on that Game at night after our regular work. To speed things up and being Independent, we need your help.


Help us funding the First Episode.


If "Jerry McPartlin - Episode One" could be made full time, it's just a little step to convince a publisher to get Jerry on the Road.


But what is Jerry all about?


Jerry McPartlin is a Rock 'n Roll star (wannabe). He lives in a typical American town in the late 50th. With teenagers, Cadillacs & Rock 'n Roll.

Jerry has an eye on Luna, the owner of the local diner. But he never told her, because she likes his rival Johnny Lash.

The day his brother Bobby, an excellent pilot and hobby archeologist, got the job to fly a customer into the desert of Arizona, Jerry's life changes forever.

When they are attacked by strangers just on discovering a hidden room in their parents' house, and forced to leave immediately, they slowly start to realize that there is no turning back.

Jerry Mc Partlin is a rocking, exciting and funny adventure filled with Rock 'n Roll.

It has a never-before-seen graphical style. Toony geometry, mixed with realistic textures & lightning.




(Work in progress)


Jerry McPartlin is planned to be released in six episodes.

The production costs of one episode is somewhere between $65.000 and $70.000

Jerry McPartlin will be voiced over in English and German. Subtitles are planned (Italian, Spanish, French).

It will feature a rocking an rolling soundtrack, performed by one of Germany's best Rock 'n Roll bands "Hickory Cats".



The Impact

We really want do that Game. And we want to do it right. So we need to drop our regular jobs, and start working full time and heart blooded, so that the first episode could already be released this summer. Episode 2-6 are planned to be released in a two month steps.

If we don't reach that goal, we wouldn't be able to finish the first episode in the next 12-18 months.


What We Need & What You Get

So as mentioned, we need 70.000$ to produce the first episode.


The money will be spent to monthly pay the team.

 

3D Artists

Story Designer

Sound Designer

Concept Art

Animator

Programmer

 

And also to do the synchronization in English and German, recording the "Hickory Cats", many other little things, and to be honest: Lots of coffee.

 

Every single dollar helps us, reaching that goal. Even, if we shouldn't reach the entire $70.000, the Project will be done. It would just need more time. So if you'd like us to speed up and don't want to wait several month till the next Episode is ready...




Other Ways You Can Help

So everybody out there, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Tell your mom, tell your friends. Use your Facebook account, tell your favorite community.

Help us to make this adventure a success.

And also to do the synchronization in English and German, recording the "Hickory Cats", many other little things, and to be honest: Lots of coffee.
 
Every single dollar helps us, reaching that goal. Even, if we shouldn't reach the entire $70.000, the Project will be done. It would just need more time. So if you'd like us to speed up and don't want to wait several month till the next Episode is ready...





Other Ways You Can Help

So everybody out there, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Tell your mom, tell your friends. Use your Facebook account, tell your favorite community.
Help us to make this adventure a success.

story:
Do you know what AppOcean is?

AppOcean is an innovative new store for applications. The best: it is available for everyone, everywhere!

Whether user or developer. Whether windows, mac or linux. AppOcean runs on all devices.


          


AppOcean for Users

AppOcean is the new center for all your favorite apps on all your devices. It allows you to find, purchase, download, review and share all types of apps. There is a large selection of categories and your security is very important to us.

AppOcean provides you with free apps, games, in-app-purchases, cheap, innovative, productive apps and much more.

When you purchase an app in AppOcean, it gets easily downloaded and installed on your computer. But not only on one computer - by purchasing apps in AppOcean, you can use them on all of your devices, regardless of the operating system.

The payment of apps is done by PayPal. This keeps your payment data safe and enables you to pay easily. Furthermore, we ensure you (or your children) cannot make debts when purchasing apps: You transfer a fixed amount of money to your AppOcean-account, which you then can spend for apps or in-app-purchases. Of course, you always have to enter a password to perform a purchase.

When you download an app and after it is installed, you see it does not run on your device, you do not have to worry about spending money for nothing - up to one hour after the purchase, you can issue a refund and get the money back.

If we collected enough money with Indiegogo, we can provide AppOcean for you.

You will find a link for downloading AppOcean on our webpage. After installing the program, you can enter the world of AppOcean.


          


AppOcean for Developers

AppOcean is your chance to bring your own applications to all devices whether they run Windows, Mac OS or Linux. 

AppOcean offers more advantages than only a universal boundless platform:

With PayPal we arranged the payment for you and your applications. No complications with money anymore! You do not have to care about your payment or about complicated copy-protection systems - we've already done this for you.

In-app-purchases, enables you to earn money with free apps. This familar concept is finally brought to Desktop-Computers by AppOcean.

Added to that, you have the possibility to safe your applications with a copy protection. So your hard work on your app is not in vain for illegal duplication.

When AppOcean is started and gets more popular, a big majority of users will find your application. This means lot of users can rate your app, which will help you to improve your app and to reach more users.


WHY WE COLLECT MONEY

The money you spend to support us here on Indiegogo will primarily be used for three purposes: First, we will finance the server for about 2 years with this money. Furthermore, we want to pay a lawyer to work on our terms and conditions. Finally, we will use this money to pay advertisments and finance publishments to boost the user count of AppOcean.


PLANNED FEATURES

We have big plans for the future of AppOcean. Help us to make them real by supporting us here on Indiegogo:

After the project has achieved the first hurdles we plan to bring AppOcean to Android with its own Android-App so we can reach even more clients. This will enable you to buy an app once and run it on all of your computers and your smartphone! Thats great.

Another feature (optional) is that we want to help you to run Nintendo-Games via AppOcean on your PC. This works with an emulator.

We will build a gaming platform especially for your gaming experience. With that gaming platform, gamers will have access to global high scores, multiplayer matches and much much more…

An extended user-accounting system with social media links to your friends and their profiles is also planned. 

For the developers of our AppOcean-community we will build an extended bug reporting system for your apps. Additionally, we will bring dynamic IAPs and more to you.

What about you? We look forward to hearing your great ideas. Simply send a mail to the AppOcean-team. Can´t wait.



REWARDS

Help us to start AppOcean and we will reward your support:

Users, spending some money will get a special 'king' user account which shows all other users they have supported us.

Users spending a bigger amount to boost our project will receive gift codes for apps or money on their account.

Developers supporting us on Indiegogo will receive a free AppOcean-developer-account for one year (or more, depending on the donated amount). (usually 25€/year).


Please support us now to turn AppOcean into reality. Thanks a lot.

The AppOcean-team
