story:
Hello! I'm Phil Walker-Harding, a board and card game designer from Sydney, Australia. Games I have designed include: Archaeology: The Card Game, Dungeon Raiders and Pirates of the Spanish Main: Shuffling the Deck. While some of my games have been picked up by larger publishers, I have also been self-publishing my games since 2007 as Adventureland Games.

My latest card game is called Sushi Go! It is a super-fast card game about eating at a sushi restaurant! 

The game has been designed and play-tested. The art is mostly complete. However, seeing as I am a one-man operation and have a day job, I am going to need help to get this game to print! This is where you come in! Take a look at the video and the rest of this page, and if you decide to get involved with a pledge, I would be so grateful!

Thanks for visiting!

UPDATE - Tom Vasel of The Dice Tower made a nice video preview of the game.
Watch it here!

UPDATE - A couple more reviews of the game have recently been posted on the web! Check them out here: 
http://www.purplepawn.com/2012/12/sushi-go-second-look/
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/896113/a-light-and-enjoyable-meal-great-for-casual-player

 

 



Sushi Go! is a card game for 2-5 players and takes around 20 minutes. Just about anyone should be able to play, including kids from around ages 7 and up.

In the game, you are eating at a sushi restaurant, trying to grab the best combination of sushi dishes as they whizz by. Score points for collecting the most sushi rolls or making a full set of sashimi. Dip your favourite nigiri in wasabi to triple its value! And once you’ve eaten it all, finish your meal with all the pudding you’ve got! But be careful which sushi you allow your friends to take, it might be just what they need to beat you!

Sushi Go! takes the card drafting mechanic of games like Fairy Tale and 7 Wonders and distills it into a 20 minute game that anyone can play! The dynamics of 'draft and pass' are brought to the fore, while keeping the rules to a minimum. As you see the first few hands of cards, you must quickly assess the makeup of the round and decide which type of sushi you'll go for. Then, each turn you'll need to weigh up which cards you keep, and what you'll pass on. The different scoring combinations allow for some clever plays and nasty blocks. Round to round, you must also keep your eye on the goal of having the most pudding cards at the end of the game!

The game includes 108 cards and will come in a 2 piece rigid box (the box that is standard for publishers like Amigo and Z-Man Games).

You can download the full rules sheet for the game here:
Sushi Go! Rules (127k PDF)

You can download a print 'n' play version of the game to try out too. Just print out the cards on cardstock (or paper if you have card sleeves), cut them up and give it a try!
Sushi Go! Cards (559k PDF)

UPDATE - VOTE FOR YOUR FAVOURITE COVER DESIGN!
Let us know which concept you like best for the cover! Please note these are only draft versions to give you an idea of the way the cover may look.

 

If you'd like to help out, you can pledge any amount! But there are certain perks at certain levels:

If you pledge $20, you'll receive a copy of the game once it is printed!

If you are one of the first 30 people to pledge $20, you'll also receive a copy of Dungeon Raiders, my dungeon adventure card game from 2011. You can find out more about the game here.

if you pledge $80 you'll receive the game, and a one-of-a-kind made-to-order piece of sushi art! Pick your favourite Sushi Go! character, and give us a scene or situation to put him in - use your imagination! We'll send you a high quality print and a digitalversion of the finished product.

If you pledge $200 and are a little crazy, you'll get 12 copies of the game! That's a whole case!

International shipping is included for all of these perks!
The estimated arrival time for the finished game is March/April 2013.

SPECIAL GIFT!
As a little way of saying thank-you for such a great start to our campaign, all pledges of $20 or more will receive The Sushi Go! Sticker Collection! For those of you who have kids, teach kids or just like stickers, I hope this is a bit of fun. This gift is for everyone who has already pledged as well as new pledges. Check out some sample art of how they might look!...

 

As this is my first time using crowd-funding, I really have no idea how this project will go! But if we receive even more support than we are asking for, we will give you all something extra!

At $6,000 we'll add 'scoring placemat' cards to the game! These are a fun and simple method for keeping score.  

 At $7,000 we'll upgrade the rules sheet to a super cool rules booklet featuring a Sushi Go! comic strip!

If we get even higher... we will consider even bigger things like an iOS version of Sushi Go!

 

Thanks again for visiting, and for your support!

story:
Summary

The 2012 CrossFit Atlanta team would like to invite you to join us for two great causes. Our main event is Tiki For Rylie which will be held at CrossFit Atlanta on July 1st.  We will feature fun activities, a raffle, a dunk tank, food and a "Beat The Team".  

In the event that you cannot attend in person, and would like to contribute, you may do so here. 

Where will the proceeds go? 

All proceeds will be split 50/50.  The first half will go towards Rylie Rahall. Rylie is the 2-year-old daughter of a close and personal friend of CrossFit Atlanta. Rylie was diagnosed with a rare genetic disorder called Ataxia-Telangiectasi (AT). Due to its rare nature, AT at the bottom of the research funding list, and relies on fundrasiers like this to fund its research.  Therefore, 50% will go towards the AT Children's Project.

The second half will go towards sending the CrossFit Atlanta team to the 2012 Reebok CrossFit Games!

To find out more about Rylie, and the AT Children's Project, visit this website: http://www.atcp.org/rylie

Thank you for your contribution!

story:
Tyler: Model-005 is a 3D action-platformer and exploration game set in the 1950s where you control a spunky miniature robot named Tyler. Many years after being shut down Tyler is accidentally powered up during the height of a thunderstorm, you set off with Tyler to discover why your creator is missing and what has happened to your home, which is now overrun with robot-sized rats, cockroaches, and more.

Size plays a huge part Tyler: Model-005. As Tyler, you are a miniscule machine. Pencils and coffee mugs can become weapons. Chairs, stairs and bookshelves are obstacles to your progress - things that are normal take on a completely new dimension in Tyler’s world. Even if you simply want to explore, all the 1950s environments are handcrafted to include a variety of puzzles, collectibles, and climbables. Details are important to breathe life into a game, and, as Tyler, it’s your role to find out as much as you can.

But stairs aren’t your only obstacles. Dozens of different enemies will stand in the way of your goal. While ants and rats may not be the smartest creatures, being swarmed by hordes of them will make life difficult. Luckily, you and Tyler are equipped with a variety of different weapons, from your trusty bolt blade to boxing gloves. Samurai swords, Sticks! Cherry bombs! All of it will allow you to carve your way through the pests that have infested your home while your creator has been missing. Tyler’s relying on your help, so use every tool you discover to find the right combination for you.

An important element we wanted to present to this Indiegogo was a playable demo of the very opening segment of the game - the Basement and a few of the early rooms. We didn’t want to give too much of the story away, but we wanted you to be able to try out the gameplay in Tyler.  Currently, the only section that has a degree of polish is the Basement, continuing play past that section may result in getting stuck or finding other weirdness.

But that’s why we’re here on Indiegogo, to give the game a few more months of polish and shine before launching. We believe you’ll be able to get a sense of what the game will become and what sort of experiences you’ll enjoy as you explore. Check it out!


Hi! I’m Tyler, the robot you’ve been reading about for the last few minutes. Running around with me looks pretty fun, right? My creator was a very, very smart man, and he gave me all sorts of different abilities that aren’t normal for a solar-powered robot. I mean, I guess solar-powered robots aren’t typical either. That reminds me - let me tell you a bit more about myself!

 

Like I said before, any light source keeps me charged up. Running around rooms is dangerous, but it gets even worse if I’m in the dark. I can’t even imagine what it’s like in a dungeon - or a sewer! Finding light switches or kerosene lamps will let me do more exploring, which is what I like to do best.

 

When I’m powered up, you can use my energy source to move objects like coffee mugs, pencils or boxes. I can even use these as bug crushers if I need to!

 

I’m not the only robot my master made though, there’s quite a few of us running around, according to my mate, Conrad. I’m not sure if I trust that guy, but he seems sure that there’s a couple others tucked around my creator’s house. The more of them I run into the more I’ll be able to find out what happened to my creator!

 

 

And the coolest thing (which I’m not exactly sure how my creator managed to invent this) is the time shifting powers he gave me! I can travel back and forth through time - how cool is that?! So who knows, maybe I already know the answers to all my own questions and I just don’t want to give you any spoilers!

 

Spoiler alert: Captain Picard totally killed Gandal with Dumbledore’s help. Luke Skywalker was there too. Hah!

With his ability to time travel, Tyler is able to discover and wear a huge assortment of diverse outfits. Anything from medieval helmets to pixelated eyeglasses are possible, and you can see a large number of these in our trailer and throughout the GIFs on this Indiegogo. As a special gift for anyone that opts to back a tier level that includes a digital copy, we’re going to give you an exclusive “American Slasher” skin, which you can see below. It’s totally appropriate for Halloween! Other Indiegogo tiers also include additional customization options, allowing you to outfit Tyler however you’d like.

 

While static images are great, we also wanted to give you an even more in-depth look at some of the customization options available to you, so we’ve utilized SketchFab - the online 3D model viewer - to create embeddable art for you to look at. Below you’ll find several of our different in-game outfits. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do.

https://sketchfab.com/models/337f912e654748f984e6cf1def00809d

https://sketchfab.com/models/a5e4d1e9d4794182be1c70992f44bea4

Finally, we know that Tyler is awesome. Your journey with him will be chock full of personality. We think he’s pretty adorable, and we hope you do too. So as one of our Indiegogo perks, we’re including a 4” figurine of Tyler available. The Tyler statue is a high-quality full-color 3D print in a sandstone material. He’ll look great perched on the edge of your desk!

Note: Tyler’s Statue is for decorative purposes only. We’d be sad if Tyler broke.

Reversed Interactive is a very small team. Most of the development has been done out of pocket up until this point, and we fully anticipate to simply cover future costs with the funding you help us raise. However, we also know that Indiegogo can be a powerful platform and community, and we hope that - with your help - we can bring a fully realized amazing experience to gamers throughout the world.

Although we’ve implemented many of the core features of the game, we know that the game needs more polish and additional content to match what exists in other action-adventure games on the market. We want to add more levels, animations, costumes, enemies, voice acting, and features into the final product, and that will only be possible with your help via this Indiegogo.

Your funding will help us bring Tyler’s world to life and make it so you can fully immerse yourself in the novelty of running a tiny robot through a delipidated 1950s home. We know that you can help us make this vision a reality.

Lance Gardener

Game Director and Lead Developer

Pretty much does all the core bits of Tyler, everything from design /modeling and coding to creating the clever 1950s era set pieces.

Favorite Games:

Fable series, Fallout, Turok,  B.O.B.

Tyler Durham

Music Writer And Composer.

In charge of all music flowing throughout the world of Tyler: Model 005 and casting vocalists to achieve that 1950s sound.

Favorite Games:

Metal Gear Solid, Last of Us, Mass Effect, Starcraft.

Martyn Luke

Lead Voice Actor

The voice behind Tyler and a few other mad little characters you will come across in
Tyler: Model 005

Favorite Games:

Streets of Rage, Dead Space, Condemned, Half Life, Fable.

Cody Bye

QA, Content Editor, Community Marketing

Creates much of the textual content surrounding Tyler, from script writing to this Indiegogo campaign. He also tries to shine up and polish Tyler as much as possible.

Favorite Games:

Baldur’s Gate 1 & 2, Everquest, X-wing vs. Tie Fighter, Curse of Monkey Island, Goldeneye: 007 (N64), and Destiny.

Thanks for reading and check out our websites for more information and updates on Tyler: Model-005.

My creator was a very, very smart man, and he gave me all sorts of different abilities that aren’t normal for a solar-powered robot. I mean, I guess solar-powered robots aren’t typical either. That reminds me - let me tell you a bit more about myself! Like I said before, any light source keeps me charged up. Running around rooms is dangerous, but it gets even worse if I’m in the dark. I can’t even imagine what it’s like in a dungeon - or a sewer! Finding light switches or kerosene lamps will let me do more exploring, which is what I like to do best. When I’m powered up, you can use my energy source to move objects like coffee mugs, pencils or boxes. I can even use these as bug crushers if I need to! I’m not the only robot my master made though, there’s quite a few of us running around, according to my mate, Conrad. I’m not sure if I trust that guy, but he seems sure that there’s a couple others tucked around my creator’s house. The more of them I run into the more I’ll be able to find out what happened to my creator!  And the coolest thing (which I’m not exactly sure how my creator managed to invent this) is the time shifting powers he gave me! I can travel back and forth through time - how cool is that?! So who knows, maybe I already know the answers to all my own questions and I just don’t want to give you any spoilers! Spoiler alert: Captain Picard totally killed Gandal with Dumbledore’s help. Luke Skywalker was there too. Hah!With his ability to time travel, Tyler is able to discover and wear a huge assortment of diverse outfits. Anything from medieval helmets to pixelated eyeglasses are possible, and you can see a large number of these in our trailer and throughout the GIFs on this Indiegogo. As a special gift for anyone that opts to back a tier level that includes a digital copy, we’re going to give you an exclusive “American Slasher” skin, which you can see below. It’s totally appropriate for Halloween! Other Indiegogo tiers also include additional customization options, allowing you to outfit Tyler however you’d like. While static images are great, we also wanted to give you an even more in-depth look at some of the customization options available to you, so we’ve utilized SketchFab - the online 3D model viewer - to create embeddable art for you to look at. Below you’ll find several of our different in-game outfits. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do.https://sketchfab.com/models/337f912e654748f984e6cf1def00809dhttps://sketchfab.com/models/a5e4d1e9d4794182be1c70992f44bea4Finally, we know that Tyler is awesome. Your journey with him will be chock full of personality. We think he’s pretty adorable, and we hope you do too. So as one of our Indiegogo perks, we’re including a 4” figurine of Tyler available. The Tyler statue is a high-quality full-color 3D print in a sandstone material. He’ll look great perched on the edge of your desk!Note: Tyler’s Statue is for decorative purposes only. We’d be sad if Tyler broke.Reversed Interactive is a very small team. Most of the development has been done out of pocket up until this point, and we fully anticipate to simply cover future costs with the funding you help us raise. However, we also know that Indiegogo can be a powerful platform and community, and we hope that - with your help - we can bring a fully realized amazing experience to gamers throughout the world.Although we’ve implemented many of the core features of the game, we know that the game needs more polish and additional content to match what exists in other action-adventure games on the market. We want to add more levels, animations, costumes, enemies, voice acting, and features into the final product, and that will only be possible with your help via this Indiegogo.Your funding will help us bring Tyler’s world to life and make it so you can fully immerse yourself in the novelty of running a tiny robot through a delipidated 1950s home. We know that you can help us make this vision a reality.Lance GardenerGame Director and Lead DeveloperPretty much does all the core bits of Tyler, everything from design /modeling and coding to creating the clever 1950s era set pieces.Favorite Games:Fable series, Fallout, Turok,  B.O.B.Tyler DurhamMusic Writer And Composer.In charge of all music flowing throughout the world of Tyler: Model 005 and casting vocalists to achieve that 1950s sound.Favorite Games:Metal Gear Solid, Last of Us, Mass Effect, Starcraft.Martyn LukeLead Voice ActorThe voice behind Tyler and a few other mad little characters you will come across inTyler: Model 005Favorite Games:Streets of Rage, Dead Space, Condemned, Half Life, Fable.Cody ByeQA, Content Editor, Community MarketingCreates much of the textual content surrounding Tyler, from script writing to this Indiegogo campaign. He also tries to shine up and polish Tyler as much as possible.Favorite Games:Baldur’s Gate 1 & 2, Everquest, X-wing vs. Tie Fighter, Curse of Monkey Island, Goldeneye: 007 (N64), and Destiny.Thanks for reading and check out our websites for more information and updates on Tyler: Model-005.

story:
Steam Store Page

Summary

The purpose for this campaign is to help development of Mech Merc Company be ready for Steam early access. Backers will get Steam pre-release keys so they can play the career mode as it is being created, and higher tier backers will be able to leave their mark on the game.

Mech Merc Company is meant to pay homage to the classic Mechwarrior titles of the 90's and early 2000's. The design is largely based on Mechwarrior 2: Mercenaries with considerations from sequel titles. The gameplay will be playing missions, designing mechs, and managing your mercenary company. The target audience is those that want a more old school style hardcore mech simulation with complex mech designing and business management elements.

What sets Mech Merc Company apart is the mech customization is improvement on the best ideas from Mechwarrior games.  Some more advance mechanics have been added such as weapons supporting multiple ammo types, weapon modification system, laser arrays, and manual guided missiles.

This campaign is flexible, because I am promising that Mech Merc Company will be for sale on Steam as part of the early access program at some point in some state. Even after launching into early access it will require many more years of development to be a finished game.

At the end of the campaign emails will be sent out with the Steam keys and instructions for submitting materials related to pilots and factions.

Perk Items

Pre-Release Steam Key: This will give to the game on Steam, and you will be able to play the career mode during the early stages of development before it is for sale.

Unique Pilot: Backers will be able to submit pilot call sign, description, portrait image, and voice clips for the creation of their own unique pilot that can be hired in career mode or used in instant action. Veteran pilots start with 60 gunnery skill and elite pilots start with 80 gunnery skill. Backers will be able to submit materials for their unique pilot at any point while the game is in development.

Criteria for unique pilot:

  • Must be safe for work.
  • Pilot call sign must be no more than 30 characters including spaces.
  • Pilot description must be no more than 500 characters including spaces.
  • Backer must have permission to allow this project to use the pilot image.
  • If the pilot image is commissioned, then it must be made for commercial use.
  • Pilot image must be a portrait of your pilot.
  • Pilot image should be semi-realistic and not overly stylized.
  • Pilot image must be 256x256 pixels or larger.
  • Pilot image should be in PNG format with transparent background.
  • Backer must have permission to allow this project to use the voice clips.
  • Pilot voice clips need to be audible and in English.

 

Merc or Pirate Faction: Backers will be able to submit name, description, paint scheme description, and logo for your own mercenary company or pirate faction that will appear in the game. The paint scheme will be attempted to be created based on your description. Backers can submit materials for their faction at any point while the game is in development.

Criteria for Faction:

  • Must be safe for work.
  • Name must be no more than 30 characters including spaces.
  • Description must be no more than 500 characters including spaces.
  • Description of paint scheme should consist of colors and patterns.
  • Backer must have permission to allow this project to use the faction logo.
  • If the faction logo is commissioned, then it must be made for commercial use.
  • Faction logo must be 256x256 pixels or larger.
  • Faction logo should be in PNG format with transparent background.

 

For Patreon Supporters

For anyone who gave to the closed Patreon campaign do not have to back this campaign. For those that gave $10 or more can have their own unique legendary pilot, and for those that gave $20 or more can also have their own mercenary company or pirate faction.

story:
Xeno Crisis is a new, original title for the Sega Mega Drive / Genesis and Dreamcast which will be released both as a physical cartridge and also as a downloadable ROM. At its core, it's an arena shooter for up to 2 players that takes inspiration from the likes of Smash TV, Contra, Mercs, Granada, Alien Syndrome, Zombies Ate My Neighbours, Chaos Engine, and Shock Troopers.

We want the game to look, feel and sound like the classic Mega Drive games of the '80s and '90s, but also add some new elements that weren't so common in games of that era, particularly procedural map generation and randomisation of gameplay elements. Achieving that classic look and feel is vitally important to us, which is why we've teamed up with legendary pixel artist Henk Nieborg, who previously worked on the Mega Drive title "The Misadventures Of Flink", developed by Psygnosis.

We're also working with "Savaged Regime"; a highly renowned chip-tune artist that knows how to push the Mega Drive's YM2612 chip to the limit - you can hear a sample of the Xeno Crisis soundtrack in the Kickstarter video above.

The game is currently at the prototype stage and we will be releasing the finished product in October 2018 to coincide with the 30th anniversary of the Mega Drive's launch in Japan. We're launching this Kickstarter campaign to fund the remainder of the title's development.

 

The focus of Xeno Crisis' gameplay is the intense combat which pits you (and optionally another player) against thousands of alien enemies - players take control of a male or female marine capable of moving and shooting in 8 directions, and they can also perform an evasive roll to get out of tricky situations. If things get really desperate then a grenade can be deployed, destroy anything nearby, giving the player a brief moment of respite.

Players have several weapons at their disposal, but ammo is limited so players must constantly be on the move, grabbing new weapons and extra ammo as they go. When a room has been cleared of all hostiles the player(s) can choose which exit to take, with the aim being to rescue any of the colony's inhabitants who might still be alive, and then progress to the area's boss. There are 6 areas in total, each with their own enemies, hazards, secrets and gameplay nuances.

Every few enemies killed will result in a set of dog-tags being dropped - these can be collected and exchanged for upgrades between areas.

Should the player run out of health they will be taken to the 'Continue' screen, where they can decide to continue the fight or start over - the player begins the game with 3 continues but more can be acquired between areas. If a player runs out of health in 2-player mode, that player will remain down until the end of the room, at which point they’ll be revived automatically.

The arena shooter has seen something of a resurgence in recent years in the form of Geometry Wars, Enter The Gungeon, Nuclear Assault and The Binding Of Isaac, but the genre was defined back in the early 1980s through games such as Berzerk and Robotron: 2084. Xeno Crisis certainly takes inspiration from these great titles, and particularly Robotron's spiritual successor, Smash TV, utilising a similar game flow.

We've expanded upon this popular and successful formula though by adding new elements which are better suited to console titles, such as the ability to backtrack, a keycard system, an equipment screen, procedural map generation and randomisation of enemies and pickups.

A breakdown of Xeno Crisis' key features:

  • Intense arena-based combat where the player must constantly be on their toes, prioritising which enemies to engage next, and ensuring they don't run out of ammo.
  • Procedurally generated maps and rooms, so you never know what's coming up, and you have to adapt your tactics on a room-by-room basis.
  • Optional 2-player co-operative play, so you can take the fight to the enemy with a friend - just make sure you share the ammo!
  • 6 diverse areas to explore, each with their own obstacles and hazards, and secrets, including The Outpost and The Nest:

  • Upgrade system which allows you to adapt the game to your style of play - are you a cautious player or more gung-ho?
  • An arsenal of 9 different weapons to switch things up and turn the tables in your favour.
  • 6 intimidating bosses, each of which will demand you to learn a different strategy to defeat them.
  • Two modes of play; once you've completed the Arcade mode you can try your hand at the Infinite mode, where even veteran players will find a challenge.
  • Two difficulty levels; "Rookie" and "Hardcorps". Playing on Rookie will mean easier progress, but you won't be able to see the "good" ending!

As you progress through the colony you will come across many different enemies, each with their own traits and means of attack. Many of them can be gunned down without too much thought, but others will require the player to outflank them, attack them within a certain time window, or be avoided altogether! Here are the first few enemies you'll encounter:

There are several weapons at your disposal, each with their own characteristics. Although your standard issue pulse rifle is perfectly capable of taking on the enemy, other weapons can give you advantages in certain situations, so picking them up is generally advisable - just don't run out of ammo!

At the end of each area you will be given the chance to exchange any dog-tags you've collected for upgrades ranging from extra health to weapon power-ups to extra continues. Which upgrades you go for will depend on your style of play.

Bitmap Bureau was formed early in 2016 with the intention of creating innovative and polished 2D games for desktops and consoles. Previously our core team have been part of the award winning mobile studio, IOMO, and also the prominent Flash / desktop game development team, Megadev. Our industry experience dates back to 1995 and we've worked with publishers such as Namco, Adult Swim, Disney and Eidos on over 100 successfully completed projects.

We've always been huge fans of the Sega Mega Drive though, and we felt the time was right to develop our first full game for the legendary 16-bit system. Although Xeno Crisis will be our first commercial release for the Mega Drive, we've had experience developing for the system at the 2016 Global Game Jam - we were given just 48 hours to develop a game but it was more like 24 in the end!

We were still able to put together a fun little shooter titled "Fatal Smarties", and it was a great exercise in getting to grips with the hardware - we're confident that without the constraints of a gamejam we'll be able to produce a much better product.

Regarding the development status of Xeno Crisis, many of the trickier features have already been implemented, including procedural map generation...

...and procedural room generation:

Most of the remaining work is implementing new enemies and level features, which we are confident won't cause any major problems.

We're also looking to integrate a range of complex effects and clever technical tricks on the Sega Mega Drive / Genesis. For example, we've created a custom tool chain for animated intros (on the same principles as used by Sonic 3D as described by GameHut).

4 video frames composited for processing

 

 

We have collated many of the most commonly used Mega Drive variants from each territory, including the Mega Drive/Genesis 1, 2 and 3, as well as the "Nomad" - the portable Mega Drive, and the RetroN 5. These will be used to test the game at regular intervals to ensure that the game works and plays well no matter whether it's being played on PAL or NTSC hardware.

Some of our Mega Drive collection

We also have some of the best CRT displays you can find including the NEC XP29 Plus, the SONY BVM 2010p and the Sony PVM 20L4, as we want to play and test Xeno Crisis on the most authentic hardware available - it's all about them scanlines!

There's also the controllers - we'll be designing and testing the game with the standard 3 button pad, the 6 button pad, as well as the Arcade Stick I and II.

A breakdown of one of the Japanese cartridges

We've come up with several rewards for all budgets - take a look!

Xeno Crisis ROM

Receive a downloadable ROM file of Xeno Crisis for use with your favourite Sega Genesis / Mega Drive emulator or compatible flash cartridge.

Xeno Crisis (boxed with manual)

Receive a boxed multi-region (PAL/NTSC/NTSC-J) cartridge of Xeno Crisis compatible with the original Sega Genesis / Mega Drive console (versions I, II and III) complete with instruction manual.

The NTSC / PAL box and cartridge variant (placeholder artwork)

Xeno Crisis Official Soundtrack

All backers will get a link to download the Xeno Crisis soundtrack, available in WAV, FLAC, MP3 and VGM formats.

Xeno Crisis Dreamcast

Xeno Crisis Dreamcast CD Jewel Case (placeholder artwork)

Receive a version of Xeno Crisis for Sega Dreamcast on a high quality pressed CD presented in an NTSC-J style jewel case. Multi-region and playable on all CD-compatible Dreamcast consoles.

Xeno Crisis Nintendo Switch and Steam PC/Mac/Linux

Receive a digital copy of the game when it's released! Choose between a Nintendo Switch or Steam PC/Mac/Linux version.

Thank you to everyone who has supported Xeno Crisis and helped us reach our funding goal in just 40 hours! We never anticipated that the project would gain so much interest in such a short space of time, below you will find our current stretch goals. 

First stretch goal achieved! Henk Nieborg has kindly put together a quick version of the female marine for everyone to have a look at:

We’ll also be looking to create a blue male marine variation and a green female marine; so you will be able to play the game with any combination of male/female players if you wish.

We’d always hoped that we would be able to bring Xeno Crisis to Dreamcast, and that will become possible if we hit this funding goal. The controls will be carefully tweaked to work perfectly with the standard Dreamcast controller, as well as the Arcade Stick.

Third stretch goal achieved! We’re adding a whole new 6th area to the game with its own unique tileset. Including a new boss to go with the area and the extra cutscenes to integrate the area within the game and story.

We also really want to create an authentic experience, so with this stretch goal we will be producing Japanese translated box art / manuals, as the Japanese releases were always distinctively different, and it’s important to us that we do it justice.

We will also be translating the in-game text and assets to the following languages:

English / French / Italian / German / Spanish / Portuguese (+ Brazilian) / Dutch / Japanese

Fourth stretch goal achieved! We’ll now be Blast Processing and pushing the Mega Drive to its limits with a whole range of features and additions to the game including:

  • Bonus stage
  • Boss rush mode
  • Extra enemies
  • Speed run seeds

We’ll also look to add where possible (after technically assessing and gameplay testing) a range of other backer requested extras like gore mode and a knife attack.

Our fifth stretch goal is to port Xeno Crisis to the Nintendo Switch and for Steam on PC/Mac/Linux. We love the Nintendo Switch and think it’ll be great to play Xeno Crisis on a handheld device (for those of us that don’t own a Sega Nomad!).

We’ve added a new £10 pledge for those of you who just want the Nintendo Switch or Steam PC/Mac/Linux version, but backers of any Xeno Crisis pledge will be able to add-on £10 to their pledge to receive the Nintendo Switch or Steam PC/Mac/Linux version (you will be able to choose which version you want in a survey after the campaign).

If you want to keep up to date with the development of Xeno Crisis or just see what we're up to in general, then here are the obligatory social media links!

Facebook: facebook.com/BitmapBureau

Twitter: @BitmapBureau

Website: bitmapbureau.com

Special thanks

Additional art and story: Stefan Barnett

Additional design, QA and photography: Daniel Hayball

Voiceovers and feedback: George Exley

Mega Drive, Sega Genesis and Sega Dreamcast are trademarks of SEGA corporation. Xeno Crisis is not endorsed, licensed, produced or sponsored by SEGA corporation.

Risks and challenges

Creating a Mega Drive game is no mean feat, and we're fully aware that it will be a challenge, particularly on the technical side. However, we are extremely confident that we can complete the project on time and on budget - the game is already in a playable state on the actual Mega Drive hardware, with most of the more complex tasks such as collision detection, procedural map generation and memory management already taken care of.

We also have an excellent track record in completing game development projects across multiple platforms dating back over 15 years. The biggest risk we see is the manufacturing schedule for the cartridges, but we will be ensuring development is complete with enough buffer for any last minute technical challenges and/or manufacturing delays.

These will be used to test the game at regular intervals to ensure that the game works and plays well no matter whether it's being played on PAL or NTSC hardware.Some of our Mega Drive collectionWe also have some of the best CRT displays you can find including the NEC XP29 Plus, the SONY BVM 2010p and the Sony PVM 20L4, as we want to play and test Xeno Crisis on the most authentic hardware available - it's all about them scanlines!There's also the controllers - we'll be designing and testing the game with the standard 3 button pad, the 6 button pad, as well as the Arcade Stick I and II.A breakdown of one of the Japanese cartridgesWe've come up with several rewards for all budgets - take a look!Xeno Crisis ROMReceive a downloadable ROM file of Xeno Crisis for use with your favourite Sega Genesis / Mega Drive emulator or compatible flash cartridge.Xeno Crisis (boxed with manual)Receive a boxed multi-region (PAL/NTSC/NTSC-J) cartridge of Xeno Crisis compatible with the original Sega Genesis / Mega Drive console (versions I, II and III) complete with instruction manual.The NTSC / PAL box and cartridge variant (placeholder artwork)Xeno Crisis Official SoundtrackAll backers will get a link to download the Xeno Crisis soundtrack, available in WAV, FLAC, MP3 and VGM formats.Xeno Crisis DreamcastXeno Crisis Dreamcast CD Jewel Case (placeholder artwork)Receive a version of Xeno Crisis for Sega Dreamcast on a high quality pressed CD presented in an NTSC-J style jewel case. Multi-region and playable on all CD-compatible Dreamcast consoles.Xeno Crisis Nintendo Switch and Steam PC/Mac/LinuxReceive a digital copy of the game when it's released! Choose between a Nintendo Switch or Steam PC/Mac/Linux version.Thank you to everyone who has supported Xeno Crisis and helped us reach our funding goal in just 40 hours! We never anticipated that the project would gain so much interest in such a short space of time, below you will find our current stretch goals. First stretch goal achieved! Henk Nieborg has kindly put together a quick version of the female marine for everyone to have a look at:We’ll also be looking to create a blue male marine variation and a green female marine; so you will be able to play the game with any combination of male/female players if you wish.We’d always hoped that we would be able to bring Xeno Crisis to Dreamcast, and that will become possible if we hit this funding goal. The controls will be carefully tweaked to work perfectly with the standard Dreamcast controller, as well as the Arcade Stick.Third stretch goal achieved! We’re adding a whole new 6th area to the game with its own unique tileset. Including a new boss to go with the area and the extra cutscenes to integrate the area within the game and story.We also really want to create an authentic experience, so with this stretch goal we will be producing Japanese translated box art / manuals, as the Japanese releases were always distinctively different, and it’s important to us that we do it justice.We will also be translating the in-game text and assets to the following languages:English / French / Italian / German / Spanish / Portuguese (+ Brazilian) / Dutch / JapaneseFourth stretch goal achieved! We’ll now be Blast Processing and pushing the Mega Drive to its limits with a whole range of features and additions to the game including:
Bonus stage
Boss rush mode
Extra enemies
Speed run seeds
We’ll also look to add where possible (after technically assessing and gameplay testing) a range of other backer requested extras like gore mode and a knife attack.Our fifth stretch goal is to port Xeno Crisis to the Nintendo Switch and for Steam on PC/Mac/Linux. We love the Nintendo Switch and think it’ll be great to play Xeno Crisis on a handheld device (for those of us that don’t own a Sega Nomad!).We’ve added a new £10 pledge for those of you who just want the Nintendo Switch or Steam PC/Mac/Linux version, but backers of any Xeno Crisis pledge will be able to add-on £10 to their pledge to receive the Nintendo Switch or Steam PC/Mac/Linux version (you will be able to choose which version you want in a survey after the campaign).If you want to keep up to date with the development of Xeno Crisis or just see what we're up to in general, then here are the obligatory social media links!Facebook: facebook.com/BitmapBureauTwitter: @BitmapBureauWebsite: bitmapbureau.comSpecial thanksAdditional art and story: Stefan BarnettAdditional design, QA and photography: Daniel HayballVoiceovers and feedback: George ExleyMega Drive, Sega Genesis and Sega Dreamcast are trademarks of SEGA corporation. Xeno Crisis is not endorsed, licensed, produced or sponsored by SEGA corporation.Risks and challengesCreating a Mega Drive game is no mean feat, and we're fully aware that it will be a challenge, particularly on the technical side. However, we are extremely confident that we can complete the project on time and on budget - the game is already in a playable state on the actual Mega Drive hardware, with most of the more complex tasks such as collision detection, procedural map generation and memory management already taken care of.We also have an excellent track record in completing game development projects across multiple platforms dating back over 15 years. The biggest risk we see is the manufacturing schedule for the cartridges, but we will be ensuring development is complete with enough buffer for any last minute technical challenges and/or manufacturing delays.

story:
I'm a one man indie game studio creating an overhead shooter based on something most of us hated in Middle School. Don't worry, this is definitely not an educational game....What sets  my game apart from other shooters in the genre was that it was made with kids in mind but can be enjoyed by adults as well. This isn't a game you should worry about your kids playing. That being said, here's some other key features for Geometry Heroes:

1) Online leader boards

2) Over 8 playable characters. 5 bosses, and ten monsters

3) An intense boss rush mode

Download the alpha ( Shown in the Video) for free here : http://bit.ly/GeometryHeroes




What I Need & What You Get

I need you guys to help me push Geometry Heroes past the alpha stage, and make it as awesome as I can. That includes:
- Getting much better visuals
- Making some intense game music
- Porting the game to as many platforms as possible (Android, Windows 8, HTML 5, ios, etc..)
- Making more characters, Bosses, enemies, and more game features like upgrades for characters and potentially monster pets to help you in battle!

If I make:

less than 100: the game will get upgraded visuals, music, and maybe some of the other features, but will only be released on Windows 7 , 8, and Mac

100 to 250 : the game will get all mentioned features and a port to Android

250  to 500: the game will get all features, some unmentioned additional ones, and a port to android and ios

500 to 850: The game will get ported to Android, IOS, HTML5, Windows Phone, Ubuntu, and eventually Ps Vita and PS4

More than 850: everything mentioned above , and I'll release a series of detailed tutorials on how I created Geometry Heroes.


The Impact

As I mentioned before, part of making Geometry Heroes  was trying to make a game that can be enjoyed by all ages; a game where parents won't have to monitor their kids to ensure nothing bad is going on-screen that will affect them off-screen. Hopefully if Geometry Heroes is a success, it will inspire other smaller and or bigger studios to create games that we can all enjoy.



Risks & Challenges

Adapting the game for mobile could prove to be difficult and likely won't be done for some time, but during that time the desktop version will be updated often.

Other Ways  You Can Help

Tell your friends and family and spread this link around:

igg.me/at/geometryheroes

story:
Sounds Great, but What the Heck is Fungo Golf?


For those of you sitting their wondering what in the world is Fungo Golf? Pay close attention, I'm going to give you a crash course in Fungo 101:


Basically Fungo Golf is a mix up of both golf and baseball. It's played with the same structure as Golf, except this game is played on a baseball field, with a Fungo bat, and a baseball. Just like when you play golf, the object is to hit your ball into a hole with as few swings as possible. Well, in Fungo golf it's the same idea, but instead of hitting your ball with a club into a hole you have to hit your ball off of certain targets on the field with a fungo bat. Many baseball players who've had to sit through rain delays or has had time between double headers know exactly what Fungo golf is all about. 

Lets say hole #1 would be a sign on the outfield fence. The way you Tee off in this game is a little different than in traditional golf. In Fungo golf you have your bat in one hand, ball in the other and all you do is simply toss the ball up to yourself and swing away. Now from that point as long as you are close enough to the target, in this case the sign on the outfield fence. You have to "Putt" your ball just like in golf and try to hit your target. 


 Score is kept the same way as you would keep it in golf. So every time you swing and hit your ball its considered a stroke, and at the end of the game the player with the least amount of strokes wins the game. There are many different variations of how people play it, but this is how we do it!


 Check Out What We've Added Since The Launch! 



Here's our Players Bench, when the guys aren't on the field this is where you'll find them  



Here We Have Our Player Bio Cards. These cards give you the opportunity to really get to know each player


 

Once you've selected your player its then off to the Locker room. This is where you get to Customize your Character



Here we have our "Power Up" screen. Power ups are weapons you could use against your opponents to really throw them off their game!


                                

By earning coins in each game you can unlock some really cool Power ups!



 Here's a quick glimpse of just a few Power ups in action!


There's that pesky Gopher again! 



IS THAT A TORNADO!??



POOR LITTLE BIRDIE



My Story

 I am a recent graduate of William Paterson University in New Jersey, where I received a degree in Business management. I was also a four year starting pitcher for the Pioneers and an all-conference "Fungo Golfer". 

It was a little over a year ago, I had baseball practice on a Saturday morning. I got down to the field about an hour early, then a few minutes later, a few of my teammates showed up. I'm sitting there in the dugout and a few of the guys grabbed their fungos, and one by one started to tee off. As i'm sitting their watching them play, it hit me! I thought to myself this would be an awesome game to play against your friends right from your phone. 

So I put pencil to paper and started sketching out what was in my head. As I tweaked the design concept of what I had in my mind, I was also going around campus networking, trying to find someone to join my one man team. Every day I would go to the computer labs, the computer science department, the student center, and the arcade. I met some really cool people, but everyone that I spoke to didn't have the time to help with their work and school schedule, didn't have the skills, or just told me to "get lost, they were busy". 

That didn't stop me though, playing baseball my entire life I'm not one to give up on anything!!! Plan B - was to try to find someone to invest in this idea and have it designed, and developed professionally.  I first reached out to my college pitching coach Scott Farber. I figured if anybody would see what I was seeing it would be this guy. He was an All American ball player in college, and although we didn't always see eye to eye on the field, we both had an amazing respect for each other off the field.

It took me about 5 months to actually get to meet with him in person. This was after the season had ended, and every time I reached out to him he was always in the middle of something, or on vacation, but he did seem interested in hearing what I wanted to tell him. So I continued to develop my story boards in more detail, and continued to call him once a week. 

One morning I gave him a call, and he goes "James meet me in my office at 10:30". Without hesitation, I got in my car and drove out to meet him. He too dabbled in some Fungo Golf back in his day, so he knew exactly what I was talking about. He loved the idea, and agreed to help fund the development costs to take this from an idea into a product on the market. The next day I reached out to my development team and we started to build the game. I can not begin to thank him enough for believing not only in my idea but believing in me as well. Farbs once again you are the man!


Why come to Indiegogo?


Like I said before, I am a business guy, that's what I went to school for. Although I have a very creative mind, drawing and programming really aren't my strong suit. As of right now all of the work that has been done has been made "work-for-hire" and contracted out professionally. 

As you scroll down you will see hiring a designer and programmer to come up with the designs of new fields, characters, and actually taking that artwork and bringing it to life does not come cheap. And all of the start up funds I had, have all dried up. Which is why we need your help to continue development and really take this game to the next level!


OK Fair Enough, Lets Get Down to Business. Where's the money going?



Let me break it down into more detail so you know exactly where every dollar will be spent


  • $20,000 for IOS Development cost                                                                                 This includes development costs on both the Iphone and Ipad

  • $7,500 for new fields (Cost to design and program into the game)                         My goal is to get at least 5 new fields  ($1,500 per new field)                           $1,500 x 5 = $7,500

  • $7,500 for new characters (Cost to design and program into the game)            My goal is to get at least 10 new characters ($750 per new character)            $750 x 10 = $7,500

  • $4,000 for new power ups and new all new gear for player customization           (This means new hats, shirts, pants, hair styles, shoes, and new weapons)

  • $1,500 Chat Room in between innings where users can interact and see one another

  • $7,500 for our initial marketing and promotion

  • $2,000 for Indigogo's 4% processing fee

What if we exceed our goal, where is that money going to go?


Any additional funds we receive will be used to create more fields, characters, power ups, and design some awesome new gear the players can wear.
Some thing else I would like to do is donate 10% of all money raised after meeting our goal to an organization called Child's Play. Child's Play is a game industry charity dedicated to improving the lives of children with toys and games through a network of over 70 hospitals worldwide. 

Child's Play works in two ways - with the help of the hospital staff, they set up gift wish lists full of video games, toys, books, and other fun stuff for kids. With the help of donations they also purchase new  consoles, peripherals, and games for hospitals and therapy facilities. These donations allow children to interact with their peers, friends, and family, and  provide an awesome distraction from an otherwise unpleasant experience. We both share a similar mission and it would really mean a lot to me, to be able to help in some way.


Here are all of the rewards we are offering - Be part of the game


Make sure your getting THE BIGGEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!

      

You will get a virtual High Five from me



You will receive a personal video chat call from me, telling you how much I appreciate your contribution.



I will make a "Happy Dance" video of me, just for you. I'm sure you will get a kick out of it!


+ A virtual high five, and video chat from me

 


Your name will forever be memorialized on my website as a key contributor to the success of this game.


+ everything included in the $5, $10, and $25 reward teirs

 


You will receive a "Do you even Fungo bro?" T-shirt


+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game




You get to come up with a line to be said by the announcer or one of the players - As long as it is "G Rated" it will be approved and put into the game.


+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game



Haven't you always dreamt about having a field named after yourself?

 

Well here is your chance! By contributing $500 you get to have your very own ballpark names after yourself


+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game

 


You get to name a character of our choosing after yourself, and forever be part of the game.


This perk  includes coming up with your own player bio card.  (Nickname, short bio, bats R/L, etc.)


+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game



You will be able to name and come up with the design of your own character to be added into the game. Here you have the opportunity to forever be part of the game with the image you have come up with.


You also get to come up with your player bio card. (Nickname, short bio, bats R/L, etc.)


+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game




Name and create your own design for a new field to be added to the game.


+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game




This includes every reward we have to offer:


Name and design your own field


Create a character / write his or her player bio card / come up with their own "Go to saying"


A "Do you even Fungo Bro?" T-shirt


Website commemoration


Happy Dance video 


Video Chat


Virtual High - Five


More Q & A


What If We Don't Hit Our Goal?

We are setting up what's called a "Flexible Funding campaign". Meaning that if we do not meet our $50,000 goal, we still take in all of your contributions, the only thing is that Indigogo will tax us 9% instead of a 4% fee.  

Will You Still Deliver On Our Rewards?

Yes! Everything I have promised you guys will be delivered and I will try my very best to have it out in the time I have estimated. 

How Do You Plan To Recruit These Everyday Heros To Be Part Of The Game? 

Throughout my life I have made many connections - many of whom I plan to reach out to, to help open some doors to get my story out their to the people that can make a difference. I also plan to reach out to non-profit organizations and health care facilities with a passion similar to mine to help take this from an idea to a reality.


Will The Game Be Free or Paid?

Fungo Golf will always be Free! Although, there will be some In-app purchases in which users will have to pay for. Including new fields, and some bonus characters. 

Can I Claim More Than One Perk?

Yes of course! If you want to help out with more then one contribution, you are more than welcome to do so. All you do is select the other perk you want, and the process is all the same!

How Do I Know If My Contribution was Successful?

If your contribution is successful, an automatic confirmation email will be sent to the email address you provided during the contribution process.
Please note that your credit card or PayPal account will be charged the contribution amount immediately if your transaction was successful, not at the end of the campaign. If you paid via PayPal, you will receive another confirmation email from PayPal, in additional to the confirmation email you'll receive from Indiegogo.


Any successful contributions will also be recorded on your individual Indiegogo account. If you did not have an Indiegogo account when you made your contribution, an Indiegogo account was created for you after you submitted your email address during the contribution process. If you do not remember your password, or if you did not have a password set for you when you contributed to the campaign, click here to have a new temporary password sent to you:http://www.indiegogo.com/account/forgot_password. Be sure to use the email address that you used when you first contributed.


Risks

There is always a possibility that the game will be delayed due to technical problems, unforeseen circumstances or us wanting to polish the game more - but don't worry, I will dedicate every bone in my body to work on Fungo Golf so that you  will get to play the game as soon as possible.

Another risk is getting the rewards to you guys in the time I have estimated delivery. Depending on the amount of players and fields I have to develop and get into the game that could delay the process just a little bit, but don't worry I promise every reward will be delivered one way or the other!

I also have to manage the risk associated with recruiting the heroes that these children playing the game will want to interact with. But I have a plan to reach out to a wide range of current non-profit organizations, business organizations, local unions and other organizations to recruit a diverse set of everyday heroes and celebrities. 


Support Our Social Reach Campaign On "HeadTalker"


What is a Social Reach Campaign? No Money. Just a Social Share! Be Awesome and spread the word!


Even if you don't have any money to contribute you can still help! HeadTalker is a new website that allows people to join together in order to help get a positive message heard around the web. Rather than donating money to a campaign or fundraiser, all you have to donate is one Tweet, Facebook post, LinkedIn post, or Tumblr post on a specific day. By having everyone share this positive message at the same time and date, it allows for more people to see it while they are online. This allows for more awareness to be raised by having an organized social media sharing frenzy!

Here is the Link to our HeadTalker campaign, please check it out, and support!

https://headtalker.com/campaigns/fungo-golf/


Other Ways You Can Help


 If your are one of those people who doesn't like trying new things that perfectly fine but if you could please spread the word to any and all of your contacts, I would really appreciate it. Here are a few other ideas for you to help create some buzz:

  • Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo
  • Tell your friends

Thank you all so much!!

What if we exceed our goal, where is that money going to go?

Any additional funds we receive will be used to create more fields, characters, power ups, and design some awesome new gear the players can wear.
Some thing else I would like to do is donate 10% of all money raised after meeting our goal to an organization called Child's Play. Child's Play is a game industry charity dedicated to improving the lives of children with toys and games through a network of over 70 hospitals worldwide. 

Child's Play works in two ways - with the help of the hospital staff, they set up gift wish lists full of video games, toys, books, and other fun stuff for kids. With the help of donations they also purchase new  consoles, peripherals, and games for hospitals and therapy facilities. These donations allow children to interact with their peers, friends, and family, and  provide an awesome distraction from an otherwise unpleasant experience. We both share a similar mission and it would really mean a lot to me, to be able to help in some way.



Here are all of the rewards we are offering - Be part of the game
Make sure your getting THE BIGGEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!      




You will get a virtual High Five from me












You will receive a personal video chat call from me, telling you how much I appreciate your contribution.








I will make a "Happy Dance" video of me, just for you. I'm sure you will get a kick out of it!

+ A virtual high five, and video chat from me

 








Your name will forever be memorialized on my website as a key contributor to the success of this game.

+ everything included in the $5, $10, and $25 reward teirs
 






You will receive a "Do you even Fungo bro?" T-shirt

+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game










You get to come up with a line to be said by the announcer or one of the players - As long as it is "G Rated" it will be approved and put into the game.


+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game




Haven't you always dreamt about having a field named after yourself?
 
Well here is your chance! By contributing $500 you get to have your very own ballpark names after yourself

+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game

 






You get to name a character of our choosing after yourself, and forever be part of the game.

This perk  includes coming up with your own player bio card.  (Nickname, short bio, bats R/L, etc.)

+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game











You will be able to name and come up with the design of your own character to be added into the game. Here you have the opportunity to forever be part of the game with the image you have come up with.

You also get to come up with your player bio card. (Nickname, short bio, bats R/L, etc.)

+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game







Name and create your own design for a new field to be added to the game.

+ everything included in the $5, $10, $25 reward tiers, and you will also be commemorated on my website as a key contributor to the success this game








This includes every reward we have to offer:

Name and design your own field

Create a character / write his or her player bio card / come up with their own "Go to saying"

A "Do you even Fungo Bro?" T-shirt

Website commemoration

Happy Dance video 

Video Chat

Virtual High - Five








More Q & A


What If We Don't Hit Our Goal?
We are setting up what's called a "Flexible Funding campaign". Meaning that if we do not meet our $50,000 goal, we still take in all of your contributions, the only thing is that Indigogo will tax us 9% instead of a 4% fee.  Will You Still Deliver On Our Rewards?Yes! Everything I have promised you guys will be delivered and I will try my very best to have it out in the time I have estimated. How Do You Plan To Recruit These Everyday Heros To Be Part Of The Game? 
Throughout
my life I have made many connections - many of whom I plan to reach out to, to
help open some doors to get my story out their to the people that can make a
difference. I also plan to reach out to non-profit organizations and health
care facilities with a passion similar to mine to help take this from an idea
to a reality.
Will The Game Be Free or Paid?Fungo Golf will always be Free! Although, there will be some In-app purchases in which users will have to pay for. Including new fields, and some bonus characters. Can I Claim More Than One Perk?Yes of course! If you want to help out with more then one contribution, you are more than welcome to do so. All you do is select the other perk you want, and the process is all the same!How Do I Know If My Contribution was Successful?If your contribution is successful, an automatic confirmation email will be sent to the email address you provided during the contribution process.Please note that your credit card or PayPal account will be charged the contribution amount immediately if your transaction was successful, not at the end of the campaign. If you paid via PayPal, you will receive another confirmation email from PayPal, in additional to the confirmation email you'll receive from Indiegogo.Any successful contributions will also be recorded on your individual Indiegogo account. If you did not have an Indiegogo account when you made your contribution, an Indiegogo account was created for you after you submitted your email address during the contribution process. If you do not remember your password, or if you did not have a password set for you when you contributed to the campaign, click here to have a new temporary password sent to you:http://www.indiegogo.com/account/forgot_password. Be sure to use the email address that you used when you first contributed.

Risks

There is always a possibility that the game will be delayed due to technical problems, unforeseen circumstances or us wanting to polish the game more - but don't worry, I will dedicate every bone in my body to work on Fungo Golf so that you  will get to play the game as soon as possible.
Another risk is getting the rewards to you guys in the time I have estimated delivery. Depending on the amount of players and fields I have to develop and get into the game that could delay the process just a little bit, but don't worry I promise every reward will be delivered one way or the other!I also have to manage the risk associated with recruiting the heroes that these children playing the game will want to interact with. But I have a plan to reach out to a wide range of current non-profit organizations, business organizations, local unions and other organizations to recruit a diverse set of everyday heroes and celebrities. 


Support Our Social Reach Campaign On "HeadTalker"

What is a Social Reach Campaign? No Money. Just a Social Share! Be Awesome and spread the word!

Even if you don't have any money to contribute you can still help! HeadTalker is a new website that allows people to join together in order to help get a positive message heard around the web. Rather than donating money to a campaign or fundraiser, all you have to donate is one Tweet, Facebook post, LinkedIn post, or Tumblr post on a specific day. By having everyone share this positive message at the same time and date, it allows for more people to see it while they are online. This allows for more awareness to be raised by having an organized social media sharing frenzy!
Here is the Link to our HeadTalker campaign, please check it out, and support!
https://headtalker.com/campaigns/fungo-golf/


Other Ways You Can Help

 If your are one of those people who doesn't like trying new things that perfectly fine but if you could please spread the word to any and all of your contacts, I would really appreciate it. Here are a few other ideas for you to help create some buzz:

Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
Send a direct email from Indiegogo
Tell your friends

Thank you all so much!!

story:
Gaming Arts Media Expo
October 10, 11, 12, 2014
Springfield Expo Center • Springfield, MO

springfieldgame.com


$4000 STRETCH GOAL!

Custom Printed G.A.M.E. Set of Dice

We reach $4000 in the next 7 hours, and each contributor that donated $30 or more to this campaign, you will get a set of custom printed COLLECTABLE G.A.M.E. Dice!  Cool?


BOTTOMLESS CUP STRETCH GOAL!

During Year 6 we will have orange cups with the G.A.M.E. logo for sale.  The cups will be $3 and you can have free soda refills all weekend!  

WE REACHED THIS STRETCH GOAL!

To everyone that contributed $5 or more to the campaign.  You will receive a FREE Cup when you arrive at G.A.M.E.  This will be ONE per person, and one per BADGE with packages supported.  This cup will be refilled free all weekend long!


What is G.A.M.E.?

Gaming Arts Media Expo (aka G.A.M.E.) is a 3-day event held in Springfield, MO that celebrates all things geeky!  We gather at the Springfield Expo Center to play games, dress-up in costumes, learn new skills, discuss fandom, socialize with others of similar and new interest, watch movies and TV shows, listen to panelist, participate in demos, shop vendor booths, and more!

During this 3-day event, Eclectic Endeavors strives to show that the arts found in nerdy interest are just a legitimate as the arts found in mainstream society.  Painting, drawing, sculpting, writing, making movies, crafting props & costumes, digital artwork are all fine art pursuits that more and more are becoming recognized by the public as true art.  Shows on TV like “Face Off”, “Heroes of Cosplay” as well as launching platforms like San Diego ComicCon where major movies and TV shows are premiered and promoted – these show that geeky interest are becoming more public, mainstream and legitimate.

Why Support G.A.M.E.?

Without your support our events do not happen.  These activities like Picnic At The End of The Universe, Ozarks Adventure Quest, GAME Day at The Creamery and most importantly G.A.M.E. all require financial and volunteer support to take place.  We strive to make good memories for you with these events, and we cannot do that unless we have money to pay for stuff.

With the 4 events that we conduct, we seek to promote nerdy pride in Springfield and the surrounding communities.   We think that our community needs more events like ours.  In our eyes geek art is FINE art and we want to show that off.

How Does G.A.M.E. Raise Funds?

The group behind G.A.M.E. and our other events is known as Eclectic Endeavors.  This group is a dedicated set of men & women that meet frequently throughout the year.  This group goes out into the community and seeks out sponsorships from local business and philanthropist that want to help back our events.   We also conduct fund-raisers throughout the year.  The majority of our funds for events comes from individual attendees and the registration fees paid to attend G.A.M.E.

Each year our operating budget is $8,000 to $9,000 depending on what activities we’ve planned.  This money comes from sponsorships, fees for tables (artist, clubs & orbs), vendor booths and individual registrations.

A chunk of this budget (for 2014 it will be about $5,000) has to be generated BEFORE the event.  This means before the doors open on G.A.M.E. in October 2014, we have to raise over $5,000 in the form of sponsorships and registrations.  Our fund-raising efforts have to be supported by everyone wanting to see Year 6 happen.

Where Does the Money Go?

Eclectic Endeavors is a non-profit organization.  We are under the umbrella of the 501(3)(c) provided by the Springfield Regional Arts Council (SRAC).  All of our funding goes directly to paying for the expenses of the events we conduct.  None of the Eclectic Endeavors board members benefits financially from their participation in the organization.   It would be nice someday to have such a huge event that we could pay someone to work on it all year long, or at least compensate some of our folks for their time, but to date it is all volunteers, good-of-their-hear, for fun.

In years past for us to meet these expenses, we’ve often found ourselves putting our own money into the account until we get past G.A.M.E. in October and hope that once we pay the bills, we can pay back loans made by our generous board members.

For Year 6, 2014, our goal is to raise funds BEFORE they HAVE TO be paid and we can avoid making loans from our board’s personal finances.

In an average year our major expense are roughly:

  • $300 for Picnic At The End of The Universe
  • $100 for GAME Day at The Creamery
  • Over $3000 for the Expo Center Rental
  • About $600 for Event Insurance
  • $600 for accounting fees with the SRAC
  • The remaining budget is stuff like:
    • Printing Materials
    • Badges
    • Food / Concessions
    • and a load of various other sundry supplies

How Can You Help?

We could use your support in many ways.  Our primary need is for sponsorship.  You’ll find sponsor levels posted on the website.  We also need vendors, exhibitors, artist, clubs and organizations to all book booths and tables for Year 6.   We sell out of space for all these areas every year.  The sooner we have these spaces sold, the easier it is to meet our goals.

This fund-raiser on IndieGoGo, will be ESSENTIAL to our success for Year 6.  This goal will be a make-or-break benchmark for G.A.M.E. in October 2014.

You can also volunteer your time.  We need GMs to run games, Henchmen to staff various parts of G.A.M.E., panelist to conduct discussions, artist for the art show, and we can use all the promotional help you want to offer.  Put up posters, distribute fliers, share links on Facebook, email, wherever.  Talk about how YOU are going to these events and your friends will follow.

and a load of various other sundry supplies

We could use your support in many ways.  Our primary need is for sponsorship.  You’ll find sponsor levels posted on the website.  We also need vendors, exhibitors, artist, clubs and organizations to all book booths and tables for Year 6.   We sell out of space for all these areas every year.  The sooner we have these spaces sold, the easier it is to meet our goals.This fund-raiser on IndieGoGo, will be ESSENTIAL to our success for Year 6.  This goal will be a make-or-break benchmark for G.A.M.E. in October 2014.You can also volunteer your time.  We need GMs to run games, Henchmen to staff various parts of G.A.M.E., panelist to conduct discussions, artist for the art show, and we can use all the promotional help you want to offer.  Put up posters, distribute fliers, share links on Facebook, email, wherever.  Talk about how YOU are going to these events and your friends will follow.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Brenden and I am the owner of ThunderPig Hosted Services. 

We are a very small company with 40 very happy customers.  As it goes in the hosting business you need to make sure you have good hardware and fast connections,  but that comes at a cost.   To be able to do that I want to build out a server rack for ThunderPig's first colocation project.

This will involve renting rack space in a datacenter in Toronto, Canada. Then purchasing the hardware to fill that rack.   This rack will be the home of your perks after the build out is complete.

Now for a little bit about myself as I am sure you are wonder who will be building this all out.

I am a System and Network Administrator with over 7 years experience in the IT field living in Toronto, Canada.   I have actually been playing with computers since I was 4 years old when I first learned DOS on my own. I really do love to do this stuff :) I work all day on computer issues, and then to wind down my day, I come home and play in my computer lab.  

I have always dreamed of having my own company and my own rack in a datacenter,  it is like the ultimate nerd dream and I am hoping you can help make it possible with me.

What We Offer

Game Hosting for the following games.
Minecraft
Starbound
Counter Strike - Global Offensive
Counter Strike - Source
Killing Floor
Team Fortress 2
Left4Dead
Garry's Mod

Once we get the funding for this project we will setup up hosting for other games like.

Space Engineers
Left4Dead2
ARMA
Even try to get license for BattleField 4

What We Need

The Datacenter space will cost about 800 a month so we will project for 6 months

As for servers depending on the specs of said server they will run from 700 to 1000. Servers are one time cost

Rack -800 x 6 = $4800

Server - 900 x 5 = $4500

Total = $10,300

For this project I will ask for $10,000

The hardware will take time to order, and I will need time to setup the servers. The servers will be initially setup in my lab and tested there, this way we won't waste rack rental time. Once the servers are setup and ready, I will get the rack and move all the servers into the datacenter. Once there you will be contacted with your server info and login information.

How this is going to work

This project will run for 45 days, and I am hoping you will all be willing to help me see this dream come true.

Regardless of the amount of funding that I receive via this project, all perks UNDER $20 will be honored.

If we are able to get more then $3,000 in funding, I will honor all Perks.

if we make over $3,000 but under $10,000.  depend on the amount, I may be able to build out a smaller rack and host your perks from there, or I will use the money and rent a couple servers for 6 months and host your Perks via that method.  Either way, you will get your perks if we get over $3,000, I Promise :)

If you donate for a game server and we do not hit the $3,000 mark.  I will do my best to make sure you get your donation worth.  

ALL people that donate to the project will have their name put up on a "Thank you Supporter of ThunderPig" page, which will be put up on www.thunderpighs.ca shortly after the close of the funding project.

If we make it to the $10,000 mark and beyond, I will add in stretch goals and see if we can make them. 

These goals will be things like getting extra funds to purchase Fiber channel SAN for better and faster storage, getting more SSD storage for the servers, and so on.

Regular updates will be posted on the ThunderPig website.  I will make a new section that will contain pictures, updates, and videos of how the build is going.

I will also create a mailing list in which I will email out weekly updates to make sure you are all kept up to date on the project as the build progressing.


    Risks & Challenges

    I want to assure you, that if you donate to this project that I will make sure you get something out of your donation.  I would not feel right if you donated and I was not able to properly compensate you for being so kind to help out ThunderPig.  So the risk is very low to you, I am kind and friendly Canadian, that is true to his word.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you see this project, spread the word.  I want to create something that people will enjoy. Hosting games for those that love to play them.  I want to create a Hosting base that is kind and friendly, helpful and supportive. If you are able to contribute, that is great and I thank you from the bottom of my heart. If you can't, then spread the word, you will receive the same thanks for doing just that :)

    Cheers and thank you for taking the time to stop by.  :)
